Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Lifesciences Consultants is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Junior HR Data Analyst to join our Team. This role will focus on supporting HR operations and analytics, particularly in generating data reports and monitoring internal processes.




Key Responsibilities

- Data Reporting & Analysis: assist in preparing and maintaining HR data reports.

- Administrative Support: maintain HR databases and records, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.

- Collaboration: work closely with HR Team and Managers to gather data and support plans‚Äô development; provide status updates.

- Process Improvement: help streamline HR operations by identifying inefficiencies and recommending improvements.




Qualifications

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Economics or related field.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data management tools.

- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- High attention to detail and ability to work with sensitive information.

- Prior experience in the role is a plus.




What We Offer

- Opportunity for professional growth and development.

- A collaborative and supportive work environment.

- Exposure to diverse HR functions and hands-on experience.

HTML:
Legnano Teknoelectric Company Spa, azienda leader nel mercato internazionale della lavorazione di lamierino magnetico, per l'ampliamento dell'Ufficio IT, ricerca un/una Data Analyst che, inserito/a in un contesto dinamico e in forte crescita, prenda parte alle seguenti attivit√†:


  • Raccolta ed analisi dei dati;
  • Creazione di report con Power BI;
  • Interfaccia con i diversi uffici e reparti aziendali per tradurre le necessit√† e fornire soluzioni informatiche adeguate alle richieste;
  • Monitoraggio della performance dei sistemi;
  • Supporto ai colleghi senior per attivit√† legate al MES (Manufacturing Execution System) e ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) utilizzati in azienda e nelle plant produttive.


Requisiti:

  • Diploma tecnico o titolo similare (ITS);
  • Interesse per l‚Äôambito produttivo industriale;
  • Ottima conoscenza di SQL e Office 365;
  • Conoscenza Power BI;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Capacit√† analitiche e di ascolto.


Completano il profilo ideale una forte passione per il mondo IT, un‚Äôottima capacit√† di lavorare in team, flessibilit√† e capacit√† di intuizione.


Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: HR Data Analyst
HTML:
We believe in the highest standards. After all, the first step in ensuring high-quality services for our clients is to operate internally at the highest levels. KPMG Support professionals have the fundamental task of supporting the daily activities of colleagues in the Business, with dedication and proactivity.

For the strengthening of our People structure in Milan, we are looking for an HR Data Analyst professional who will be responsible for the following activities:

  • Create, develop, and update reporting systems for the Management;
  • Support the maintenance of data and oversee the accuracy of information in company systems;
  • Conduct analyses on the data available in the HR information system;
  • Contribute to the creation of interactive dashboards focused on personnel analysis to drive the overall human resources strategy;
  • Support HR processes with data and statistics.

To be the ideal candidate, you should possess:

  • Master's degree in economic disciplines;
  • 2-4 years of previous experience in the role;
  • Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite;
  • Good knowledge of the English language;
  • Passion and enthusiasm for HR issues, curiosity, and proactivity, flexible approach, and respect for deadlines.

Are you a problem solver who never loses sight of your goals? Can you build strong relationships and promote collaboration? You might be the person we are looking for!

KPMG is one of the leading networks of professional services, a leader in audit and accounting, management consulting, and tax, legal, and administrative services.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for people, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity. These are the values of KPMG that guide the behaviors of the people who work there, representing its identity and way of being, creating an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge that allows our professionals to express their full potential.

Our role is a prominent one in a context of continuous and rapid change, requiring a set of new skills and abilities to support growth ambitions and the trust the market places in us.

Driven by passion, we strive every day to promote inclusion and growth, fostering an environment where everyone feels they belong.

The requested data will be processed in absolute compliance with the provisions of European Regulation 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR" or "Privacy Regulation") and its subsequent amendments and integrations. For more information, please refer to KPMG's Privacy Policy.

KPMG Business Services ensures equal opportunities.

Title: Data Engineer & BI Specialist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer & BI Specialist that will work alongside a Business Data Manager and a Data Engineer to support the company in growing data management and analytics performance.




In this position, you will play a pivotal role in supporting different teams in analytics needs, driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will be the champion for our data strategy and will be dedicated to develop data pipelines, new data integration, creation of new measures and building powerful dashboards to support the business in their decisions.




Key Responsibilities:

Monitoring existing data pipelines across efficiency KPIs to proactively identify areas requiring maintenance
Collect issues and feedbacks reported by end-users and collaborate with team to solve it
Assetize data pipelines developed as to maximize re-usability
Identify innovative data ingestion and preparation techniques to optimize run-time and robustness of data pipeline
Ensure data Governance rules are enforced and proactively identify risk hindering compliant use of data
Calculate new metrics and develop ad hoc analysis to support the business needs
Design and develop dashboards using PowerBI to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into effective reporting solutions
Maintain documentation related to data management processes and ETL pipelines




The Ideal Candidate:

1-2 years of experience in a similar role
Master‚Äôs Degree Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science, Informatics or similar
Proficiency in using Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and reports
In-depth knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data analysis and manipulation
Experience with any cloud provider - Azure/AWS/GCP
Experience using DevOps, GitHub
Passion for new technologies
Experience in designing and implementing end-to-end data pipelines is a plus
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with non-technical stakeholders
Results-oriented with the ability to work independently and in a team
Interest in the consumer goods
Fluent English
... and of course a chocolate and gelato lover!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

Location: Milano, MI - Italy

Sul Nostro Team

Warner Music Italia √® un‚Äôorgogliosa record label che riconosce l‚Äôunicit√† di ogni artista e label partner. Siamo coraggiosi, creativi e ossessionati dalla musica, con la convinzione che ognuno di noi √® coinvolto nel rendere eccellenti i nostri artisti.

E tu?

Riporterai al Sales & Business Development Director e lavorerai trasversalmente tra Marketing Frontline, Catalogo e A&R per interpretare dati, fornire insights dettagliati e strategici per lo sviluppo del nostri progetti artistici.

Farai parte della struttura internazionale di Data Science e Data Analysis.

Sarai il collegamento tra i dati e i nostri stakeholder aziendali aiutandoci a costruire una cultura basata sui dati.

Ti Occuperai Di


Lavorare con i team artistici, commerciali e di marketing per fornire report, strumenti e analisi ad-hoc che supportino le diverse aree della nostra attivit√†
Fornire analisi approfondite, identificando strategie e opportunit√† commerciali, con un focus su azioni attuabili
Formare e supportare i colleghi sugli strumenti e le dashboard di dati
Raccogliere feedback e sintetizzare i requisiti per prioritizzare accuratamente le richieste e fornire risultati tempestivi ai team.


Il Tuo Contributo Speciale


Hai +5 anni di esperienza come data analyst, con un focus su insight attuabili e analisi creative
Ti senti a tuo agio nel creare una narrazione basata sui dati, con visualizzazioni efficaci e indicazioni attuabili
Sei esperto/a nell'interpretazione e nell'applicazione di modelli statistici in contesti reali
Hai dimostrato forti capacit√† analitiche e di problem-solving; √® apprezzato un portfolio di lavori rilevanti
Sei esperto/a in SQL e ti muovi con sicurezza nei database relazionali
Hai esperienza con almeno uno strumento di BI come Tableau, Looker o simili
Hai la capacit√† di sintetizzare dati provenienti da pi√π fonti
Ti piace essere un operatore indipendente, capace di pensiero critico e problem-solving, ma sai come sfruttare le risorse a disposizione per completare il lavoro
Sei costantemente curioso riguardo agli insight che si nascondono nei grandi set di dati e sei in grado di comunicarli a un pubblico non tecnico.
Hai conoscenza di base di Python e/o R


Sarebbe Una Figata Avere


Passione per la musica, con una buona conoscenza dell'attuale panorama del consumo musicale
Esperienza nel settore musicale


E invece noi?

Insieme, siamo Warner Music Group: Musica con Vision e Voce.

Non scoraggiarti se non ci senti subito. Ci stiamo prendendo il nostro tempo per esaminare tutti i curriculum e trovare le persone migliori per WMG.

Grazie per il tuo interesse a lavorare per WMG‚ù§Ô∏è. Ci piace tanto stare qui, e pensiamo che piacer√† anche a te.

Le ricerche indicano che spesso le donne non si candidano a una posizione se il loro CV non corrisponde perfettamente ai requisiti. Tuttavia, noi diamo pi√π importanza al talento che all'esperienza. Se il ruolo ti interessa e credi di poter dare il meglio di te con il tempo e un po‚Äô di formazione, non esitare a candidarti.

WMG √® impegnata per l'inclusione e la diversit√† in tutti gli aspetti del nostro business. Siamo orgogliosi di essere un luogo di lavoro con pari opportunit√† e valuteremo i candidati qualificati senza discriminazione di razza, credo religioso, colore, et√†, sesso, orientamento sessuale, genere, identit√† di genere, espressione di genere, origine nazionale, ascendenti, stato civile, condizione medica come definita dalla legge dello stato (caratteristiche genetiche o cancro), disabilit√† fisica o mentale, servizio militare o stato di veterano, gravidanza, parto e condizioni mediche correlate, informazioni genetiche o qualsiasi altra caratteristica protetta dalla legge federale, statale o locale applicabile.

Title: Business Technical Analyst
Description:
In Sky IT ‚Äì Digital Customer Product Line we want the Sky Customers to develop their relationship with Sky through our Digital Products, working to make them effective, performant, stable and engaging.

Thanks to your knowledge of the Digital Products, as a Business Technical Analyst (BTA) you will play a central role in the area being a technical/functional reference for the Agile Product Teams, the Business Analysts team and the Governance team.

The BTA area is primarily responsible for analyzing detailed solutions to facilitate and support the development team's work.

Solution analysis involves designing the APIs required for communication with third-party systems (middleware, CMS, ‚Ä¶) and, once exposed to clients, defining how these Digital Clients should use them.

The Business Technical Analyst will need to interact with both the development team and project functional stakeholders. Additionally, they will need to talk to Security and Architecture teams to design secure, scalable, and maintainable solutions. In some cases, it will also be necessary to talk directly to Business Stakeholders to formulate counterproposals and alternative solutions to the requirements.

As a BTA you will be part of an Agile Team, usually working in Scrum or Kanban to manage with flexibility customers needs. The BTA can often act as a Technical Lead in big complex projects.

Here are the main responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Analysis activities and documentation creation to support the Agile Development Team.

‚Ä¢ Help moderating negotiation and simplification of detailed requirements to fit both costs constraints and solution quality

‚Ä¢ Participation in high-level solution design discussions.

‚Ä¢ Support in identifying the best solutions, collaborating with Architects, other system representatives, Lead Engineers, etc.

‚Ä¢ Support for Functional Analysts and development teams during development.

‚Ä¢ Support for Quality Assurance (QA) during testing phases: SIT/UAT/E2E/trials.

‚Ä¢ Support for Project Managers, IT Business Partners (ITBP), and Delivery Managers of Agile Squads throughout the initiative's lifecycle and post rollout.

Required skills:

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical and synthesis skills.

‚Ä¢ Inclination and curiosity for innovation in the Digital & Integration field.

‚Ä¢ Flexibility and ability to embrace challenges.

‚Ä¢ Problem-solving skills and quick learning.

‚Ä¢ Good communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in the English language.

‚Ä¢ Ability to perform reverse engineering in code, both back-end and client-side.

‚Ä¢ Previous experience as a Software Engineer.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
ABB E-mobility Holding AG Are you a visionary leader with a passion for delivering exceptional services in the BI & Analytics domain? Join our dynamic team and drive the successful delivery of cutting-edge solutions that exceed customer expectations! As the Domain Owner, you are responsible for delivering the service(s) on time, within budget, and in line with the customer‚Äôs expectations. This role oversees the successful delivery of services across all service lines within the BI & Analytics Domain.

In This Role Your Main Accountabilities Will Be


Operations / Services / Delivery: Responsible for the end-to-end effective and efficient delivery of all valuable services in the BI & Analytics domain to the customer and consumer as assigned and requested.
Stakeholder Management: Leads the development of comprehensive stakeholder relationships with senior stakeholders, both internal and external.
Services Delivered: Takes full accountability for each service architecture in the domain, ensuring compliance, standards, and governance are defined and adhered to.
Continuous Improvement: Oversees and addresses operational domain risks and service-level related risks, working with the team to capture these risks and take corrective action.
Financial Management: Oversees the definition of costs and schedules in the domain, providing full cost transparency, and collaborating with IS business customers and Service Owners.


Requirements

To make the above work, we are looking for a senior professional who is an excellent communicator with the ability to explain complex solutions. Other essential requirements:


University degree in Business Administration, Business and Economics, Science of Statistics, Information Technology, or equivalent through experience.
Experience leading large and complex cross-functional projects in a multinational context.
Strong organizational planning skills. Strong teamwork and cooperation predisposition to develop and maintain good working relationships with business, functional, and technical teams.
Hands-on approach, multitasking, and self-adjustment capability. Highly motivated, with the ability to work effectively under pressure and meet deadlines.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


Preferred Skills


Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere and Microsoft Power BI.
Knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, data lakes and ETL processes.
Familiarity with programming languages such as SQL and Python.
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS and Azure
Understanding of business intelligence best practices, tools, and techniques.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

Work with the best specialists in their field, in a diverse environment with unparalleled global reach. Feel inspired by our fast growth. You will have the accountability to own your part in enabling a future of sustainable and efficient mobility. You can also count on a competitive compensation package in line with your capabilities and experience. Diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities are at the core of what we do. We celebrate different experiences and perspectives, and we aim to empower everyone in the creation of sustainable solutions for people all over the world. Our individual differences make us successful.‚ÄØ

About ABB E-Mobility‚ÄØ

ABB E-mobility is a world leader in EV charging technology and a partner of choice for the world‚Äôs biggest electric vehicle OEMs and nationwide EV charging network operators. With a strong R&D pipeline, our robust product portfolio of innovative holistic solutions ‚Äì from grid to charge point and domestic installations to large fleet depots ‚Äì means we are actively enabling the future of E-Mobility, not just predicting it.

Title: Web Data Analyst
Description:
üåüCHI SIAMO

Leroy Merlin √® parte del gruppo internazionale Adeo. La nostra missione √® aiutare gli abitanti a dare forma ai loro progetti di casa e di vita, con soluzioni utili ad impatto positivo. Contiamo su 8500 persone che lavorano in 52 punti vendita distribuiti su tutto il territorio e presso la sede centrale di Milano.

Leroy Merlin √® un datore di lavoro che rispetta le pari opportunit√†. Accogliamo con favore le candidature di tutti i membri della societ√† e crediamo che l'impiego di una forza lavoro diversificata sia fondamentale per il nostro successo.




üéÅCOSA OFFRIAMO

Sarai accolto, in un contesto dinamico e multinazionale, attento alle persone, dove √® possibile sviluppare nuove competenze, esprimere potenzialit√† e raggiungere obiettivi personali e professionali.

Beneficerai del nostro sistema premiante che √® orientato a valorizzare i risultati aziendali e di squadra.

Potrai contare su un network di colleghi e professionisti a livello locale e internazionale con cui confrontarti al fine di facilitare la diffusione di best practices.

  • Buoni pasto elettronici

  • Orario flessibile, in base alle esigenze di progetto e/o di servizio

  • Milano, FULL REMOTE

Title: Data Analyst, Intern
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.




To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.




For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.




A few examples of your responsibilities

Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.




What we look for

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.




Commitment & contract

Internship. Full-time.




Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.




Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.




The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.




Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Lifesciences Consultants is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Junior HR Data Analyst to join our Team. This role will focus on supporting HR operations and analytics, particularly in generating data reports and monitoring internal processes.




Key Responsibilities

- Data Reporting & Analysis: assist in preparing and maintaining HR data reports.

- Administrative Support: maintain HR databases and records, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.

- Collaboration: work closely with HR Team and Managers to gather data and support plans‚Äô development; provide status updates.

- Process Improvement: help streamline HR operations by identifying inefficiencies and recommending improvements.




Qualifications

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Economics or related field.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data management tools.

- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- High attention to detail and ability to work with sensitive information.

- Prior experience in the role is a plus.




What We Offer

- Opportunity for professional growth and development.

- A collaborative and supportive work environment.

- Exposure to diverse HR functions and hands-on experience.

Title: Supply Data Analyst - Internship
Description:
Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we‚Äôre changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do


Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.


About You


Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel; knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with programming languages such as Python.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with big data tools and technologies.

Title: Stage Business Intelligence
Description:
Societ√†

Banca Mediolanum spa

Posizione




Stage Business Intelligence




Responsabilit√† primarie

L‚Äôufficio Business Intelligence, parte dell‚ÄôUnit√† di supporto manageriale Market e Business Intelligence all'interno della Direzione Servizi di Investimento e Assicurativi, si occupa di fornire alle varie Direzioni della Banca, in modo approfondito e fattuale, analisi qualitative e quantitative sulle dinamiche aziendali in relazione ai prodotti, ai clienti ed ai relativi canali a supporto delle valutazioni di business e di offerta.

Siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire in stage nel team che, con competenza, precisione ed entusiasmo, possa contribuire a generare valore verso gli stakeholders interni ed affrontare al meglio le sfide che il contesto pone.

La risorsa lavorer√† con gli altri specialisti dell‚Äôufficio, ed in sinergia con le altre anime che compongono l‚ÄôUnit√†, a diretto riporto del responsabile di Business Intelligence ed avr√† il compito di utilizzare le informazioni ottenute dai dati per permettere di prendere decisioni consapevoli ed efficaci al fine di elaborare strategie utili al business.




Nello specifico, il/la tirocinante fornir√† supporto operativo alle seguenti attivit√†:

fornire alle varie funzioni aziendali indicazioni utili per una efficace ed efficiente comprensione del valore dei clienti attraverso analisi quali/quantitative sulle caratteristiche e le esigenze della Customer Base in relazione ai prodotti ed ai relativi canali;
comprendere i bisogni, tradurre le esigenze e le domande di business in approcci analitici solidi, efficaci e convincenti utilizzando differenti tecniche di analisi e visualizzazione dati;
comunicare in maniera efficace gli insight ai principali stakeholders, anche non analitici, in modo da supportarli nel processo decisionale;
creazione di report direzionali sulle dinamiche aziendali erogati attraverso il tool di BI adottato in azienda (Microsoft Power BI) in un‚Äôottica di self-service BI.




Profilo competenze

Requisiti

laurea magistrale in discipline economiche o statistiche;
ottima padronanza del linguaggio di programmazione SQL e di Microsoft PowerBI;
conoscenza di almeno un tool statistico/linguaggio di programmazione (p.e. R, Python);
completano il profilo un forte orientamento al risultato e agli obbiettivi aziendali, spirito di iniziativa e proattivit√†.

Sede di lavoro: Basiglio (MI). Smartworking settimanale.

I dati richiesti verranno trattati nell‚Äôassoluto rispetto delle disposizioni contenute nel Regolamento Europeo 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù o ‚ÄúNormativa Privacy‚Äù) e sue successive modificazioni ed integrazioni.

Gruppo Mediolanum si impegna a garantire la parit√† di trattamento a tutti i candidati secondo i principi di Diversity and Inclusion.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst

Location: Milano, MI - Italy

Sul Nostro Team

Warner Music Italia √® un‚Äôorgogliosa record label che riconosce l‚Äôunicit√† di ogni artista e label partner. Siamo coraggiosi, creativi e ossessionati dalla musica, con la convinzione che ognuno di noi √® coinvolto nel rendere eccellenti i nostri artisti.

E tu?

Riporterai al Sales & Business Development Director e lavorerai trasversalmente tra Marketing Frontline, Catalogo e A&R per interpretare dati, fornire insights dettagliati e strategici per lo sviluppo del nostri progetti artistici.

Farai parte della struttura internazionale di Data Science e Data Analysis.

Sarai il collegamento tra i dati e i nostri stakeholder aziendali aiutandoci a costruire una cultura basata sui dati.

Ti Occuperai Di


Lavorare con i team artistici, commerciali e di marketing per fornire report, strumenti e analisi ad-hoc che supportino le diverse aree della nostra attivit√†
Fornire analisi approfondite, identificando strategie e opportunit√† commerciali, con un focus su azioni attuabili
Formare e supportare i colleghi sugli strumenti e le dashboard di dati
Raccogliere feedback e sintetizzare i requisiti per prioritizzare accuratamente le richieste e fornire risultati tempestivi ai team.


Il Tuo Contributo Speciale


Hai +5 anni di esperienza come data analyst, con un focus su insight attuabili e analisi creative
Ti senti a tuo agio nel creare una narrazione basata sui dati, con visualizzazioni efficaci e indicazioni attuabili
Sei esperto/a nell'interpretazione e nell'applicazione di modelli statistici in contesti reali
Hai dimostrato forti capacit√† analitiche e di problem-solving; √® apprezzato un portfolio di lavori rilevanti
Sei esperto/a in SQL e ti muovi con sicurezza nei database relazionali
Hai esperienza con almeno uno strumento di BI come Tableau, Looker o simili
Hai la capacit√† di sintetizzare dati provenienti da pi√π fonti
Ti piace essere un operatore indipendente, capace di pensiero critico e problem-solving, ma sai come sfruttare le risorse a disposizione per completare il lavoro
Sei costantemente curioso riguardo agli insight che si nascondono nei grandi set di dati e sei in grado di comunicarli a un pubblico non tecnico.
Hai conoscenza di base di Python e/o R


Sarebbe Una Figata Avere


Passione per la musica, con una buona conoscenza dell'attuale panorama del consumo musicale
Esperienza nel settore musicale


E invece noi?

Insieme, siamo Warner Music Group: Musica con Vision e Voce.

Non scoraggiarti se non ci senti subito. Ci stiamo prendendo il nostro tempo per esaminare tutti i curriculum e trovare le persone migliori per WMG.

Grazie per il tuo interesse a lavorare per WMG‚ù§Ô∏è. Ci piace tanto stare qui, e pensiamo che piacer√† anche a te.

Le ricerche indicano che spesso le donne non si candidano a una posizione se il loro CV non corrisponde perfettamente ai requisiti. Tuttavia, noi diamo pi√π importanza al talento che all'esperienza. Se il ruolo ti interessa e credi di poter dare il meglio di te con il tempo e un po‚Äô di formazione, non esitare a candidarti.

WMG √® impegnata per l'inclusione e la diversit√† in tutti gli aspetti del nostro business. Siamo orgogliosi di essere un luogo di lavoro con pari opportunit√† e valuteremo i candidati qualificati senza discriminazione di razza, credo religioso, colore, et√†, sesso, orientamento sessuale, genere, identit√† di genere, espressione di genere, origine nazionale, ascendenti, stato civile, condizione medica come definita dalla legge dello stato (caratteristiche genetiche o cancro), disabilit√† fisica o mentale, servizio militare o stato di veterano, gravidanza, parto e condizioni mediche correlate, informazioni genetiche o qualsiasi altra caratteristica protetta dalla legge federale, statale o locale applicabile.

Warner Music Italia √® un‚Äôorgogliosa record label che riconosce l‚Äôunicit√† di ogni artista e label partner. Siamo coraggiosi, creativi e ossessionati dalla musica, con la convinzione che ognuno di noi √® coinvolto nel rendere eccellenti i nostri artisti.

E tu?

Riporterai al Sales & Business Development Director e lavorerai trasversalmente tra Marketing Frontline, Catalogo e A&R per interpretare dati, fornire insights dettagliati e strategici per lo sviluppo del nostri progetti artistici.

Farai parte della struttura internazionale di Data Science e Data Analysis.

Sarai il collegamento tra i dati e i nostri stakeholder aziendali aiutandoci a costruire una cultura basata sui dati.

Ti Occuperai Di

  • Lavorare con i team artistici, commerciali e di marketing per fornire report, strumenti e analisi ad-hoc che supportino le diverse aree della nostra attivit√†
  • Fornire analisi approfondite, identificando strategie e opportunit√† commerciali, con un focus su azioni attuabili
  • Formare e supportare i colleghi sugli strumenti e le dashboard di dati
  • Raccogliere feedback e sintetizzare i requisiti per prioritizzare accuratamente le richieste e fornire risultati tempestivi ai team.

Il Tuo Contributo Speciale

  • Hai +5 anni di esperienza come data analyst, con un focus su insight attuabili e analisi creative
  • Ti senti a tuo agio nel creare una narrazione basata sui dati, con visualizzazioni efficaci e indicazioni attuabili
  • Sei esperto/a nell'interpretazione e nell'applicazione di modelli statistici in contesti reali
  • Hai dimostrato forti capacit√† analitiche e di problem-solving; √® apprezzato un portfolio di lavori rilevanti
  • Sei esperto/a in SQL e ti muovi con sicurezza nei database relazionali
  • Hai esperienza con almeno uno strumento di BI come Tableau, Looker o simili
  • Hai la capacit√† di sintetizzare dati provenienti da pi√π fonti
  • Ti piace essere un operatore indipendente, capace di pensiero critico e problem-solving, ma sai come sfruttare le risorse a disposizione per completare il lavoro
  • Sei costantemente curioso riguardo agli insight che si nascondono nei grandi set di dati e sei in grado di comunicarli a un pubblico non tecnico.
  • Hai conoscenza di base di Python e/o R

Sarebbe Una Figata Avere

  • Passione per la musica, con una buona conoscenza dell'attuale panorama del consumo musicale
  • Esperienza nel settore musicale

E invece noi?

Insieme, siamo Warner Music Group: Musica con Vision e Voce.

Non scoraggiarti se non ci senti subito. Ci stiamo prendendo il nostro tempo per esaminare tutti i curriculum e trovare le persone migliori per WMG.

Grazie per il tuo interesse a lavorare per WMG‚ù§Ô∏è. Ci piace tanto stare qui, e pensiamo che piacer√† anche a te.

Le ricerche indicano che spesso le donne non si candidano a una posizione se il loro CV non corrisponde perfettamente ai requisiti. Tuttavia, noi diamo pi√π importanza al talento che all'esperienza. Se il ruolo ti interessa e credi di poter dare il meglio di te con il tempo e un po‚Äô di formazione, non esitare a candidarti.

WMG √® impegnata per l'inclusione e la diversit√† in tutti gli aspetti del nostro business. Siamo orgogliosi di essere un luogo di lavoro con pari opportunit√† e valuteremo i candidati qualificati senza discriminazione di razza, credo religioso, colore, et√†, sesso, orientamento sessuale, genere, identit√† di genere, espressione di genere, origine nazionale, ascendenti, stato civile, condizione medica come definita dalla legge dello stato (caratteristiche genetiche o cancro), disabilit√† fisica o mentale, servizio militare o stato di veterano, gravidanza, parto e condizioni mediche correlate, informazioni genetiche o qualsiasi altra caratteristica protetta dalla legge federale, statale o locale applicabile.

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Milan
Description:
About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to; the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources; the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model; the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Responsibilities

Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:

Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally; foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate
Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.


Our Ideal Candidate

Educated to degree level
Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
Familiarity with the Google stack
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
A confident presenter
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
Phone allowance
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
UnMind App subscription

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

Title: Data Analytics & Visualization Consultant - Milano [CNS]
Description:
Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Entra nella practice Technology Consulting di PwC e diventa:

Data Analytics & Visualization consultant

YOUR PERSPECTIVE

Farai parte del team focalizzato nella gestione di sfidanti progetti di Digital Transformation per i principali players in ambito Automotive & Industrial Manufacturing, consumer Markets, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Telco & Media attraverso la creazione di avanzate soluzioni di Business Intelligence, sfruttando tutte le tecnologie pi√π recenti.

Le Tue Attivit√† Saranno


Partecipare a progetti che coprono l'intero ciclo di vita del dato: raccolta dei requisiti, ETL, analisi dei dati e rappresentazione degli stessi attraverso l‚Äôutilizzo di tool di Data Visualization;
Strutturare la modellazione dei dati a supporto del processo di Data Preparation finalizzato alla Data Visualization;
Valutare la tecnologia pi√π adatta per i differenti contesti progettuali;
Effettuare studi di fattibilit√† e analisi comparative;
Utilizzare strumenti di Data Visualization


YOUR UNIQUE STRENGHTS


Sei laureato/a in una delle seguenti discipline: Informatica, Ingegneria, Economia, Matematica ed hai una forte passione per la tecnologia
Hai buona conoscenza di almeno uno dei principali tool di Data Visualization PowerBI, QlikView/QlikSense, Tableau.
Hai buone conoscenze nella struttura di un database relazionale
Conosci le principali tecniche di Data Modeling e di ETL ed i principali linguaggi di manipolazione dati (e.g. SQL, T-SQL, M, DAX, ecc.)
Hai una comprensione generale degli argomenti relativi alla Data Preparation
Hai un forte interesse verso le piattaforme di Business Intelligence, Data Analytics e Big Data
Costituisce titolo preferenziale possedere delle certificazioni in uno dei seguenti tool Microsoft Power BI, QlikView/QlikSense, Tableau

Title: Data Analyst (Stage)
Description:
Questa posizione √® nel team di Ewiva: cerchiamo le migliori opportunit√† sul web e le mostriamo sulla piattaforma Joinrs.




Ewiva √® una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilit√† elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.




Il futuro sostenibile √® oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralit√† climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.




Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.




Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuper√† di:




Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management

Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management




Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?




Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
Capacit√† di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
Orientamento al cliente
Capacit√† di sviluppare presentazioni

Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
Prima esperienza con Salesforce
Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
Inglese e italiano fluenti
Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia




Cosa ti offriamo?




Lo stage avr√† una durata di 6 mesi.
Sar√† previsto un rimborso mensile, rimborso dei pasti e la possibilit√† di lavorare in smart working.




Cosa aspetti a candidarti? Non vediamo l'ora di conoscerti!

Title: Real Estate Data Analyst
HTML:
Guber Banca √® una challenger bank innovativa, dinamica e in rapida crescita dove il digitale si fonde con il fattore umano. Nati oltre 30 anni fa come operatore specializzato nel credit management, dal 2018 siamo la prima banca italiana ad aver ricevuto ex novo l‚Äôautorizzazione dalla Banca Centrale Europea.

Il nostro approccio al mercato e la nostra capacit√† di adattarci alle pi√π diverse situazioni, ci ha permesso di crescere e di diventare una banca innovativa, moderna e solida.

Il nostro core business √® rappresentato da soluzioni sartoriali per supportare le imprese: dalla gestione di NPL e UTP si sono infatti affiancati nuovi business come, tra gli altri, operazioni finanziarie in special situation, acquisto di crediti erariali, factoring evoluto, advisory, due diligence e consulenza in ambito real estate.

La nostra vera forza risiede in un team composto da persone che, tra le sedi di Milano e Brescia, lavora insieme per costruire il futuro con grande entusiasmo e professionalit√†: ¬´Guber Banca: digital but human first¬ª.

Passione, innovazione, Flessibilit√† e Rispetto sono valori che rispecchiano il nostro modo di intendere il lavoro. Se ti piacciono le sfide, sei nel posto giusto!

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di una persona che possa supportare l‚Äôattivit√† interna alla Business Unit Real Estate, in particolar modo rispetto alla strutturazione e gestione dei modelli economico-finanziari e di aggregazione-sviluppo dei dati immobiliari derivanti dalle attivit√† proprie della BU e/o presenti nei tool aziendali.

Nello specifico, la persona si occuper√† delle seguenti attivit√†:

  • occuparsi della raccolta e analisi di un set predefinito di kpi aziendali/ finanziari in ottica performance management;
  • fornire feedback sistematici (qualitativi e quantitativi) alle BU per il miglioramento dell‚Äôefficienza operativa;
  • predisporre report periodici utili alla rappresentazione dei risultati della gestione immobiliare, a supporto anche delle interazioni con i differenti desk aziendali coinvolti nel processo;
  • predisporre materiale utile a supportare le decisioni di investimento oltre alla creazione e gestione di modelli statistico-finanziari;
  • contribuire nella fase di selezione e organizzazione dei servizi immobiliari volti a supportare l‚Äôattivit√† strategica della banca e dei clienti terzi;
  • collaborare con le altre figure della BU nell‚Äôanalisi dei risultati di portafoglio (trend e modelling) oltre a supportare l‚Äôimplementazione degli strumenti atti al monitoraggio dei portafogli/single asset gestiti.

Requisiti:

  • Laurea in discipline economiche o tecniche (Ingegneria Gestionale/Architettura/Ingegneria);
  • Esperienza pregressa di 1/2 anni in ruoli similari all‚Äôinterno di realt√† operanti in ambito NPL, istituti finanziari, societ√† di consulenza;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e Power Point;
  • buone capacit√† di organizzazione e flessibilit√†;
  • ottima capacit√† di analisi;
  • proattivit√† e capacit√† di lavorare in team.

Plus

  • costituir√† titolo preferenziale avere conseguito un master in ambito Real Estate.

Sede di lavoro: Milano

Altre informazioni:

Siamo convinti che la manifestazione dell‚Äôindividualit√† e creativit√† sia un acceleratore dell‚Äôinnovazione e, pertanto, un fattore decisivo per la crescita e la sostenibilit√† del Banca.

Guber Banca opera per favorire un‚Äôampia diffusione della cultura necessaria a garantire, all‚Äôinterno della propria organizzazione, un ambiente inclusivo che non discrimini per genere, et√†, diversa abilit√†, stato di salute, etnia, provenienza geografica, orientamento e identit√† sessuale o ideologie politiche e promuove questi valori per tutelare la massima espressione del potenziale del singolo quale elemento distintivo e funzionale alla crescita del Banca.

Title: JR Data Analyst - Data Warehouse Specialist e BI
Description:
QIBIT, divisione ICT di Gi Group S.p.A., Agenzia per il Lavoro (Aut. Min. 26/11/04 Prot. n. 1101-SG), √® specializzata nella selezione, formazione, inserimento e sviluppo professionale dei profili IT per il mercato italiano.

Per multinazionale fortemente strutturata e di respiro internazionale, leader nello sviluppo di servizi per il mercato del lavoro, caratterizzata da un ambiente stimolante e collaborativo, cerchiamo un/a:

Data Analyst - Data Warehouse Specialist e BI

La persona inserita verr√† introdotta nell'area di product management DWH/BI IT che ha il compito di recuperare, interrogare e aggregare i dati delle diverse business unit per ottenere informazioni e consentire il corretto monitoraggio dei processi aziendali e decisionali.

Sar√† responsabile delle seguenti attivit√†:


Progettare le corrette procedure di integrazione dei dati con i sistemi di origine, con il supporto degli IT Solution Architect e degli altri IT Products Owner coinvolti;
Definire e implementare rapporti e analisi di dati ed estrazioni di dati;
Collaborare con il team di architettura definendo e impostando le varie strutture di DataWareHouse
Collaborare con il team operativo per la manutenzione e l'evoluzione del DWH e B.I.;


Requisiti:


Laurea Magistrale in discipline STEM;
Ottima conoscenza di excel, SQL e DB relazionali;
Esperienza maturata in ambito DWH e BI;

Title: Global Retail Analysis Intern
Description:
THE COMPANY




KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics.




YOUR ROLE AT KIKO




We are looking for a Global Retail Analysis Intern to join KIKO MILANO‚Äôs Global Retail team, reporting to the Global Retail Analysis Senior Specialist.




Such talent will take active part in maintaining the existing analysis & reporting framework, while also supporting in the development of new formats to assess the 360¬∞ performance of our whole Direct Operated Stores network.




In particular, you will:

Learn and monitor everyday business KPIs trends, cooperating and interacting with main stakeholders (e.g. HQ functions, local Retail Directors, Area Managers) to deep dive performance insights and rationales;
Constantly update/fine tune current reporting and create new views in case of specific need (product launches, special focus etc), acting as analytic support for all members of the Global Retail Team;
Learn to interpretate and quickly translate data trends to concrete details about the stores‚Äô reality & needs, and how to support them in the best way;
Be the ambassador of a data-centered culture among both HQ and international colleagues;
Maintain the Store & Retail responsible mapping updated and be the go-to person for this & other operational tasks, interacting with team members from all nationalities with DOS stores;
Explore new KPIs and analytic concepts in an Omnichannel scenario, connecting different kinds of data to support concrete business decisions.







WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED




Degree/Master in Economy, Statistics and/or Data related studies
Good analytical skills, and the curiosity to look beyond numbers
A creative mind to give analysis an effective visual look, clear and scalable to all potential users
Passion for the beauty business and a strong interest for the retail industry (previous experience with Retail KPIs will be a plus)
Good knowledge of the Microsoft Office package (especially Excel), along Power BI or other analogue visualization tool; further data analyst skills/software knowledge will be a strong plus
Strong work fluency in English (other languages are more than welcome). We are a multi-language team and speak daily with our many Countries







WE WOULD LOVE IT IF YOU HAD




Ability to learn on the job
Problem-solving skills & detail-oriented
Highly collaborative style & willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams
Openness to a culture of continuous feedback
A creative side, keen on exploring new ideas to generate a positive impact
Love for numbers but also for multicultural and effective communication







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunit√† e dedica una particolare attenzione all‚Äôintegrazione delle persone con disabilit√† all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôazienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link http://recruiting-italy.kikocosmetics.com/info.pdf

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

We believe that clothes ‚Äî and how you make them ‚Äî can make a difference.

Since 1853, we‚Äôve been passionate about innovation to meet people‚Äôs needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn‚Äôt last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world ‚Äì supporting great brands, including Levi‚Äôs¬Æ, Dockers¬Æ and Denizen¬Æ. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Brussels for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

About The Job


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe‚Äôs business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of predictive modelling
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer


Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world‚Äôs number one denim brand
Great compensation


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

nanoGrid is at the forefront of energy monitoring and control solutions, providing innovative technologies to optimize energy consumption and enhance sustainability. We specialize in the collection and analysis of utilities data from thousands of meters across multiple sectors. Our data includes electricity, gas, water, solar production, and extensive metadata (square footage, weather conditions, degree days, etc.). We leverage this vast dataset to help businesses optimize energy usage, drive sustainability initiatives, and comply with reporting standards such as CSRD and ESG. Our cutting-edge systems empower businesses to manage their energy usage effectively, contributing to a smarter, greener world.




Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. As Data Analyst you will be responsible for working with a vast and continually growing dataset of utility meter readings (7,000 records per second). The primary goal is to transform this data into valuable insights for energy banchmarking, energy management, commercialization, and a variety of reporting standards, including CSRD and ESG. If you have a passion for data and a desire to make a real impact on energy consumption, we want to hear from you!




Responsibilities

Data Collection, Cleaning & Maintenance:

Manage and process large volumes of utility meter data, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Aggregate and align multiple data sources (electricity, gas, water, solar, etc.) with metadata like square meters and weather conditions.

Data Analysis & Benchmarking:

Analyze historical and real-time data to establish energy consumption benchmarks.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization across various utilities.

Reporting & Compliance:

Prepare and automate regular reports for internal and external stakeholders, focusing on energy management and operational efficiency.
Support compliance with sustainability frameworks, such as CSRD and ESG, by extracting and analyzing relevant data.

Commercialization & Predictive Analytics:

Develop and implement models to forecast energy usage and costs based on historical data.
Assist in identifying new opportunities to commercialize data insights through product offerings and consulting services.

Visualization & Communication:

Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., operations, sustainability, finance) to turn data into actionable business decisions.




Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, preferably in utilities, energy management, or a related field.
Hands-on experience working with large datasets, ideally in real-time data environments.
Proficient in SQL, Python, or other programming languages for data analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with statistical methods, predictive analytics, and machine learning techniques.
Strong problem-solving abilities with a detail-oriented mindset.
Excellent communication skills, able to present complex data in a clear and actionable manner.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.




Preferred

Experience in energy management or utilities sectors.
Familiarity with sustainability frameworks like ESG, CSRD, or other environmental reporting standards.
Experience with time-series data and real-time analytics.




What We Offer

Competitive salary and a wide range of extra-legal perks such as: meal vouchers, eco vouchers, health insurance, pension funds, 13th month, extra-legal time off...

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

A collaborative and innovative work environment.

The chance to make a tangible impact on sustainability and energy efficiency.

Flexibility with remote work options.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We‚Äôre open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶




Don‚Äôt let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst ‚Äì Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Show more
HTML:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst ‚Äì Insurance?


We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.


Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.



What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!


Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.


Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.


What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

  • Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
  • Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
  • Organize and structure data for analysis.


2. Data Analysis:

  • Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
  • Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
  • Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.


3. Data Visualization:

  • Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
  • Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
  • Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.


4. Reporting and Presentation:

  • Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
  • Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
  • Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.


5. Data-driven Decision Making:

  • Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.


6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

  • Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
  • Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
  • Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.


What do you need to bring?

  • Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
  • Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
  • Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
  • Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master‚Äôs degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My retail client within the fashion e-commerce sector in Brussels are looking for an experienced data analyst to join their team. The team work on a variety of business problems ranging from sales, supply chain and planning, so there is lots of scope to grow within the business!




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:




‚Ä¢ Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of GCP and BigQuery is a plus

‚Ä¢ Excellent Python skills

‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualisation is a plus




Salary Package:




‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

‚Ä¢ Travel allowance

‚Ä¢ Hybrid working and flexible working hours

‚Ä¢ Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

‚Ä¢ Meal vouchers.




You can reach me on the following:

Phone: +31203997864
