Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As a leading telecommunications and entertainment company with more than 7 million customer interactions and around 100 internal Telenet and BASE stores in Belgium and more than 1500 employees working in a customer-oriented function, Telenet has a very divers data availability across the entire organization (e.g. customer, product, interaction data).

Within the Customer Operations Steering Tribe (part of the larger Customer Operations Circle), we are looking for an ambitious Data Insights Analyst that feeds full-time one of our Operations Tribes with data and becomes a part of our Customer Operations Data Steering Team. There we will use data to support, challenge and inspire our Telenet, BASE & back-office customer operations colleagues with clear data-driven recommendations, actionable insights, and efficient self-service dashboards. An ideal candidate would act as a true sparring partner, challenger, and sound board for our (Senior) Leadership counterparty and be comfortable in regular interactions with our companies Leadership Team.

Key overall responsibility of our team is to cut through the noise and share the most critical data information for our Customer Operations Leadership in a tailor-made management level by combining back-ward and forward-looking facts and forecasts and enable leadership stakeholders to comprehend the bigger pictures. To complete this amazing team, we are looking for a Data Insights Analyst to support us.

Your Responsibilities As a Data Insights Analyst


Drives analysis of bigger data and insights topics and tracks across the 6 different Operations Tribes (Telenet, BASE, Back Office, Billing, Customer Innovation & Platform, Steering)
Understands the business question(s) and translate towards data requirements
Creates the necessary data queries to ensure the data is gathered in the most correct way to perform analysis
Translates data analysis in a visually attractive PowerPoint deck that have a high level of data storytelling
Presents your insights to the Operations management to ensure the full value of the analysis is captured


What We Have To Offer

You will be joining a company that invests fully in you and adapts your work environment optimally to what you need. This allows you to develop while taking care of your work-life balance. What else are we throwing into the fray?

You will have every opportunity to further develop your expertise. We stimulate your personal growth with internal mobility opportunities and extensive learning opportunities, but also give you the chance to press the pause button after a while or take a completely different path.

A varied job in which you achieve tangible results and make your mark.

A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with numerous benefits (ex. Homeworking policy, specific benefits such as meal vouchers, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, smartphone, company car, etc.).

The fine company of colleagues who are as passionate as you are.

Our Ideal Data Insights Analyst Has


Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (Business Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Sciences, Information Management‚Ä¶) or equivalent by experience
Looking for (non-starting) professionals and more experienced data experts with having Experience in Telecom, Entertainment, Consulting or similar industries is a plus
Clear track record in data analysis and be able to capture data yourself
Knowledge of a reporting tool is a plus
Strong acumen in quantitative analytics and structured problem solving
Results driven: able to coordinate an analytics initiative end to end from ideation through production and adoption and have an understanding of the life cycle of an analytics initiative and the common pitfalls.
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills and ability to influence decision makers
Dutch native (must) and English speaking

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
bpostgroup strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don‚Äôt believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a senior reporting analist who will make us move. ‚Äã

‚Äã

Your mission:

The Senior Reporting Analyst plays a key role in the follow-up and evaluation of bpost‚Äôs operational activities, by providing accurate up-to-date data in the form of dashboards, operational reports and end-to-end scorecards, thus enabling field teams to quickly take corrective actions where needed, helping performance controllers to keep budget and operations under control and providing business leaders the necessary foundation to take pertinent decisions for bpost‚Äôs roadmap.

Advanced knowledge is required both on backend IT systems to ensure smooth and reliable wrangling of data coming from massive data sources, as well as modern frontend reporting interfaces to present the data in a sleek, fit-for-use and fit-for-purpose jacket.

He/she will support, collaborate and build long lasting relationships with internal key stakeholders, continuously looking for and propose new ideas for potential improvements.

This role requires high organization and communication skills, the ability to work in teams or fly solo, and to manage multiple projects simultaneously. He/she should be able to continue to work meticulously under pressure at peak times, and be agile to work in an environment where change happens at a rapid pace.

‚Äã

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

‚Äã

¬∑ Understand business processes and assist the customer in finding the right solution for his problem

¬∑ Deliver quality analytic reports in timely fashion

¬∑ Familiarize oneself with the various data marts‚Äô contents

¬∑ Follow up data projects from A to Z as pm, starting from Business Requirements to the final result including after care.

¬∑ Develop and manage flexible data extract solutions that allow effortless and reliable continuity

¬∑ Maximize the automation of report generation

¬∑ Build reports in a standardized and harmonized way (share with other teams)

¬∑ Ensure data quality by adding consistency checks to the reports

¬∑ Participate in test & QA phases of new releases and propose measurement data sets

¬∑ Continue to develop and simplify the reporting process and increase its efficiency

¬∑ Identify & analyze recurring issues and propose solutions

¬∑ Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies at hand

¬∑ Be or become the Subject Matter Expert of a set of channels/products and act as SPOC within the team

¬∑ Present new reports to the relevant internal customers

‚Äã

‚ÄãYour profile:‚Äã‚Äã

We do not only deliver letters and parcels, but also opportunities. This job is open to all with diverse backgrounds and talents, possessing the following skills: ‚Äã

‚Äã

¬∑ A talented colleague with strong analytical and communication skills who picks things up quickly, has an eye for detail and likes to make things happen.

¬∑ You embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment and thrive well in a team environment, taking others along on your growth journey.

‚Äã

¬∑ You have 3-7 years‚Äô experience in analyzing business needs and translating them into clear reports, using mainstream and new data manipulation and reporting tools such as:

o MS Excel

o Visualisation (PowerBi)

o SAP Business Objects

o SQL

o ETL_Tool (Knime; Access)

HTML:
bpostgroup strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don‚Äôt believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a senior reporting analist who will make us move. ‚Äã

‚Äã

Your mission:

The Senior Reporting Analyst plays a key role in the follow-up and evaluation of bpost‚Äôs operational activities, by providing accurate up-to-date data in the form of dashboards, operational reports and end-to-end scorecards, thus enabling field teams to quickly take corrective actions where needed, helping performance controllers to keep budget and operations under control and providing business leaders the necessary foundation to take pertinent decisions for bpost‚Äôs roadmap.

Advanced knowledge is required both on backend IT systems to ensure smooth and reliable wrangling of data coming from massive data sources, as well as modern frontend reporting interfaces to present the data in a sleek, fit-for-use and fit-for-purpose jacket.

He/she will support, collaborate and build long lasting relationships with internal key stakeholders, continuously looking for and propose new ideas for potential improvements.

This role requires high organization and communication skills, the ability to work in teams or fly solo, and to manage multiple projects simultaneously. He/she should be able to continue to work meticulously under pressure at peak times, and be agile to work in an environment where change happens at a rapid pace.

‚Äã

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

‚Äã

¬∑ Understand business processes and assist the customer in finding the right solution for his problem

¬∑ Deliver quality analytic reports in timely fashion

¬∑ Familiarize oneself with the various data marts‚Äô contents

¬∑ Follow up data projects from A to Z as pm, starting from Business Requirements to the final result including after care.

¬∑ Develop and manage flexible data extract solutions that allow effortless and reliable continuity

¬∑ Maximize the automation of report generation

¬∑ Build reports in a standardized and harmonized way (share with other teams)

¬∑ Ensure data quality by adding consistency checks to the reports

¬∑ Participate in test & QA phases of new releases and propose measurement data sets

¬∑ Continue to develop and simplify the reporting process and increase its efficiency

¬∑ Identify & analyze recurring issues and propose solutions

¬∑ Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies at hand

¬∑ Be or become the Subject Matter Expert of a set of channels/products and act as SPOC within the team

¬∑ Present new reports to the relevant internal customers

‚Äã

‚ÄãYour profile:‚Äã‚Äã

We do not only deliver letters and parcels, but also opportunities. This job is open to all with diverse backgrounds and talents, possessing the following skills: ‚Äã

‚Äã

¬∑ A talented colleague with strong analytical and communication skills who picks things up quickly, has an eye for detail and likes to make things happen.

¬∑ You embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment and thrive well in a team environment, taking others along on your growth journey.

‚Äã

¬∑ You have 3-7 years‚Äô experience in analyzing business needs and translating them into clear reports, using mainstream and new data manipulation and reporting tools such as:

o MS Excel

o Visualisation (PowerBi)

o SAP Business Objects

o SQL

o ETL_Tool (Knime; Access)

o Programming languages (VBA; DAX; M; Perl)

¬∑ Expertise in similar tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, ‚Ä¶) is considered as an asset. Knowledge of other programming languages is considered as an asset as well (Python) even as experience in a logistics environment.

¬∑ You speak fluent Dutch or French and understand the other language, and have business knowledge of English.

‚Äã

Our offer: ‚Äã

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes: ‚Äã

¬∑ Competitive monthly salary‚Äã

¬∑ Meal vouchers‚Äã

¬∑ Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances‚Äã

¬∑ 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off ‚Äã

¬∑ An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay ‚Äã

¬∑ Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners‚Äã

bpostgroup is Belgium's leading postal operator and a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner globally. With a focus on social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world. As our newest team member you will: ‚Äã

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
You‚Äôll be part of the Strategy team, working closely with senior management and focusing on the business lines of Telenet, BASE, and Tadaam for both segments: a) residential and b) SOHO (small office home office).




Here are some key points about the role:

Your tasks as a Data & Insights Analyst

Identify & Prioritize Insights: Work with business unit‚Äôs facilitators and senior management to determine key insights and reporting needs.
Build & Communicate Dashboards: Create and share KPI dashboards that map business unit‚Äôs performance.
Recommend Improvements: Proactively suggest areas for performance enhancement.
Collaborate on Deep Dives: Work with Data & Insights specialists to synthesize complex insights into actionable recommendations.
Monitor Business Planning: Assist with budget and forecast updates, creating insights with business stakeholders.
Support Colleagues: Help business colleagues with self-service tools.




What we have to offer

Strategic Department: Gain a broad view of strategic projects and P&Ls.
Personal Development: Opportunities for internal mobility and extensive learning opportunities. Along with chance to press the pause button after a while or take another path.
Work-Life Balance: A supportive environment that adapts to your needs.
Financial incentives: A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, cell phone, option for a car, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, possibility to work from home,.).

It‚Äôs a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. Does this role align with what you‚Äôre looking for in your next career move?




Our ideal D&I Analyst has ‚Ä¶

Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a data or business analyst or similar roles
Master's degree in an economic, technical or economic field (Commercial Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Digital...) or similar experience
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills. We value different points of view.
Strong analytical & result oriented skills
Can naturally assume problem solving thinking and has great impact on decision makers
Knowledge and experience in telecom, media or consulting or similar industries is a plus




Apply? Good idea!

Fancy a job with content and variety? Become D&I Analyst at Telenet. Apply now!

Title: Data Mining Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Duration: 6 months with Extension

Languages: English




Description:

We are seeking a Process Mining enthusiast, passionate about using data-driven insights to help us achieve strategic goals.
The role involves creating persuasive insights to optimize processes with advanced process mining techniques.




Responsibilities include:

Developing predictive models;
Crafting value analysis;
Presenting them to internal stakeholders.




Skills:

Hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Econometrics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, or a closely related field.
Have hands-on experience in a dynamic role, specializing in data consulting and process mining.
Are driven by the possibilities of big data, predictive analytics, and process mining to create meaningful, continuous improvements.
Are fluent in English
Excel in SQL and you‚Äôre eager to apply your skills to make a real impact.
Have a prior experience with leading process mining tools like Celonis (preferably), Software AG Process Mining, or Minit is a plus.
Knowledge of Python is a plus.
Have worked in the telecom industry, with knowledge of the fiber ordering and provisioning processes is a plus.




Responsibilities:

Diving deep into large data sets to uncover opportunities and optimize business processes with advanced process mining.
Creating persuasive value cases and presenting them with confidence to our internal stakeholders.
Delivering real value by crafting predictive models that drive impactful outcomes.
Leading and inspiring cross-functional teams with key decision-takers and experts in the field.

Title: Deals Data Analyst
Description:
Line of Service

Advisory

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

Data Analytics

Management Level

Associate

Job Description & Summary

Leading with heart, living by values

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you‚Äôre reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you‚Äôll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you‚Äôll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that‚Äôs making a difference.

Are you passionate about Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) and the data that drives business decisions? Do you want to transform business data into meaningful insights? If so, PwC's Deal Analytics team is the place for you!

In the dynamic world of M&A, data is a vital source of value creation. However, many companies struggle to leverage it effectively. This is where PwC‚Äôs Deal Analytics team excels. We harness data to provide critical insights for buyers and sellers, enhancing their understanding of historical performance and uncovering new opportunities. As a data analyst, you will be at the heart of that, engaging in a wide array of tasks:

What you will learn and do


Execute on exciting projects:
Harness the power of data and analytics to create (or break) a compelling story around a target business;
Unlock value potential after a deal;
Liaise with clients, advisors and/or other PwC teams to provide robust, data-driven insights (e.g. into business and value drivers)
Work across the entire data-lifecycle:
Extract, transform and load (ETL) client and alternative data using a variety of tools;
Automate manual processes to boost efficiency.
Utilize tools like Alteryx, R, or Python to conduct complex analyses
Create insightful visualizations using e.g. Power BI
Help our Deals Analytics team to further grow:
Coordinate our intern(s) and/or remote teams;
Contribute to development of new services; by building Proof-of-Concept solutions using new technology and techniques;
Be a digital accelerator for the broader Deals practice


Who You Are, What You‚Äôre Like


Earned a degree in a technology-related program, mathematics, statistics, civil or business engineering.
Worked as a data analyst/ data scientist/data engineer or BI-consultant/developer in a similar consulting environment with at least 1 year of relevant experience.
Possess an analytical mind with strong business acumen.
Skilled in communicating complex analyses effectively to diverse audiences.
Fluency in English; ideally also in Dutch and/or French.
Knowledgeable in basic financial, accounting, and commercial principles.
Experience in working a range of data tools like:
Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or equivalent;
ETL-tools such as Alteryx or equivalent;
R, Python or other scripting tools (with advanced analytical capabilities);
Excel, Power Tools


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we‚Äôre proud of. Here‚Äôs a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.


Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.


Looking for a career where you‚Äôll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Engineering

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you‚Äôre at the right place.

Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you‚Äôre reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you‚Äôll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you‚Äôll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that‚Äôs making a difference.

We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analytics Consultant to join our Technology Consulting department as of September 2025.

Your impact

As a Data Consultant, you‚Äôll make an impact by:


Help clients by providing efficient data analysis to reach a better understanding of their business
Guide clients from strategy through execution when facing digital challenges
Leverage the value of enterprise knowledge and big data to help clients evolve towards insights-driven organisations by going through the whole ‚Äúdata‚Äù range: data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation and reporting
Enable business growth for our top tier clients and create unique experiences for their people and customer base
Use your knowledge and expertise to contribute to the success of our projects with and for our clients


About You


You have a bachelor‚Äôs or a master‚Äôs degree in business, data analytics, informatics, engineering or computer sciences, or any other relevant degree that showcases your capabilities
You have a strong interest in technologies and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French
You are creative and eager to solve challenging problems
You have an analytical mindset, a can-do attitude and great communication skills
You enjoy being client facing as from day one
You are eager to work in multi-disciplinary teams with consultants from various backgrounds, while also being able to work flexible and independently
You are keen to take on new challenges and to continuously learn
You are sociable and communicative, while embracing an inclusive environment
You are people-oriented and look forward to being part of an international family
You are looking for lifelong experience as well as a learning from failure culture


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we‚Äôre proud of. Here‚Äôs a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.


Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred: Master Degree - Data Analytics

Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

AI Systems, Business, Data Analytics, Data Science, Python (Programming Language), Structured Query Language (SQL)

Optional Skills

Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Dutch, English, French

Travel Requirements

Up to 20%

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

No

Government Clearance Required?

Yes

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
As a privately-owned European credit fund management firm, KARTESIA purpose is to help and support small and mid-cap corporate companies by providing them long-term liquidity and flexible credit solutions. Today, with ‚Ç¨6bn of assets under management in 4 credit strategies, we have become one of the leading European managers in the leveraged loans market. Our track record spans over 10 years of delivering top decile risk-adjusted returns.




We are seeking a detail oriented and proactive Sustainability Data Analyst Trainee to join our Sustainability team in Brussels.




Primary function & essential responsibilities will include:

Maintain Sustainability data integrity and supporting analytics (ESG KPIs, etc.)
Assist in the preparation of the annual reporting to our investors
Assist in the preparation of the annual reporting to the UN PRI
Assist in the preparation of the various SFDR reporting
Assist in the preparation of the annual sustainability report




Have a look! https://sustainability-report-2024.kartesia.com/Assistance with all other Sustainability matters (ESG due diligence, carbon footprint assessment, etc.)




Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs degree with a financial or sustainability connection
Fluent in English ‚Äì French is a +
Good financial and investment knowledge
Advanced MS Excel and Power Point skills
Demonstrable interest in investment and sustainability (including ESG risks, ESG due diligence and sustainability-linked regulations such as SFDR, TCFD, etc.)




Prior trainee experience in sustainability, ESG, banking, direct lending / private equity, strategy consulting, financial analysis / audit, compliance is a plus




Personal Attributes

High level of integrity and professionalism
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Self-motivated, results driven, with an inquisitive mind
Strong attention to detail
Good administrative, organizational and prioritization skills




Do you feel you can find yourself in this job posting?

So that this career opportunity sounds appealing to you then please contact our HR Director, Ariane van der Haegen via ariane.vanderHaegen@kartesia.com

Title: Data-Analyst Expert
Description:
Fujitsu is looking for a Data-Analyst Expert

Where? 1000 Bruxelles

When? 15/10/2024

#Man days : 65




Mission Context

Data Analyst

Business and data-analyst within the Market & Customer Analysis team
Plays a role in close collaboration with other team members and internal stakeholders in translating business needs into hypotheses which can be verified by using client data being available at BNPPF
Having a good knowledge of the business context combined with a strong analytical mind
Being critical (i.e. being able to translate the research needs into relevant hypotheses, covering relevant data variables, being able to focus on what's key in the outcome of the analysis)
Being able to grasp the relevant data (knowing which data is required, which variables, format, data sources,...) and to transform and analyze it in order to support business in their existing needs or client-data related questions




Function Description

Gather, transform and analyze rough data using sourcing techniques
Deliver business impact in order to improve customer approach
Deliver to-the-point stories in PowerPoint with key conclusions & recommendations based on data




Language Requirements

Dutch: Fluent => mandatory
French: Fluent => mandatory
English: Fluent => mandatory




Education

You have a Master‚Äôs degree in economics or a Master‚Äôs degree in another academic background with substantial knowledge and experience in data and analytics in a business context




Required Experience / Knowledge

You have at least 6 years of relevant experience in Data Analytics




Technical Experience

Mandatory

Data analysis is part of your DNA. You will work in SAS EG and SQL to capture and transform the data
Very good knowledge of Excel
Your data analytics tools knowledge doesn't impose any problems in setting up ad hoc queries, reports...
Being eager to get a grip on the most relevant data, to understand it well, and to analyze it in a way that answers business questions and sets relevant conclusions & recommendations




Preferable

Good knowledge of Power BI or Tableau is an asset




Business Experience

Mandatory

Good knowledge of bank & insurance products and sector




Soft Skills

Team player
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good communication and influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment, and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Customer-oriented
Critical
Flexibl




Do not hesitate to apply!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Onderneming




Deze Belgische onderneming gelegen te Grimbergen staat gekend om haar ruimtelijke economische projecten met betrekking tot duurzaamheid. Omwille van hun sterke dynamische groei zijn ze momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analyst om hun huidig hecht IT-Team te versterken.







Takenpakket




Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de data analyse van diverse interne projecten ter optimalisatie van de bedrijfsprocessen. Deze presenteer je aan de betrokken leidinggevenden door middel van informatieve dashboards en waardevolle gegevens. Je beheert het volledige gegevensproces, van het vastleggen en integreren van gegevens uit diverse bronnen tot het verrijken en koppelen van gegevens in het datawarehouse. Je publiceert dashboards met PowerBI en onderhoudt contact met interne gebruikers om hun behoeften en feedback te begrijpen.







Profiel




Je hebt een Bachelor of Master diploma in IT
Je hebt ervaring binnen PowerBI
Je bent sterk analytisch en communicatief ingesteld
Je bent innovatief en leergierig
Schoolverlaters welkom!







Aanbod




Elektrische bedrijfswagen met laadkaart
Nettovergoedingen
Maaltijd- en ecocheques
Groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering
CAO90 bonus
Gsm met abonnement
Flexible werkuren
Thuiswerk
32 vakantiedagen

Title: Data Analyst (ID:2308)
Description:
As a Data Analyst you will:


Develop and implement data management plans, policies, and practices to control, protect, and optimize the value of data assets.
Devise and implement master data management processes for specific subsets of data, ensuring consistency and quality.
Assess the integrity of data from multiple sources and provide advice on transforming data from one format to another.
Design, code, verify, test, and refactor moderately complex programs or scripts, adhering to agreed-upon standards and tools.
Investigate enterprise data requirements and plan data modelling and design activities with a focus on meeting assigned objectives.
Create and maintain data pipelines that connect data within and between applications, stores, and organizations, ensuring seamless data flow.


What You Bring to the Table:


A minimum of 2 years of post-related experience in data analysis, data science, or a similar role.
Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Python, R, or C#.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Grafana, or R Shiny to create clear, impactful visuals.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases such as SQL Server, enabling efficient data querying and management.
Strong understanding of data science techniques and methodologies, along with the ability to select, acquire, and integrate data for comprehensive analysis.
Proven track record in business intelligence reporting and analysis to aid decision-making and optimize operational processes.
Security clearance required to handle sensitive and classified data responsibly.


You Should Possess the Ability to:


Apply a range of data science techniques and specialized programming languages to solve complex problems.
Design, implement, and maintain complex data engineering solutions, including creating and maintaining data pipelines.
Collaborate with stakeholders to evaluate design options, obtain feedback, and ensure user experience aligns with operational needs.
Use non-standard business intelligence tools to provide insights and streamline data handling processes.
Apply a variety of data visualization techniques to design the content and appearance of data visuals efficiently.
Analyze evaluation data and make informed recommendations for user research and interface improvements.


What We Bring to the Table:


Opportunities to engage with advanced data science, analytics, and engineering challenges, helping to shape the future of data management.
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies, including Power BI, SQL Server, and Python for your data visualization and programming needs.
A collaborative work environment focused on continuous learning and skill development.
The opportunity to contribute to meaningful projects where your work directly impacts decision-making and business operations.

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years‚Äô experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you‚Äôll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with the world‚Äôs leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels.¬†

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

HTML:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years‚Äô experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you‚Äôll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with the world‚Äôs leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels. 
  • [Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
  • [Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
  • [Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
  • [Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
  • [Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
  • [Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
  • [Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
  • [Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
  • [Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
  • [Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
  • [Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
  • [Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203


If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you
  • As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
  • Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
  • Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
  • We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
  • A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
  • Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?
  1. Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
  2. Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
  4. Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
  5. Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
  6. Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
  7. Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
  8. Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
  9. Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end AI solutions based on the effective combination of Crowd+ML+Expert+Tech Platform. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages. We bring together labeling executors from all over the world to form our growing team of more than 200 people. Our team is globally distributed and works from several locations, including the Netherlands, Serbia, USA and other countries across the globe. Working at Toloka AI unlocks the door to being able to work on global projects and our commitment to personal and professional growth.


We need an experienced and energetic Data Analyst who will focus on ‚Äògetting the job done‚Äô and add knowledge, expertise, and experience to our team.


Responsibilities


  • Building a dataset quality assessment system;
  • Study supply-demand balance with a variety of roles of performers and a variety of requirements in projects;
  • Building metrics to define the processes of generating training data;
  • Search for opportunities of economic efficiency optimization.


Requirements


  • At least 4 years‚Äô experience as a data analyst;
  • Advanced SQL;
  • Product approach to business and metrics;
  • Excellent communication skills and fluency in English;
  • Able to work in a dynamic and growing environment;
  • Good teamwork skills.


Our Technology Stack


  • Azure Databricks (Python, SparkSQL)
  • Dbt
  • Tableau


What we can offer


  • Tasks that don‚Äôt yet have standard approaches in the market, here is an opportunity to get involved in tasks that practically did not exist a year ago;
  • Instant implementation of solutions, freedom from slow decision making;
  • Modern international business culture;
  • Customers who need analytics to make decisions, not to protect already made decisions;
  • A startup with ambitions to take a leading position in the growing Gen AI market.


Some of our key Benefits


  • Personal and career development: we support employee‚Äôs ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
  • Transportation expenses reimbursement;
  • Meal allowance for every working day in the office;
  • Contributions to personal pension plan.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Type: Full-time

Start date: 16/09/2024

Location: Brussels

Remote: Hybrid

What are we looking for?

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join the dynamic team at a leading company in the energy sector. The ideal candidate will possess a blend of technical expertise and strong interpersonal skills to effectively manage data within Downstream and Upstream activities, focusing on forecasting.

As a Data Analyst, you'll be responsible for:

Writing functional specifications, including PBIs, use cases, and process designs.
Writing and executing test cases to ensure the functionality and reliability of data systems.
Performing integration tests to ensure seamless data flow between systems.
Acting as the liaison between Business and Development teams to ensure alignment and clear communication.
Assisting the business during acceptance testing to validate that solutions meet business requirements.
Ensuring timely deliveries and adherence to project deadlines.
Monitoring production systems and performing maintenance as needed to ensure continuous operation.

Who are you?

As Data Analyst you are a data management expert, skilled in data warehousing, SQL, and functional database design. You have hands-on experience with Python scripting, APIs, and cloud services like AWS, and are comfortable working in fast-paced, multidisciplinary environments. You possess strong interpersonal skills, uphold high ethical standards, and have a good command of English. Additionally, you have knowledge of the energy market industry and experience with Agile methodologies and digital problem-solving initiatives.

How to Apply

Ready for a new challenge and eager to be part of a dynamic and growing team? For more information or to apply directly, please contact: Phone: +32 3 613 30 02 Email: f.maes(a)computerfutures.be

About us

Computer Futures is an international IT Staffing and Recruitment firm.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
C003731, Statement of Work Requirement Title:

Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Overview: We are seeking a skilled Business Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing data assets, developing data solutions, and providing insights to support key business functions. You‚Äôll work with various teams to design, implement, and optimize data processes, ensuring data integrity, accessibility, and usability. The ideal candidate has experience in data management, data science, business intelligence, and data visualization, with a focus on supporting operational and strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Management:


Develop and implement policies and practices to control, protect, and optimize data assets.
Design and manage master data management processes for specific data sets.
Assess the integrity of data from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Provide guidance on data transformation between formats and media.
Implement procedures to ensure data availability, integrity, and searchability through structured metadata and security measures.



Programming/Software Development:


Design, code, verify, test, document, and amend moderately complex programs or scripts.
Apply coding standards and tools to ensure high-quality, well-engineered results.
Monitor development progress, identify issues, and collaborate to propose practical solutions.
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback as necessary.



Data Modelling and Design:


Investigate complex and ambiguous enterprise data requirements.
Plan and execute data modeling activities, choosing appropriate techniques and levels of detail.
Provide guidance on the use of data structures and associated components.



Data Engineering:


Design, implement, and maintain complex data engineering solutions for data acquisition and preparation.
Create and maintain data pipelines that integrate data across systems, applications, and organizations.



Data Science:


Analyze problems and datasets to determine the feasibility of data science and analytics solutions.
Apply data science techniques and specialized programming languages to solve problems.
Ensure compliance with industry-specific rules and guidelines and anticipate risks.
Develop hypotheses, evaluate models, and advise on the effectiveness of specific techniques based on project results.
Contribute to the development, evaluation, and deployment of data science solutions.



Business Intelligence:


Support business intelligence needs for management, governance, or operational processes.
Investigate and apply business intelligence tools to provide insights for decision-making.
Identify opportunities to streamline operational data handling and optimize business intelligence processes.



Data Visualization:


Utilize a variety of visualization techniques to design and present data visuals.
Automate the production of data visuals for efficient reporting.
Experiment with and explore new visualization approaches to enhance data presentation.



User Experience Evaluation:


Evaluate design options to gather user feedback for system, product, or service development.
Test usability and accessibility, and analyze evaluation data to recommend improvements.
Ensure compliance with relevant standards and conduct usability assessments for benchmarks.



Requirements:


A relevant degree from a nationally recognized university and a minimum of 2 years of post-graduation experience. Alternatively, 6 years of progressive experience in a related role may compensate for the absence of a degree.
Demonstrable experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or in a similar role.
Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python, R, C#).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Grafana, or R Shiny.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases (e.g., SQL Server).
Experience with user experience KPIs and reporting.



Desirable Skills and Experience:


Previous experience working in an international environment, especially involving both military and civilian personnel.
Familiarity with NATO‚Äôs structure, responsibilities, and organizations, including ACO and ACT.



Training and Certifications:


ITIL Foundation, DevOps Foundation, or similar certifications that validate programming or software development skills.



This role offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, solving complex data challenges while supporting critical business processes through data-driven insights.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Data Management & Analytics
Description:
Capco ‚Äì The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let‚Äôs Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You‚Äôre serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you‚Äôre ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let‚Äôs Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Show Us What You‚Äôve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:


Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English


Professional experience is important. But it‚Äôs paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer


An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture


Show more

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Visualization Lead
Description:
As Stephen Few states: ‚ÄúWe are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.‚Äù Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

We are looking for a Data Visualization Lead to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

You create insights into data with dashboards and storytelling ,creating compelling user experiences. You're in business teams or liaising with them to build value together
You advise on solution architecture, hosting models, license and lifecycle evolutions, etc, for data visualization technology ( PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, ‚Ä¶)
You provide thought leadership in the BI landscape, and share and develop this knowledge with our customers and teams
You develop technical solutions, design operating models and service approaches for BI projects and teams
You lead, develop and coach the data visualization team by setting out the strategy, development plan and executing it
You build a rich international network in our global Insights & Data business lines and delivery centers




Knowledge & Experience

You are customer focused, eager to connect with Business users and build value together
You master multiple data visualization tools ( PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik) in terms of front-end (dashboard creation), and back-end ( data wrangling, performance optimization, security and integration into other IT tools) and bring practical experience as well as certification
You have a keen understanding of data modeling
You master SQL and Python for Data
Professional working proficiency in Dutch & English.
Proven Leadership skills, with ability to lead and nurture our clients needs as well as our consultants
Integrate and work in an international/multi-cultural environment, on variable-sized projects




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment‚Äîproblem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.

For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Show more
HTML:
As Stephen Few states: ‚ÄúWe are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.‚Äù Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

We are looking for a Data Visualization Lead to help our clients in their digital transformations.


Key tasks & activities

  • You create insights into data with dashboards and storytelling ,creating compelling user experiences. You're in business teams or liaising with them to build value together
  • You advise on solution architecture, hosting models, license and lifecycle evolutions, etc, for data visualization technology ( PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, ‚Ä¶)
  • You provide thought leadership in the BI landscape, and share and develop this knowledge with our customers and teams
  • You develop technical solutions, design operating models and service approaches for BI projects and teams
  • You lead, develop and coach the data visualization team by setting out the strategy, development plan and executing it
  • You build a rich international network in our global Insights & Data business lines and delivery centers


Knowledge & Experience

  • You are customer focused, eager to connect with Business users and build value together
  • You master multiple data visualization tools ( PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik) in terms of front-end (dashboard creation), and back-end ( data wrangling, performance optimization, security and integration into other IT tools) and bring practical experience as well as certification
  • You have a keen understanding of data modeling
  • You master SQL and Python for Data
  • Professional working proficiency in Dutch & English.
  • Proven Leadership skills, with ability to lead and nurture our clients needs as well as our consultants
  • Integrate and work in an international/multi-cultural environment, on variable-sized projects


#GetTheFutureYouWant


At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment‚Äîproblem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.


In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

  • A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
  • Meal & eco vouchers
  • Group & health insurance
  • Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
  • 32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
  • Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies


Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.

For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerci√´le data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerci√´le team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te defini√´ren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Cre√´er in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerci√´le sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pr√©.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en priv√©.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Position Title: Power BI Expert

Location: Brussels, Belgium

Duration: 6 months with possible extension

Languages: English

Remote: Hybrid







Job Description:

The Group Digital Capabilities (GDC) division contributes to Client competitiveness by delivering and supporting cost-effective client facing digital communication solutions. The domain covers the various areas of the customer journeys of user-interactive and STP communication flows (transactional flows, information flows, reporting, CRM). It also covers our Data & Analytics capabilities, Smart Automation and our Innovation Tribe.

Within GDC, you will join the Transversal Insights & Proficient Services (TDE) Tribe, and more specifically a team in charge of analysing and developing reporting needs for the division and the tribes.




The Role:

Analyse existing projects and financial reporting with the objective to transform, automate and make it more user-friendly
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective reporting solutions
You will identify the right balance between Cost and Quality/Completeness.
Design, develop, and implement interactive and visually appealing PowerBI dashboards.
Ensure a full testing for reports and dashboards.
Optimize reports for performance and ensure they meet user requirements.




Your profile:

Strong knowledge in PowerBI (Development, Data modelling & Business Analysis), Power app, Power Automate
Very Good knowledge of project tools and Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Power Query, Process, VBA)
ServiceNow knowledge
Good understanding of project life cycle (Agile and Waterfall methodology) and governance, project status reporting and project/program financials
Good analytical skills, Problem Solver and solution oriented
Fast learner, autonomous & pro-active
Empathic and easiness to understand stakeholders needs
Innovation & creative
Good written and verbal communication skills
English is a must
Show more
