  • English is a must

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote from Austria, Germany, Spain.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world‚Äôs leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We‚Äôre also a unicorn and have raised more than ‚Ç¨675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information
Show more

Title: Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Als Reporting & Data Analyst maak je deel uit van een dynamisch team dat zich focust op analyse en rapportering voor Indirecte Aankopen binnen Colruyt Group Technics. Jouw bijdrage speelt een belangrijke rol bij besluitvormingsprocessen en het bevorderen van de groei van het bedrijf. Een job met veel impact!




Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Als Reporting & Data Analyst binnen Colruyt Group Technics ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en rapporteren van gegevens die cruciaal zijn voor onze bedrijfsvoering. Hiervoor ontwikkel, onderhoud en optimaliseer je periodieke rapportages en dashboards met behulp van Power BI.
Je analyseert hierbij data om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken, maar ook knelpunten en verbeterpunten te vinden. Vanuit jouw inzichten doe je voorstellen voor datagedreven verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven.
Je werkt samen met verschillende interne stakeholders om hun noden en rapportagebehoeften te begrijpen en te vervullen.
Je schrijft werkmethodes uit, stelt gedetailleerde opleidingsmappen op ifv. de opgestelde rapporteringen en geeft trainingen aan medewerkers om hen te ondersteunen bij het gebruik van rapportages en data-analysetools.
Je werkt nauw samen met jouw team om gegevensgestuurde oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
Je waakt over de datakwaliteit binnen de verschillende systemen aan de hand van rapporteringen en draagt op die manier actief bij aan de continue verbetering van dataverzamelings- en analyseprocessen.

Je werkt in Halle en kunt tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Haasrode, Zwijnaarde, ‚Ä¶).




Profiel




Ervaring ‚Äì Je hebt minstens een bachelordiploma in een relevante studierichting zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde, ‚Ä¶ en ervaring met het werken in complexe spreadsheets in Excel. Basiskennis van SAP is een pluspunt.
Analytisch vermogen ‚Äì Je bent analytisch en kunt complexe informatie vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten zonder de details uit het oog te verliezen.
Teamplayer ‚Äì Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, je haalt energie uit samenwerken om de beste resultaten te halen.
Initiatief ‚Äì Je bent gedreven en pakt je werk zelf vast om op een effici√´nte manier je doel te bereiken. Zie je dat iets beter kan? Dan ga je daar mee aan de slag.
Communicatie - Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe gegevens eenvoudig uit te leggen.
Talenkennis ‚Äì Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Frans en kunt informatie vlot overbrengen aan je collega‚Äôs en stakeholders.




Wij bieden




Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
Opleidingen en leertrajecten ‚Äì Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen idee√´n en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Werkzekerheid ‚Äì Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid √©n een mooie toekomst!
Plezant werken ‚Äì Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.




Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Show more

  • Als Reporting & Data Analyst binnen Colruyt Group Technics ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en rapporteren van gegevens die cruciaal zijn voor onze bedrijfsvoering. Hiervoor ontwikkel, onderhoud en optimaliseer je periodieke rapportages en dashboards met behulp van Power BI.
  • Je analyseert hierbij data om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken, maar ook knelpunten en verbeterpunten te vinden. Vanuit jouw inzichten doe je voorstellen voor datagedreven verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven.
  • Je werkt samen met verschillende interne stakeholders om hun noden en rapportagebehoeften te begrijpen en te vervullen.
  • Je schrijft werkmethodes uit, stelt gedetailleerde opleidingsmappen op ifv. de opgestelde rapporteringen en geeft trainingen aan medewerkers om hen te ondersteunen bij het gebruik van rapportages en data-analysetools.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met jouw team om gegevensgestuurde oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
  • Je waakt over de datakwaliteit binnen de verschillende systemen aan de hand van rapporteringen en draagt op die manier actief bij aan de continue verbetering van dataverzamelings- en analyseprocessen.

Je werkt in Halle en kunt tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Haasrode, Zwijnaarde, ‚Ä¶).


Profiel


  • Ervaring ‚Äì Je hebt minstens een bachelordiploma in een relevante studierichting zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde, ‚Ä¶ en ervaring met het werken in complexe spreadsheets in Excel. Basiskennis van SAP is een pluspunt.
  • Analytisch vermogen ‚Äì Je bent analytisch en kunt complexe informatie vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten zonder de details uit het oog te verliezen.
  • Teamplayer ‚Äì Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, je haalt energie uit samenwerken om de beste resultaten te halen.
  • Initiatief ‚Äì Je bent gedreven en pakt je werk zelf vast om op een effici√´nte manier je doel te bereiken. Zie je dat iets beter kan? Dan ga je daar mee aan de slag.
  • Communicatie - Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe gegevens eenvoudig uit te leggen.
  • Talenkennis ‚Äì Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Frans en kunt informatie vlot overbrengen aan je collega‚Äôs en stakeholders.


Wij bieden


  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket ‚Äì Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
  • Opleidingen en leertrajecten ‚Äì Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
  • Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen idee√´n en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
  • Werkzekerheid ‚Äì Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid √©n een mooie toekomst!
  • Plezant werken ‚Äì Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.


  • Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Title: Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity who is analytical, communicative, and self-motivated to join us in our Ethics & Business Integrity (E&BI) team, based in our headquarters office in Brussels, Belgium or in our office in Atlanta, United States.

About The Role

You will be working in a team that designs the compliance monitoring program, including data analysis, research, data management, and reporting, with a goal of enabling the E&BI Team to make informed decisions based on empirical evidence, promoting ethics and business integrity within the organization. Your focus will be on designing data analytics approaches to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of monitoring approaches.

Who You‚Äôll Work With

You will collaborate with various E&BI teams, IT teams, and external partners/vendors to deliver comprehensive data insights and analytics supporting ethical practices and business integrity.

What You‚Äôll Do


Identify opportunities for data-informed reporting and analytics within E&BI.
Assess relevant data sources availability across the organization.
Develop data analytics models to generate insights related to ethics and business integrity.
Deploy and evaluate data analytics solutions and communicate results effectively ‚Ä¶.


Interested? For this role we‚Äôre looking for the following education, experience and skills


Excellent analytical skills for identifying trends and insights from data.
Experience with compliance monitoring approaches preferred.
Strong knowledge and interest in data (Data Visualization/BI Tools, Coding Languages & Tools).
Effective communication skills, including presentations and clear writing.
Ability to influence stakeholders to maximize the impact of ethics and integrity analytics.
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


Are you ready to ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don‚Äôt just complete tasks, we create value. We aren‚Äôt afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that‚Äôs on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST
Description:
Dark Light specializes in the temporary deployment of talented professionals for data and business intelligence projects. We are currently seeking a Business Data Analyst for one of our major clients, a key player in the Financial landscape.

Tasks


Ability to perform in-depth data analyses in a dynamic and complex environment
Ability to document and communicate analysis results with colleagues
Gather user needs, considering the requirements of the target system and the data present in the source systems
Assignments with both functional and technical aspects
Knowledge of private banking
Thorough knowledge of SQL
Proficiency in French and English
Team player
Good communication skills with IT colleagues and users



Requirements


1-4 years of experience (junior/medior)
Experience in the banking sector (understanding of the banking industry & CRM ‚Äì customer data)
SQL & Excel proficiency
Ability to communicate with technical profiles
Must be able to work independently



Benefits


Hybrid work
Freelance contract of one year (plus extensions)
Remuneration in line with experience

Title: Data Analyst (ID: 2267)
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will:


Take responsibility for the accessibility, retrievability, and security of specific subsets of data.
Assess the integrity of data from multiple sources, including data from sensors, measurement systems, or ticketing systems.
Maintain and implement information handling procedures.
Enable the availability, integrity, and searchability of information through the application of formal data structures and protection measures.
Manipulate specific data from information services to satisfy local or specific information needs.
Investigate enterprise data requirements and apply data analysis, data modeling, and quality assurance techniques to establish, modify, or maintain data structures and their associated components.
Provide advice and guidance to database designers and others using the data structures and associated components.
Utilize designated data analysis software to analyze data and write reports to support decision-making at the senior level.
Participate in projects to gather data for needs analysis, designing blueprints on how to structure, store, and utilize data.
Design, create, and test SQL reports using SSRS, Power BI, and Excel, and validate report functionality with internal staff/end users.
Design and develop ETL processes, data models, and data warehouses.


What You Bring to the Table:


A minimum of 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server, SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services), SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), and SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services).
Experience with data warehouse design and ETL processes.
Working experience with SharePoint (administration experience is desirable).
Competence and experience with programming languages such as C#, Python, or R.
Experience with dashboard development on Microsoft Power BI or similar reporting tools.
Familiarity with BMC ITSM/ITSM data.
ITIL v3 or higher certification.
Experience with the BMC Remedy Smart Reporting tool.


You Should Possess the Ability to:


Assess common problems and obstacles surrounding data gathering and customize data fields to meet client needs.
Interpret and explain the results of data-gathering initiatives.
Participate in software development processes by investigating data requirements.
Follow standards, processes, and methodologies to develop each phase of data architecture.
Detect and summarize patterns in data and produce reports.
Respond to users to troubleshoot and/or improve existing reports.


What We Bring to the Table:


Opportunities to work on cutting-edge data architecture and reporting projects.
A collaborative environment where your input and expertise will drive impactful decisions.
Support for professional development and IT certifications.

Title: Functional Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



ALTER SOLUTIONS is a consulting and technology expertise company founded in 2006. Our mission is to support our clients in their digital transformation challenges. Our services are structured around the following areas of expertise:


Software Delivery
Infrastructure & Cloud Computing
Agile IT Performance
Business Performance

Our success relies on the development and fulfillment of each employee, so we place great importance on providing the best possible working conditions:


Remote work available for a large part of our projects
A Flex Office work environment to promote communication and collaboration
Expert communities to share and disseminate skills within the group
Close project management and HR support
Annual training and certification opportunities
Recognition of our consultants' expertise paths
Strong openness to occasional or long-term international mobility
Intrapreneurship opportunities

Job Description:


We are currently looking for a Functional Data Analyst to work with one of our clients in the energy sector. The successful candidate will join the "Data" team, which manages data for both Downstream and Upstream activities, with a focus on Forecasting. In this role, you will be responsible for data management, ensuring high-performing forecasting processes, and bridging the gap between business and IT teams.


Key Responsibilities:


Write functional specifications (PBI, use cases, process design)
Develop and execute test cases, including integration testing
Serve as a liaison between business and development teams
Assist with business acceptance testing
Monitor production and perform maintenance
Ensure timely deliveries and adherence to deadlines


Qualifications



Required Skills and Experience:


Proven experience in Data Management
Knowledge of the energy market industry
Technical expertise in SQL and Python
Experience with API development and cloud environments (AWS)
Familiarity with tools like Databricks, PySpark, Insomnia, and Postman
Experience in functional database design and data warehousing

Additional Information: This project is focused on supporting and securing the business processes related to confirmed sales positions in gas and power markets. The service is carried out within the Downstream & Upstream Delivery Centers, with a focus on the LSS departments of Brussels but may extend to various European countries.


Languages:
English is required; proficiency in French is a strong plus.

Title: Data Mining Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a Process Mining enthusiast, passionate about using data-driven insights to help us achieve strategic goals. The role involves creating persuasive insights to optimize processes with advanced process mining techniques.

Responsibilities include developing predictive models, crafting value analysis, and presenting them to internal stakeholders.

You‚Ä¶

¬∑ Hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Econometrics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, or a closely related field.

¬∑ Have hands-on experience in a dynamic role, specializing in data consulting and/or process mining.

¬∑ Are driven by the possibilities of big data, predictive analytics, and process mining to create meaningful, continuous improvements.

¬∑ Are fluent in English

¬∑ Excel in SQL and you‚Äôre eager to apply your skills to make a real impact.

¬∑ Have a prior experience with leading process mining tools like Celonis (preferably), Software AG Process Mining, or Minit .

¬∑ Knowledge of Python is a plus.

¬∑ Have worked in the telecom industry, with knowledge of the fiber ordering and provisioning processes is a plus.

You will be‚Ä¶

¬∑ Diving deep into large data sets to uncover opportunities and optimize business processes with advanced process mining.

¬∑ Creating persuasive value cases and presenting them with confidence to our internal stakeholders.

¬∑ Delivering real value by crafting predictive models that drive impactful outcomes.

¬∑ Leading and inspiring cross-functional teams with key decision takers and experts in the field.

Title: Data Engineer & Analyst
Description:
At Univercells, we are on a mission to make health equally accessible to all. We work every day to reinvent biomanufacturing processes and develop or integrate the next innovative technologies. Through the combination of process development and engineering expertise, we create synergies to deliver game-changing production capacities to achieve our mission: ‚ÄúBiologics available and affordable to all!‚Äù




Within Univercells group, which provides global services to all UNVC affiliates, the IT & Digital department is looking for a full-time Data engineer & Analyst that will actively contribute to the development of the data platform project launched a year ago.

This project aims at building a centralized data lake based on data collected from all affiliates and business verticals (e.g., finance, sales, operations, HR) to provide actionable metrics and KPIs.

The data engineer & analyst will be responsible for the implementation of the data platform data model, the integration of the data platform with the enterprise solutions and the development of new dashboards / reports.

The role offers the possibility to work remotely for up to three days per week with the remaining days to be spent between our offices in Brussels and Jumet.




RESPONSIBILITIES




‚Ä¢ Participate in workshops with business teams to analyze business requirements and design data models to convert raw data into meaningful insights

‚Ä¢ Design and implement efficient and maintainable data integration flows with enterprise solutions (e.g., SAP, Hubspot, Mpleo, Sharepoint‚Ä¶)

‚Ä¢ Recommend the optimal way to import data from different data sources (internal and external)

‚Ä¢ Be able to execute data discovery on client data sets. Identify data characteristics and adjust ETL and database design accordingly

‚Ä¢ Extend and improve our data platform data framework

‚Ä¢ Build automated reports and dashboards within Power BI cross affiliates

‚Ä¢ Build documentation on new dashboards, KPIs specs and data model updates




REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS




‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer engineering, computer science or related fields

‚Ä¢ 3 years of relevant experience in a similar role with working experience in database, ETL design and development

‚Ä¢ Expert in Microsoft Azure suite (Synapse workspace (DB, Pipelines‚Ä¶), DevOps, Storage accounts‚Ä¶) with experience in data integration for on-premises systems and cloud implementation

‚Ä¢ Expert in SQL

‚Ä¢ Programming experience with following language: Python or C# is a plus

‚Ä¢ Expert in Power BI dashboards development & design

‚Ä¢ Experience in writing technical documents, ETL specifications and data validation procedures

‚Ä¢ Advanced Analytical skills and quantitative awareness




ADDITIONAL COMPETENCIES




‚Ä¢ Microsoft certifications in Azure technologies is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, French is a plus

‚Ä¢ High degree of autonomy, rigorous and structured

‚Ä¢ Team player with strong communication skills and with a collaborative spirit







OUR OFFER




We offer a long-term contract (CDI), a competitive salary package including many interesting compensations and benefits(including the possibility to do regular homeworking), ad-hoc training to develop hard and soft skills, and the possibility of evolution in an international, dynamic, and fast-growing company.




Is this function of Data engineer & Analyst appealing to you? Do you want to work in a great and motivated team? Let‚Äôs meet! Apply!.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
VIATRIS BV

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access ‚Äì Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership ‚Äì Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership ‚Äì Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here‚Äôs how the Business Data Analyst role will make an impact:

Key Responsibilities for This Role Include:

Enhancing the advancement of CRM systems through the integration of AI technologies, the Business Data Analyst will support strategic decision-making by leveraging advanced data analytics, predictive models, and machine learning, ultimately enhancing business intelligence and operational efficiency.


Implement and integrate new versions and functionalities of existing CRM systems, in collaboration with Regional and Global teams, to bring system capabilities to the next level.
Manage and optimise the existing CRM systems to ensure accurate and up-to-date customer data.
Ensure that data management procedures are up-to-date and provide end-users training on CRM functionalities.
Analyse large and complex datasets using AI techniques to identify patterns and deliver insights for strategic decision-making.
Develop and implement predictive models, machine learning algorithms, and AI-driven statistical analyses to support the transformation of business operations.
Perform regular data audits to identify and rectify inaccuracies or inconsistencies, ensuring higher data quality.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to communicate insights and performance metrics to internal stakeholders.



The minimum qualifications for this role are:


Master‚Äôs degree in Business Management, Marketing, Data Science or a related field.
Minimum 3-5 years experience in supporting the business goals and needs.
Fluent in FR and/or NL, with strong EN capabilities
In-depth knowledge of CRM systems (Salesforce, Veeva)
Good understanding of programming languages (Python, R, Java, or others)
Experience with Power BI
Experience in data management and model development
Strong business acumen and capability to translate business requirements into data modelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.



At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.

We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.

Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.

The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:


Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.


Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.

The program

Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO‚Äôs principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.

Role Duties And Responsibilities

Data management - Developing and implementing plans, policies, and practices that control, protect and optimise the value of data assets.


Devises and implements master data management processes for specific subsets of data.
Assesses the integrity of data from multiple sources.
Provides advice on the transformation of data from one format/medium to another.
Maintains and implements information handling procedures.
Enables the availability, integrity and searchability of information through the application of formal data and metadata structures and protection measures.


Programming/software development


Designs, codes, verifies, tests, documents, amends and refactors moderately complex programs/scripts.
Applies agreed standards and tools to achieve a well- engineered result.
Monitors and reports on progress.
Identifies issues related to software development activities.
Proposes practical solutions to resolve issues.
Collaborates in reviews of work with others as appropriate.


Data modelling and design


Investigates enterprise data requirements where there is some complexity and ambiguity.
Plans own data modelling and design activities, selecting appropriate techniques and the correct level of detail for meeting assigned objectives.
Provides advice and guidance to others using the data structures and associated components.


Data engineering


Designs, implements, and maintains complex data engineering solutions to acquire and prepare data.
Creates and maintains data pipelines to connect data within and between data stores, applications and organisations.


Data science


Investigates the described problem and dataset to assess the usefulness of data science and analytics solutions.
Applies a range of data science techniques and uses specialized programming languages.
Understands and applies rules and guidelines specific to the industry, and anticipates risks and other implications of modelling.
Selects, acquires and integrates data for analysis.
Develops data hypotheses and methods and evaluates analytics models.
Advises on the effectiveness of specific techniques based on project findings and comprehensive research.
Contributes to the development, evaluation, monitoring and deployment of data science solutions.


Business intelligence


Supports business intelligence needs of specific management or governance processes or operational areas.
Investigates the need for business intelligence reporting and analysis where there is some complexity and ambiguity.
Selects and applies non-standard business intelligence tools and techniques to provide insights and aid decision-making.
Selects, acquires and integrates data for analysis.
Identifies opportunities to digitise and streamline operational data handling and optimise business intelligence capabilities.


Data visualisation


Applies a variety of visualisation techniques and designs the content and appearance of data visuals.
Operationalises and automates activities for efficient and timely production of data visuals.
Selects appropriate visualisation approaches from a range of applicable options.
Contributes to exploration and experimentation in data visualisation.


User experience evaluation


Evaluates design options and prototypes to obtain user feedback on requirements of developing systems, products, services or devices.
Tests the usability and accessibility of components and alternative designs.
Administers a range of evaluations, recording data and feedback.
Analyses evaluation data and recommends actions.
Identifies areas for future user research.
Checks systems, products, services or devices for adherence to applicable standards, guidelines, style guides, and legislation.
Evaluates the usability of existing or competitor systems to provide benchmark values and as input to design.


Essential Skills And Experience


Demonstrable experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role, or experience performing these functions roles as part of another job.
Demonstrable experience with at least one programming language, such as Python, R, or C#.
Experience with commercially available or open source data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Grafana or R Shiny.
Experience with SQL and relational databases, such as SQL Server.
Experience with user experience KPIs and reporting.


Desirable Skills And Experience


Prior experience of working in an international environment comprising both military and civilian elements;
Knowledge of NATO responsibilities and organization, including ACO and ACT.


Training & Certifications


ITIL Foundation, DevOps Foundation and certifications proving the competency level in programming/software development skills


Education


A minimum requirement of a relevant degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a related discipline and 2 years post-related experience, or exceptionally, the lack of a university degree may be compensated by the demonstration of a candidate's particular abilities or experience that is/are of interest to NCI Agency, that is, at least 6 years extensive and progressive expertise in duties related to the function of the post.


Working Location


Braine l‚ÄôAlleud, Belgium


Working Policy


On-Site


Travel


Some travel to other NATO sites may be required


Security Clearance


Valid National or NATO Cosmic Top Secret personal security clearance


We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.
Show more

  • Contributes to the development, evaluation, monitoring and deployment of data science solutions.

Business intelligence

  • Supports business intelligence needs of specific management or governance processes or operational areas.
  • Investigates the need for business intelligence reporting and analysis where there is some complexity and ambiguity.
  • Selects and applies non-standard business intelligence tools and techniques to provide insights and aid decision-making.
  • Selects, acquires and integrates data for analysis.
  • Identifies opportunities to digitise and streamline operational data handling and optimise business intelligence capabilities.

Data visualisation

  • Applies a variety of visualisation techniques and designs the content and appearance of data visuals.
  • Operationalises and automates activities for efficient and timely production of data visuals.
  • Selects appropriate visualisation approaches from a range of applicable options.
  • Contributes to exploration and experimentation in data visualisation.

User experience evaluation

  • Evaluates design options and prototypes to obtain user feedback on requirements of developing systems, products, services or devices.
  • Tests the usability and accessibility of components and alternative designs.
  • Administers a range of evaluations, recording data and feedback.
  • Analyses evaluation data and recommends actions.
  • Identifies areas for future user research.
  • Checks systems, products, services or devices for adherence to applicable standards, guidelines, style guides, and legislation.
  • Evaluates the usability of existing or competitor systems to provide benchmark values and as input to design.

Essential Skills And Experience

  • Demonstrable experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role, or experience performing these functions roles as part of another job.
  • Demonstrable experience with at least one programming language, such as Python, R, or C#.
  • Experience with commercially available or open source data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Grafana or R Shiny.
  • Experience with SQL and relational databases, such as SQL Server.
  • Experience with user experience KPIs and reporting.

Desirable Skills And Experience

  • Prior experience of working in an international environment comprising both military and civilian elements;
  • Knowledge of NATO responsibilities and organization, including ACO and ACT.

Training & Certifications

  • ITIL Foundation, DevOps Foundation and certifications proving the competency level in programming/software development skills

Education

  • A minimum requirement of a relevant degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a related discipline and 2 years post-related experience, or exceptionally, the lack of a university degree may be compensated by the demonstration of a candidate's particular abilities or experience that is/are of interest to NCI Agency, that is, at least 6 years extensive and progressive expertise in duties related to the function of the post.

Working Location

  • Braine l‚ÄôAlleud, Belgium

Working Policy

  • On-Site

Travel

  • Some travel to other NATO sites may be required

Security Clearance

  • Valid National or NATO Cosmic Top Secret personal security clearance

We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
Join Our Team as a Power BI Expert!

Are you passionate about data visualization and business intelligence? We're looking for a talented and experienced Power BI Expert to join one of our clients and play a crucial role in transforming their data into actionable insights and improving system efficiency.

Your Role:

As a Power BI Expert, you will leverage your deep expertise in Power BI and data visualization to design, implement, and optimize business intelligence solutions. Your role will be pivotal in ensuring seamless integration of data sources, creating interactive dashboards, and enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization.

What You‚Äôll Do:

Design and develop Power BI dashboards and reports.
Implement data models and ensure efficient data flows.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and transform them into visual insights.
Optimize Power BI solutions for performance and scalability.

Interested?

Send your resume to h.mehta@vertexagility.com or reach out directly via phone at +443333073261. This is an exciting opportunity for professionals specializing in Power BI and data analytics that you wouldn‚Äôt want to miss!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
bpostgroup strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don‚Äôt believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a senior reporting analist who will make us move. ‚Äã

‚Äã

Your mission:

The Senior Reporting Analyst plays a key role in the follow-up and evaluation of bpost‚Äôs operational activities, by providing accurate up-to-date data in the form of dashboards, operational reports and end-to-end scorecards, thus enabling field teams to quickly take corrective actions where needed, helping performance controllers to keep budget and operations under control and providing business leaders the necessary foundation to take pertinent decisions for bpost‚Äôs roadmap.

Advanced knowledge is required both on backend IT systems to ensure smooth and reliable wrangling of data coming from massive data sources, as well as modern frontend reporting interfaces to present the data in a sleek, fit-for-use and fit-for-purpose jacket.

He/she will support, collaborate and build long lasting relationships with internal key stakeholders, continuously looking for and propose new ideas for potential improvements.

This role requires high organization and communication skills, the ability to work in teams or fly solo, and to manage multiple projects simultaneously. He/she should be able to continue to work meticulously under pressure at peak times, and be agile to work in an environment where change happens at a rapid pace.

‚Äã

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

‚Äã

¬∑ Understand business processes and assist the customer in finding the right solution for his problem

¬∑ Deliver quality analytic reports in timely fashion

¬∑ Familiarize oneself with the various data marts‚Äô contents

¬∑ Follow up data projects from A to Z as pm, starting from Business Requirements to the final result including after care.

¬∑ Develop and manage flexible data extract solutions that allow effortless and reliable continuity

¬∑ Maximize the automation of report generation

¬∑ Build reports in a standardized and harmonized way (share with other teams)

¬∑ Ensure data quality by adding consistency checks to the reports

¬∑ Participate in test & QA phases of new releases and propose measurement data sets

¬∑ Continue to develop and simplify the reporting process and increase its efficiency

¬∑ Identify & analyze recurring issues and propose solutions

¬∑ Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies at hand

¬∑ Be or become the Subject Matter Expert of a set of channels/products and act as SPOC within the team

¬∑ Present new reports to the relevant internal customers

‚Äã

‚ÄãYour profile:‚Äã‚Äã

We do not only deliver letters and parcels, but also opportunities. This job is open to all with diverse backgrounds and talents, possessing the following skills: ‚Äã

‚Äã

¬∑ A talented colleague with strong analytical and communication skills who picks things up quickly, has an eye for detail and likes to make things happen.

¬∑ You embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment and thrive well in a team environment, taking others along on your growth journey.

‚Äã

¬∑ You have 3-7 years‚Äô experience in analyzing business needs and translating them into clear reports, using mainstream and new data manipulation and reporting tools such as:

o MS Excel

o Visualisation (PowerBi)

o SAP Business Objects

o SQL

o ETL_Tool (Knime; Access)

o Programming languages (VBA; DAX; M; Perl)

¬∑ Expertise in similar tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, ‚Ä¶) is considered as an asset. Knowledge of other programming languages is considered as an asset as well (Python) even as experience in a logistics environment.

¬∑ You speak fluent Dutch or French and understand the other language, and have business knowledge of English.

‚Äã

Our offer: ‚Äã

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes: ‚Äã

¬∑ Competitive monthly salary‚Äã

¬∑ Meal vouchers‚Äã

¬∑ Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances‚Äã

¬∑ 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off ‚Äã

¬∑ An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay ‚Äã

¬∑ Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners‚Äã

‚Äã

Why bpostgroup?‚Äã

bpostgroup is Belgium's leading postal operator and a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner globally. With a focus on social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world. As our newest team member you will: ‚Äã

¬∑ Become part of the bpostgroup family with a unique atmosphere and culture.‚Äã

¬∑ Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a hybrid model allowing for flexibility.‚Äã

¬∑ Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.‚Äã

¬∑ Have a direct impact on decision-making in an international success story.‚Äã

¬∑ Thrive in a leadership culture centered on visioning, sense making, innovation, and relating, empowering you to lead effectively in our forward-thinking organization.‚Äã

‚Äã

Find out more about bpostgroup‚Äã‚Äã

‚Äã

No match? ‚Äã

Explore other exciting job opportunities with us.‚Äã

‚Äã

More info? ‚Äã

Feel free to reach out to Marissa Sorgeloos

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Data Management & Analytics
Description:
Capco ‚Äì The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let‚Äôs Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You‚Äôre serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you‚Äôre ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let‚Äôs Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Show Us What You‚Äôve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:


Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English


Professional experience is important. But it‚Äôs paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer


An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture


Show more

Title: IT Business Analyst / Data Analyst (Contractor)
Description:
IT Business Analyst / Data Analyst (Contractor) ‚Äì Banking Client ‚Äì Brussels

Duration: 6 months

Rate: 600 ‚Äì 700 Euros per day

Business Analyst ‚Äì Identity & Access Management




In CISO, we see the Business Analyst Expert as a key-resource of the team who contributes to deliver new systems or modifications to existing systems.

This therefore encompass the role of Business Analyst and Product Business Analyst sometimes segregated in other divisions.




Objectives:

Support the Project Lead in scope definition by understanding the overall objective and constraints in the field of Identity and Access Management.
Collect requirements and transform them into a structured and comprehensive work product.
Define clear acceptance criteria which can serve as a comprehensive test set.




Responsibilities:

As a Business Analyst, you will help create a repository for assets and applications integrated with the Identity and Access Management Tribe, including all the manually input identity data.

Participate in the initial feasibility study.
Working closely with Business and IT stakeholders to gather requirements (functional and non-functional) and translate them into technical specifications.
Elicit, analyse, document, and validate business requirements.
Create and document business processes using BPMN (Business Process Modelling Notation) tools.
Collaborate with the change management to ensure that new deliverables are adopted for the benefit of the organization.
Analyse the impact and the risks of a new service development on the current system. Capitalize on the existing security measures or mitigations in place and identify benefit profiles.
Facilitate communication between the business, the IT teams, and the key contributors during the project delivery phase.
Define a test approach for the identified requirements to ensure that the initiative delivers the expected solution.
Participate to the validation of the solution through testing and ensure the traceability of the results.
Update internal and external documentation to ensure its up to date like the standard operating procedures (SOPs) or training material.
Drive and secure the operational readiness of the project solution.

Required skills and qualifications:

Client is looking for a candidate with minimum 3 years of experience in Business Analysis/Data Analysis to be able to produce the required work products.

Analytical and critical mindset, with a strong attention to detail: Capacity to break down complex problems, interpret and challenge data, and make informed decisions to drive business success.
Excellent communication skills (listening, writing, and presenting) at all levels, from team members to senior management level.
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand and meet their requirements.
Strong negotiation and conflict management skills.
Problem-oriented and solution-driven: Ability to identify and Analyse problems, understand their root-cause, and find high-quality solutions.
Flexibility and continuous improvement: Can work in an environment with continuous change on the related services.
Experience with data analysis tools and techniques, statistical data modelling and data visualization.
Knowledge in data management principles and practices.
Understanding of data quality and governance principles.
MS Office, Tableau or Power BI proficiency.
Professional English proficiency.
Ability to come to a Office minimum 4 days a month
Capacity to work autonomously and in close team collaboration.
Understanding of agile methodology and ability to work in an agile environment.

Preferred skills and qualifications:

Certifications in Business Analysis like CBAP, ECBA or CCBA.
Business process modelling, and experience with process mapping tools like Adonis or Visio.
Experience with qualitative data analysis tools such as Nvivo, Atlas.ti and MaxQDA.







Please do send an up to date CV to eobiechefu@welovesalt.com

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity who is analytical, communicative, and self-motivated to join us in our Ethics & Business Integrity (E&BI) team, based in our headquarters office in Brussels, Belgium or in our office in Atlanta, United States.

About The Role

You will be working in a team that designs the compliance monitoring program, including data analysis, research, data management, and reporting, with a goal of enabling the E&BI Team to make informed decisions based on empirical evidence, promoting ethics and business integrity within the organization. Your focus will be on designing data analytics approaches to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of monitoring approaches.

Who You‚Äôll Work With

You will collaborate with various E&BI teams, IT teams, and external partners/vendors to deliver comprehensive data insights and analytics supporting ethical practices and business integrity.

What You‚Äôll Do


Identify opportunities for data-informed reporting and analytics within E&BI.
Assess relevant data sources availability across the organization.
Develop data analytics models to generate insights related to ethics and business integrity.
Deploy and evaluate data analytics solutions and communicate results effectively ‚Ä¶.


Interested? For this role we‚Äôre looking for the following education, experience and skills


Excellent analytical skills for identifying trends and insights from data.
Experience with compliance monitoring approaches preferred.
Strong knowledge and interest in data (Data Visualization/BI Tools, Coding Languages & Tools).
Effective communication skills, including presentations and clear writing.
Ability to influence stakeholders to maximize the impact of ethics and integrity analytics.
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


Are you ready to ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don‚Äôt just complete tasks, we create value. We aren‚Äôt afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‚Äògo beyond‚Äô to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that‚Äôs on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST
Description:
Dark Light specializes in the temporary deployment of talented professionals for data and business intelligence projects. We are currently seeking a Business Data Analyst for one of our major clients, a key player in the Financial landscape.

Tasks


Ability to perform in-depth data analyses in a dynamic and complex environment
Ability to document and communicate analysis results with colleagues
Gather user needs, considering the requirements of the target system and the data present in the source systems
Assignments with both functional and technical aspects
Knowledge of private banking
Thorough knowledge of SQL
Proficiency in French and English
Team player
Good communication skills with IT colleagues and users



Requirements


1-4 years of experience (junior/medior)
Experience in the banking sector (understanding of the banking industry & CRM ‚Äì customer data)
SQL & Excel proficiency
Ability to communicate with technical profiles
Must be able to work independently



Benefits


Hybrid work
Freelance contract of one year (plus extensions)
Remuneration in line with experience

Title: Operationeel data-analist
Description:
AMP, onderdeel van bpostgroup, is een toonaangevende Belgische distributeur van printmedia. Met vier logistieke sites bedient AMP 4.000 persverkooppunten in Belgi√´ en bereikt dagelijks meer dan een miljoen lezers.




Het hoofdkantoor bevindt zich in Anderlecht, met verdeelcentra in Jumet, Paal-Beringen, Lokeren en Mollem. Onze missie is het effici√´nt en tijdig distribueren van publicaties voor uitgevers.




Jouw functie




Als operationeel data-analist speel je een sleutelrol binnen het Circulation & Business Intelligence team.




Taken en Verantwoordelijkheden




Analyseren van verkoopdata voor effici√´ntere distributiestrategie√´n en distributietrends
Administratieve opvolging en ad hoc wijzigingen afhandelen via de mailbox, inclusief distributieplanning en wijzigingen
Onderhouden van klant- en uitgeversrelaties, inclusief communicatie met klanten en uitgevers
Beheren, opvolgen en analyseren van verkoopcijfers met behulp van SAP, Excel en Word voor gegevensanalyse en rapportage naar dagbladhandelaars







Werkomgeving

Je werkt samen met een team van 7 collega's die je zullen opleiden en ondersteunen. Jouw rol is cruciaal voor de distributie van kranten en tijdschriften in Belgi√´ en Nederland. We zoeken iemand die zowel analytisch sterk als administratief vaardig is, met beperkte innovatie met nieuwe tools.




Wat breng je mee?




Talenkennis: Effectieve communicatie in zowel het Nederlands als het Frans is cruciaal voor het onderhouden van sterke relaties met klanten en collega's, en voor een vlot verloop van dagelijkse taken.




Passie voor data-analyse: Je hebt een sterke affiniteit met het analyseren van data en bent in staat om kritisch te denken, wat essentieel is voor het optimaliseren van distributieprocessen.




Sterk concentratievermogen: Met een sterk concentratievermogen beheer je nauwkeurig planningen en kun je flexibel omgaan met veranderingen in een dynamische omgeving.




Software pakketten: Je hebt ervaring met SAP, Excel en Word voor gedetailleerde data-analyses en het opstellen van rapporten, wat bijdraagt aan effectieve besluitvorming. Eventuele kennis van SAP kan ook intern worden bijgebracht.




Bachelor niveau of relevante ervaring: Een afgeronde bacheloropleiding of vergelijkbare ervaring is vereist in een soortgelijke functie.




Analytisch en nauwkeurig: Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden om complexe data te interpreteren en nauwkeurige beslissingen te nemen.




Ervaring in de persindustrie is een plus: Kennis van de persindustrie kan een voordeel zijn vanwege het inzicht in specifieke behoeften en uitdagingen binnen de sector.




Ons aanbod




Bij AMP bieden we een competitief salarispakket en een breed scala aan voordelen om zowel jouw professionele als persoonlijke leven te ondersteunen:




Aantrekkelijk salaris, rekening houdend met jouw ervaring.
Maaltijdcheques ter waarde van 8 euro per dag.
20 wettelijke verlofdagen plus 2 extra dagen.
Thuiswerkvergoeding van 50 euro per maand.
100% terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer.
Ecocheques ter waarde van 250 euro per jaar.
Hospitalisatieverzekering.
Individuele en op maat gemaakte taalcoaching indien nodig, om jouw vaardigheden in de andere landstaal te verbeteren.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst ‚Äì Newly Created Role
Description:
A leading multinational organization, dedicated to fostering an innovative work environment that promotes both personal and professional growth, is now offering an exciting new opportunity for a Business Data Analyst (CRM focus). This is a unique opportunity to join a dynamic, agile team where quick communication and idea-sharing fuel efficiency and learning, so you‚Äôll be able to make the role your own quickly.

With a flexible working policy that includes two days in the office and three days working remotely, the company encourages a balanced lifestyle, allowing you to spend more time on personal interests and relationships while still benefiting from face-to-face collaboration with your colleagues.

Benefits


Flexible working arrangements that support a healthy work-life balance, while building meaningful relationships with your team.
Diverse responsibilities and opportunities for role ownership, ensuring active involvement in shaping your future within the company.
Clear pathways for career progression, with numerous professional development opportunities within a respected multinational firm.


Responsibilities


Work closely with a small team to analyze complex data sets and translate business needs into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.
Use your expertise in CRM systems and data management to develop analytical models that improve business operations and increase efficiency.
Actively engage in continuous development, contributing to a variety of impactful projects and honing your skills.


Requirements


A master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business Management, Marketing, or related fields, giving you a strong foundation in understanding business complexities.
3-5 years of experience in roles such as Business Analyst, Data Scientist, or Business Consultant, enabling you to apply your expertise effectively.
Proficiency in CRM systems such as Veeva or Salesforce, along with familiarity with programming languages like Python, R, or Java, ensuring smooth collaboration with technical teams.


If interested, apply soon ‚Äì interviews are already happening.

Title: Freelance Data Engineer
Description:
WHAT WOULD YOU DO?




In your role as a Data Engineer you provide insights and solutions for complex data problems in order to implement end-to-end data solutions. You are responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the Data Warehouse and ETL infrastructure, where you will transform data into useful data formats for analysis. As a Data Engineer you will come across many varied and challenging projects: ranging from the design and implementation of the data warehouse and the development of ETL to the implementation and maintenance of reports and dashboards.




WHO ARE YOU?




You understand the needs of the customer and can easily handle complex data environments.
You are focused on collaboration, innovation and continuous improvement.
You have strong communication skills and always strive for the best solution.
You have an inquisitive mind and eager to learn.
You are fluent in Dutch or French and have a strong knowledge of English.




WHAT ABOUT YOUR TECHNICAL SKILLS?




Knowledge and hands-on experience with ETL and Data pipelines to integrate multiple data sources
Experience with Data Warehouse environments
Insights in setting up ETL processes and Data Flows
Development and testing of ETL jobs
Solid programming skills and SQL querying experience
Hands-on experience with ETL tools is a plus
Knowledge of Data Vault, Kimball is a plus
Knowledge of Oracle, Google BigQuery or Microsoft Azure is a plus




ls dedicated freelance-resource contact zorgen we voor een snelle, flexibele en persoonlijke aanpak. Onze samenwerking is gebaseerd op respect, vertrouwen en continu√Øteit.

We hebben steeds rechtstreeks contact met de opdrachtgever, een project wordt altijd op voorhand besproken met de freelancer.




Wil je meer info of gewoon een gesprek?

Neem snel contact op.




recruitment@fieldside.be of diana.dierckx@fieldside.be

ls dedicated freelance-resource contact zorgen we voor een snelle, flexibele en persoonlijke aanpak. Onze samenwerking is gebaseerd op respect, vertrouwen en continu√Øteit.

We hebben steeds rechtstreeks contact met de opdrachtgever, een project wordt altijd op voorhand besproken met de freelancer.

Neem snel contact op.


recruitment@fieldside.be of diana.dierckx@fieldside.be

Title: Data Visualization Consultant
Description:
As Stephen Few states: ‚ÄúWe are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.‚Äù Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.




We are looking for a Data Visualization Consultant to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

Create and design reports and dashboards
Interpret business requirements and translate them, through functional analysis, in a good technical solution
Define and execute test scenarios
Coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT)




Knowledge & Experience

You are customer focused, eager to connect with end users and capture their requirements
You have knowledge of visualization techniques
You have relevant experience and/or certificates in one or more of the following technologies: Microsoft Power BI, Qlik, Tableau
Good presentation skills
Ability to work in a team, integrate and work in an international/multi-cultural environment, on variable-sized projects.
Native speaker in Dutch or French with professional working proficiency in English.




Relevant certificates

PL300 ‚Äì Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst
Tableau Desktop Specialist, Tableau Certified Data Analyst
Any certificate linked to Data Visualization and Business Intelligence




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment‚Äîproblem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.

For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Title: Data Mining Analyst
Description:
Description

Vous participez √† la d√©finition des objectifs business du data mining. Vous pouvez ainsi guider les Information/Business Analysts dans leur traduction des besoins business.




Vous √™tes √©galement en charge de l'impl√©mentation d'un mod√®le de data mining : vous transformez les donn√©es et faites de l'exploration de donn√©es.




Vous d√©veloppez des mod√®les et assurez leur impl√©mentation, leur maintenance, leur √©valuation et leur optimisation.




Enfin, vous √™tes impliqu√© dans des projets sp√©cifiques (ex. : environnement de travail cloud) ou dans l'analyse de la fraude, en collaboration avec le service Concurrence loyale.




Profil

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description:

We are looking for a talented and experienced Data Engineer to join our client's team
The Data Engineer will play a crucial role in analyzing data, building predictive and prescriptive models, using generative artificial intelligence and generating actionable insights to support business decisions across different departments of the company.
The projects will cover various business entities such as Marketing, E-commerce, Product, Customer Excellence, Stores, Supply Chain, Procurement...
This position offers the opportunity to work on challenging projects, collaborate with cross-functional teams and contribute to the group's digital retail strategy.




Key responsibilities:

Data analysis and modeling: Use advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze large data sets.
Identify trends, patterns and insights to support data-driven decision-making.
Build and deploy machine learning models, including generative models, to solve business challenges.
Continuously optimize and refine models to improve their performance.
MLOps Best Practices:Follow Carrefour MLOps best practices throughout the machine learning lifecycle, including model versioning, continuous integration and automated model deployment.
Monitor model performance and implement model retraining and maintenance procedures.
Collaboration:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data platforms, data insights and business partners, to understand their needs and deliver solutions.
Communicate results and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.
Innovation:Stay up to date with the latest developments in data science, machine learning and generative artificial intelligence.
Explore new techniques and technologies, especially in the field of generative artificial intelligence, to improve the company's data capabilities.




Qualifications:

You hold a scientific or business-oriented master's degree (computer science, data science, statistics, economics or related field).
Proven experience as a Data Scientist, data engineer, with a minimum of 3 years.
Solid experience in applying advanced statistics to various business situations, with the ability to synthesize complex data and transform it into actionable insights.
Proficiency in Python and SQL programming.
In-depth knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (VertexAI, Dataform, BigQuery ...)
Ability to work independently, leading projects from concept to completion.
Strong collaboration skills: you are comfortable working with technical and non-technical people.
Experience in the retail sector is a plus.
Fluency in English and in-depth knowledge of French or Dutch.

Title: Internship Business Analyst - Data & Analytics Team
Description:
Working on innovative solutions to address emerging business challenges, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in genuine partnership with market-leading clients, impacting the way people work and live in the future.

We are offering you an interesting and challenging position as:




Business Analyst Intern - Data & Analytics




The Role:




The D&A intern will play a pivotal role in supporting our ongoing projects and initiatives within the EU and International Institutions by providing key data analysis and insights. This is an incredible opportunity for students or recent graduates looking to gain hands-on experience in a leading business consulting environment, working closely with seasoned professionals on meaningful projects.




Main responsibilities:




Assisting in the analysis and interpretation of data.
Supporting the development and delivery of D&A solutions to our clients.
Participating in cross-functional teams to contribute to the success of our projects.
Gaining a deep understanding of our clients‚Äô needs and challenges.

Ideal profile:




Currently enrolled in a degree in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Business Engineering or a related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of data analysis tools and software.
Strong proficiency in English and/or French/Dutch.
Good communication and presentation skills.
Eagerness to learn, adapt, and collaborate in a multicultural environment.
Entrepreneurial mindset.
Keen interest in consulting.
Mandatory school agreement.




BearingPoint offers you:




An enriching internship experience within a leading European Business Consulting firm.
The possibility to work on multiple international projects within an easy-going team.
Cross-level collaborations with our data experts, eager to share their knowledge.




Apply and become part of the D&A team!
