Title: Job | Data Analist C2N | Brussel
Description:
Omschrijving

Je levert data-analyses en rapporten op. Zo draag je bij tot de verbetering en monitoring van commerci√´le en operationele prestaties.

De job in een notendop

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. Vragen vanuit de businessafdelingen (Marketing, Distributie, Contact Center) vertaal je in gedetailleerde data requirements. En je gebruikt de juiste bronnen: sociodemografische bronnen en bronnen in verband met productuitrusting, klantenrentabiliteit, risicoprofielen, onlinegedrag, CRM en verkoopgegevens.

Je staat ook in voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. In samenwerking met de data engineers en gebruikmakend van SQL, Azure en Python bouw je de onderliggende datastructuren op waarop de rapporten zullen draaien en die kunnen dienen voor nieuwe analyses. En je zorgt voor de uitbouw van de visualisaties van de rapporten in dashboards met behulp van QlikSense.

Samen met data governance harmoniseer en centraliseer je ook concepten, met duidelijke owners, stewards en kwaliteitscontroles.

Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. We zoeken vooral een straffe persoonlijkheid met een learning mindset.

Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan als je iemand bent met:


Een STEM diploma (Science, Technology, Engineer, Mathematichs), of een diploma in handels-/economische wetenschappen en/of relevante werkervaring
Een voorliefde voor cijfers en een sterke analytische capaciteiten
Een gezonde dosis nieuwsgierigheid en een interesse in business en marketing concepten
Sterke communicatievaardigheden



Je scoort extra met:


Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans) en kennis van het Engels
Oog voor detail en datanuances
Het vermogen om een massa aan gegevens samen te vatten en om te zetten in kerninzichten



Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:


Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Show more
HTML:
Omschrijving

Je levert data-analyses en rapporten op. Zo draag je bij tot de verbetering en monitoring van commerci√´le en operationele prestaties.

De job in een notendop

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. Vragen vanuit de businessafdelingen (Marketing, Distributie, Contact Center) vertaal je in gedetailleerde data requirements. En je gebruikt de juiste bronnen: sociodemografische bronnen en bronnen in verband met productuitrusting, klantenrentabiliteit, risicoprofielen, onlinegedrag, CRM en verkoopgegevens.

Je staat ook in voor de oplevering van rapporten en analyses. In samenwerking met de data engineers en gebruikmakend van SQL, Azure en Python bouw je de onderliggende datastructuren op waarop de rapporten zullen draaien en die kunnen dienen voor nieuwe analyses. En je zorgt voor de uitbouw van de visualisaties van de rapporten in dashboards met behulp van QlikSense.

Samen met data governance harmoniseer en centraliseer je ook concepten, met duidelijke owners, stewards en kwaliteitscontroles.

Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel √©√©n worden. We zoeken vooral een straffe persoonlijkheid met een learning mindset.

Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan als je iemand bent met:

  • Een STEM diploma (Science, Technology, Engineer, Mathematichs), of een diploma in handels-/economische wetenschappen en/of relevante werkervaring
  • Een voorliefde voor cijfers en een sterke analytische capaciteiten
  • Een gezonde dosis nieuwsgierigheid en een interesse in business en marketing concepten
  • Sterke communicatievaardigheden


Je scoort extra met:

  • Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans) en kennis van het Engels
  • Oog voor detail en datanuances
  • Het vermogen om een massa aan gegevens samen te vatten en om te zetten in kerninzichten


Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:

  • Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
  • Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carri√®rekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
  • Een goede werk-priv√© balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
  • Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Title: Power BI Senior Consultant
Description:
Start a new adventure in the beating heart of the data driven services of Business Elements, where we raise the standards of our industry. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We‚Äôll coach you, train you and make you part of our story.




Your skills

Advanced Dax (writing dax, optimizing dax, calculation groups, ‚Ä¶)
M-language (write own functions)
SQL
Dax Studio
Tabular Editor
Power BI Rest api

Will be a plus:

Powershell (powerbi api)
R-language
Azure Data Factory
Azure Synapse Analytics
Develop Connectors
Develop Custom Visuals
Takes ownership of projects
Delivers work with high quality & precision
Eager to learn




Your missions

In this role, your primary activity will be to develop Power BI reports making use of your extensive knowledge & experience to deliver insights to customers in a UX-friendly way. We expect an advanced skillset in Power BI, not just providing solutions for customers, but also optimizing them where possible. You know how to translate business requirements in terms of analytics to lean reports and have a willingness to share your knowledge with colleagues to drive success at our customers.




We offer

Extensive training & learning opportunities
Structured career progression - at Reply we encourage career growth and will give you the tools and guidance to achieve subject matter expertise and management capabilities
Competitive compensation package
Paid certification programs for your career evolution
Diverse and vibrant work environment - you'll be surrounded by peers who share your passion for technology
Opportunities to get involved in Hackathons, Code Challenges and Lab Camps
Your education doesn‚Äôt need to stop here! We are proud of our continuously learning culture about emerging technologies
Opportunity to work on projects with some of the world‚Äôs leading brands







About Business Elements

Business Elements is market leader in providing solutions on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, Microsoft AI, and Microsoft Power Platform in the Belgium and Luxembourg Area. With 70+ experienced consultants, we offer a broad range of expertise in Customer Engagement, Artificial Intelligence and Digital Marketing.

As a Microsoft Tier 1 Cloud Solution Partner, we also offer dedicated support services to Microsoft customers.

The Microsoft digital transformation framework is designed to enable a cloud data-centric model which is based on 4 pillars: empower people, transform products, optimize operations and engage customers. Business applications are making the bridge between the power of the MS cloud and customer's business processes. The glue which makes the magic for such strategic projects is the way a partner can map this vision to the customer reality. It is all about excellence in delivery, industry knowledge, customer care and technology expertise: the assets that Business Elements has developed during years, and that we will continue to reinforce together with the Microsoft team and our customers.

Title: Geo Data Analyst
HTML:
Iristeam vzw biedt de ondersteuning in IT medewerkers alsook bijstand en dienstenprestatie op het gebied van digitale transitie en IT-diensten voor haar leden. Iristeam heeft 650 mensen in dienst en fungeert als kenniscentrum. Tot de leden behoren 150 besturen en organisaties die op gewestelijk of lokaal niveau actief zijn in het Brussels Gewest.

Het belangrijkste lid op het vlak van IT-medewerkers is Paradigm, de Organisatie van Openbaar Belang (OOB) voor digitale transitie en ICT in het Brussels Gewest.

Als Geo Data Analyst werk je in het Geo & Open data team van Paradigm, dat met name verantwoordelijk is voor UrbIS data, de benhmark voor ruimtelijke data in het Brussels Gewest.

Geo Data Analyst

Jouw bijdrage, jouw taken:

Als Geo Data Analyst zijn je belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Toezicht houden op en verbeteren van de processen om geospatiale gegevens te verzamelen, bijwerken en distribueren;
  • Toezien op en verbeteren van processen gericht op het waarborgen van de kwaliteit van geospatiale gegevens en de hun conformiteit met Europese of Belgische normen;
  • Deelnemen aan werkgroepen die verantwoordelijk zijn voor de standaardisering van ruimtelijke gegevens in het Brussels Gewest of in Belgi√´.

Je ervaring en competenties:

Je hebt minstens twee jaar aantoonbare werkervaring in een gelijkaardige functie of je hebt een universitair of hoger diploma, bij voorkeur in geografie, agronomie, geologie, geomatica of ruimtelijke informatica.

  • Je hebt een goede kennis van GIS Dekstop (QGIS, ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro of vergelijkbare software);
  • Je hebt basiskennis van object geori√´nteerd programmeren (Python, R of een andere object geori√´nteerde taal);
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van relationele databases (SQL of gelijkaardige taal);
  • Je hebt ervaring met een ETL (FME of gelijkaardige software);
  • Je spreekt Frans en/of Nederlands.

Troeven

  • Kennis van het Engels
  • Kennis van de volgende technologie√´n of standaarden
    • GIS-server (GeoServer, MapServer, QGIS Server, ArcGIS Entreprise of vergelijkbare software) ;
    • Metadata management tools (GeoNetwork, CKAN, opendatasoft of vergelijkbare software);
    • OGC-standaarden ;
    • INSPIRE-standaarden;
    • UML.

Kennis van het Frans en/of Nederlands is verplicht, kennis van het Engels is een pluspunt.

Van je vele kwaliteiten waarderen we vooral je proactiviteit, je resultaatgerichtheid en je vermogen om jezelf te ontwikkelen!

Deze functie staat niet open voor freelancers of wervingsbureaus.

Ons aanbod:

Uiteraard een contract van onbepaalde duur met een zeer ruim salarispakket inclusief :

  • hospitalisatieverzekering uitgebreid met ambulante behandelingen voor jou en je gezin ;
  • groepsverzekeringen (pensioenkapitaal, gewaarborgd inkomen en levensverzekering);
  • opleidingspakket(ten) ;
  • 100% terugbetaling van je kosten voor openbaar vervoer ;
  • smartphone-abonnement ;
  • netto maandelijkse vergoeding ;
  • maaltijdcheques twv 8 euro;
  • 37 vakantiedagen per jaar (op fulltime basis);
  • mogelijkheid tot telewerken...

En nog veel meer!

  • makkelijk bereikbare kantoren ;
  • een afwisselende en boeiende baan in een dynamische en gezellige omgeving ;
  • een goed evenwicht tussen werk en priv√©leven...


Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Stuur ons je meest recente CV via de "Solliciteer" knop!

De sollicitatieprocedure omvat een gesprek met je toekomstige manager en een gesprek met je HR-contactpersoon, eventueel gevolgd door een assessment.

Je toekomstige collega's kijken al uit naar je eerste dag!

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description du poste :

CONTEXT:

L‚ÄôOccitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L‚ÄôOccitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins

HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is a plus
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline

¬†

STARTING DATE:¬†January 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)LOCATION:¬†Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

If you are selected, we will have the pleasure to meet you during an online recruitment day

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for our client in the following locations: Zurich, Lucerne and St Gallen.




In this role, you'll handle the development of the BI system, perform data analysis, create reports and visualizations, and lead efforts to optimize and automate business processes.

If you are fluent in both German and English and have several years of experience in data analysis and BI, complemented by experience with SQL and visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik), this is the right opportunity for you!




Knowledge of Python or R is a plus.




If you want to hear more about this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The L‚ÄôOCCITANE Group is a leading international manufacturer and retailer of premium and sustainable beauty and wellness products. The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: L‚ÄôOCCITANE en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L‚ÄôOCCITANE au Br√©sil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze.

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L‚ÄôOCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet. The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature.

L‚ÄôOCCITANE is also committed to sustainability for business, people & the planet, as well as respect of human rights, ethics principles and labour protection. All employees at L‚ÄôOCCITANE must therefore implement the company‚Äôs mission and integrate the social, environmental, economic and legal effects of their actions in their day-to-day job. In practice, this means that any employee at L‚ÄôOCCITANE shall contribute to growing sales, regenerating nature, caring for our consumers & partners and supporting our employees. The L'OCCITANE Group is a certified B CorporationTM.

Context

L‚ÄôOccitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

Main Responsibilities


Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L‚ÄôOccitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins


How You Can Fit


Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is a plus
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline

Title: Junior Business Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Junior Business Data Analyst to join our client, one of the largest banks in Zurich for the contracting role.




Start date: 01.10.2024.

End date: 31.12.2024. (With the possibility of extension)




In this role, you will focus on delivering regulatory reports through Compliance Analytics, ensuring they support informed risk assessments and decisions by being easily understood, comparable, and reliable, all based on the bank‚Äôs data. The main responsibilities include updating the inventory of scripts and reports, identifying common elements, proposing standards, and updating the report documentation.




This role is ideal for candidates with around 2 years of relevant experience in financial services, specifically in non-financial risk areas such as compliance, risk management, and legal. A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in STEM fields, economics, or banking and finance is required. Strong skills in database programming, such as SQL, are essential, along with experience in project management or business analysis.




Apply here, or reach out to me directly at: irina.maric@nicollcurtin.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Procurement Data Analyst - 6 month contract (remote)

We are seeking a Procurement Analyst to manage supplier negotiations, support RFP development, and ensure cost-effective vendor agreements for a key client. In this role, you will work closely with internal teams such as Procurement, Legal, and Finance to drive procurement strategies and optimize supplier relationships.

Key Responsibilities


Negotiation Coordination: Manage and track multiple supplier negotiations, ensuring timely and favorable supply agreements.
RFP & Contract Development: Assist in preparing RFPs, analyzing bids, and drafting contracts.
Vendor Pricing Analysis: Evaluate vendor pricing and terms to ensure cost competitiveness and identify savings opportunities.
Bid Management: Receive, review, and analyse vendor bids for decision-making.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with teams across procurement, legal, and finance to clarify proposals and align on procurement strategies.
Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of received bids and RFPs to prepare fact-based negotiation materials.
Stakeholder Engagement: Provide regular updates to internal stakeholders and ensure clear communication between all parties.


Key Skills


Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze data, conduct root cause analysis, and interpret bid and pricing information.
Communication & Presentation: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to present ideas and updates clearly.
Negotiation & Vendor Management: Knowledge of purchasing, tendering, and negotiation principles.
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams.
Tech Savvy: Proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint, for data analysis and presentations.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs in Data Science, Life Sciences, Engineering (preferred: Supply Chain/Business)
Experience in procurement, RFP management, and vendor negotiations.

Title: Junior Payroll Data Analyst
Description:
Mercuria is one of the world‚Äôs leading independent energy and commodity groups. Our purpose is to connect markets and to advance the energy transition. We bring markets together to support the world‚Äôs energy needs of today by trading, structuring finance, and investing into strategic assets, whilst generating over $170 billion in turnover. We are committed to advancing the transition to a more sustainable, affordable and reliable energy system for tomorrow. We are well ahead of the pledge we made in 2021 that over half of our investment capital will go into sectors that are advancing the energy transition by 2025, to contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.




As a Junior Payroll Analyst for Mercuria Energy Trading, your primary role will be to assist in the collection, preparation, and provision of payroll information to our payroll team; focusing on finding ways to automate and optimize the process. You will work to ensure accuracy and confidentiality in all payroll data, while also providing exceptional payroll services and support. Your advanced analytics and data science skills will be relevant to enhance our processes and act as an agent of change.




Key Responsibilities:




Assist the payroll team with the timely collection and preparation of payroll variables on a monthly basis.
Verify the accuracy of payroll information by collecting, computing, and entering data into the payroll system.
Assist in preparing payroll reports for audits and management review.
Update payroll records by entering changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, deductions, job titles, and department/division transfers.
Respond to payroll queries by providing required information timely and accurately, while maintaining the confidentiality of payroll operations.
Liaise with human resources for new hires, terminations, and benefits updates.
Participate in relevant projects that require cross-departmental collaboration when required.
Utilize advanced analytics and numeric skills to improve payroll processes.
Apply business analysis capabilities to identify and implement process automation.
Engage in data science and coding tasks to support payroll and broader business functions.







Qualifications and Skills:




Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a numerical field of studies;
Minimum 2 years of experience in a function where you are responsible for collecting variables, reconciling and analyzing data.
Strong numerical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel, with advanced analytics skills.
Proficiency in French and English. Additional language skills would be a plus.
Tech-savvy with a strong interest in data science and coding.
Strong drive for process enhancements and automation.

Show more

This is a FT/PT/ Other role for a Data Specialist at HFS Hiring. Title: Procurement Data Analyst
Description:
For our Pharma client in the kanton of Basel we are currently looking for a Procurement Data Analyst




Your Tasks and Responsibilities:

Supports the coordination and tracking of multiple negotiations in parallel to ensure supply agreements are reached in a timely manner and provides regular and clear status updates
Assists in the development and preparation of requests for proposals (RFPs) and draft contracts
Analyses vendor pricing and other terms to ensure cost competitiveness for goods and services via telephone, email, quotation, bid, and/or request for proposal (RFP) process.
Receives, opens and tabulates vendor bid data for evaluation.
Engages with internal stakeholders and suppliers to clarify supplier proposals, so clear supplier feedback can be provided
Reviews and analyses data within all received RFPs and prepares negotiation material
Actively communicates and corresponds with internal and external customers regarding opportunities and challenges.
Performs related work as required.
Under general direction, conducts the preparation and analysis of multiple supplier bids to reach competitive pricing and commercial agreements. Supports the negotiation process by preparing fact based negotiation presentations.

Ihr Profil:

BS Field of Study Data science, Life Sciences or Engineering
BS or MSC Field of Study Supply Chain Management or Business Management
Challenges the status quo and looks for opportunities to make improvements in his/her area of the business and beyond
Uses knowledge of his/her own business area and related areas to identify and develop operational/financial improvements
Works in partnership as an active member of his/her team and cross- functional working groups
Proactively seeks to understand internal/external customer and market needs
Develops insights that can be used to enhance customer satisfaction or other metrics
Helps peers (and team) overcome performance obstacles and challenges
Secures buy-in from key stakeholders
Ensures delivery excellence for own goals
Ensures clear and direct 2-way communication within his/her team and other organisations
Takes personal accountability for outcomes resulting from choices and behaviours of self and team
Good communication and presentation skills. Ability to present ideas in a clear and concise manner
Strong analytical skills with the ability to define metrics (KPI‚Äôs) and identify issues through root cause analysis
Knowledge of purchasing and tendering and negotiation principles
Ability to analyse and interpret data, and prepare concise reports
Competent using MS Office suite, particularly Excel and PowerPoint

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description:
You are an integral part of the success of the B2B Telco business and have the power to influence it directly. You analyze our data and prepare them in "smart" dashboards as control instruments for our business. Based on the results, we define optimal measures and generate corresponding leads for sales campaigns and technological product migrations. In this way, you contribute to achieving revenue and migration goals.



Analysing market and customer behaviour to define actions and generate leads for sales campaigns
Continuous development of sales dashboards to improve churn prevention, upselling and other revenue and margin-related improvements
Planning and managing technological product migration campaigns in collaboration with stakeholders from various departments
Responsible for enhancing sales order entry and customer revenues for short and long-term planning



Your profile



Bachelor's degree (Uni/UAS/FH) in Business Informatics, Data Science or a relevant field
Several years of experience and strong knowledge in IT business analysis, data analytics, data mining, data warehousing and AI algorithms
Proficiency in data science platforms for data preparation such as KNIME
Solid experience in BI analytics for data visualisation e.g. Tableau



What Makes You Stand Out



Very good understanding of the B2B telecommunications market and its offerings
Ability to comprehend complex IT systems, structure complex business problems and develop pragmatic solutions
Very good analytical and problem-solving skills with a structured and methodical approach
Proficient in German and English; French is a plus

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Your team

The Pictet Group is one of the world‚Äôs leading independent wealth and asset managers. Founded in 1805 and headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, the Group is represented in 30 offices in financial centres worldwide, currently employing over 5,000 people.

Pictet Wealth Management combines more than 200 years of Swiss banking heritage with global investment expertise. The Partner-owned financial service group offers a comprehensive service for wealthy individuals and families, including discretionary and advisory investment solutions and family office services.

You will be joining Pictet Wealth Management and will be part of the PWM COO Office team based in Geneva. The PWM COO Office aims, among other things, to provide support to the teams in charge of the digital solutions in key activities along the product management lifecycle.

The COO Office is looking to hire a Data Analytics Specialist. You will use your data and analytics skills to collaborate on key projects to enhance the tooling and value chain of operational data analytics. The aim is to serve the consumers of analytics with high-quality operational data and meaningful dashboards creating added business value and promoting a data culture in our digital product-oriented organisation.

Your role


Work closely with the Tech team to design and build comprehensive and scalable data analytic infrastructure to automate and industrialise data retrieval, transformation and distribution.
Collaborate with PWM‚Äôs dashboard users/data scientists to collect new needs, document requirements and deliver solutions.
Provide expertise and guidance to the data users on accessing and using the data infrastructure effectively.
Maintain and enhance existing dashboards and reports to management (Business Development, Investment Platform, Etat Major).
Identify and address data quality issues, ensuring accuracy, consistency and reliability.
Collaborate with data stakeholders across the firm to stay aligned with Group‚Äôs guidelines and governance, and benefit from Group initiatives and best practices


Your profile


A Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science or related field.
Between five and eight years‚Äô proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a focus on data analysis, data management, and maintenance and/or implementing data infrastructure.
Solid understanding of data governance, data quality and data classification principles.
Good knowledge of private banking organisation, products and processes.
Relevant experience in interacting with end-users.
Proven technical skills in: programming (SQL queries, event-driven, Python), orchestration tools (Prefect, DBT), integration with cloud/major data warehousing platforms, advanced visualisation tools and technologies (such as Tableau, BusinessObject and ReactJS).
Initiative and commitment, self-motivation and ability to work independently while actively engaging and collaborating with others.
Able to work in a demanding and challenging environment.
Fluent in French and excellent command of English.
Able to show discretion and handle confidential issues in an appropriate manner.
Must be resident in Switzerland.


Ref: DAS/SN/AA

Note

We will not accept any CVs via agencies

Diversity & Inclusion

Pictet is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse environment. We respect all individuals and seek their inclusion in the workplace.

Your team

The Pictet Group is one of the world‚Äôs leading independent wealth and asset managers. Founded in 1805 and headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, the Group is represented in 30 offices in financial centres worldwide, currently employing over 5,000 people.

Pictet Wealth Management combines more than 200 years of Swiss banking heritage with global investment expertise. The Partner-owned financial service group offers a comprehensive service for wealthy individuals and families, including discretionary and advisory investment solutions and family office services.

You will be joining Pictet Wealth Management and will be part of the PWM COO Office team based in Geneva. The PWM COO Office aims, among other things, to provide support to the teams in charge of the digital solutions in key activities along the product management lifecycle.

The COO Office is looking to hire a Data Analytics Specialist. You will use your data and analytics skills to collaborate on key projects to enhance the tooling and value chain of operational data analytics. The aim is to serve the consumers of analytics with high-quality operational data and meaningful dashboards creating added business value and promoting a data culture in our digital product-oriented organisation.

Your role

  • Work closely with the Tech team to design and build comprehensive and scalable data analytic infrastructure to automate and industrialise data retrieval, transformation and distribution.
  • Collaborate with PWM‚Äôs dashboard users/data scientists to collect new needs, document requirements and deliver solutions.

  • Solid understanding of data governance, data quality and data classification principles.

  • Proven technical skills in: programming (SQL queries, event-driven, Python), orchestration tools (Prefect, DBT), integration with cloud/major data warehousing platforms, advanced visualisation tools and technologies (such as Tableau, BusinessObject and ReactJS).
  • Initiative and commitment, self-motivation and ability to work independently while actively engaging and collaborating with others.
  • Able to work in a demanding and challenging environment.
  • Fluent in French and excellent command of English.

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master‚Äôs degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years‚Äô experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools ‚Äì Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential ‚Äì French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees‚Äô fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activit√©s

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more

Title: Data and Compliance Analyst (Junior)
Description:
Data and Compliance Analyst vacancy for a globally operating Zurich based company in the Banking sector.

Your Tasks


Taking responsibility for regulatory reports in collaboration with the Compliance Analytics Team
Keeping the inventory of scripts and reports up to date
Extracting common elements as well as proposing standards
Updating the report documentation



Your Experience/knowledge


2+ years of working experience as a Data or Business Analyst or in another relevant position
Familiarity with financial services with focus on non-financial risk like Compliance, Risk Management and Legal
Proficiency in database programming, for example with SQL
Knowhow in project management or business analysis
University degree in STEM fields, economics or banking and finance
Language skills: English ‚Äì fluent in written and spoken



Your Soft Skills


Team player with excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
A high degree of self-organisation and time management



Location: Z√ºrich, Switzerland

Work setting: Hybrid

Sector: Banking

Start: 10/2024

Duration: 03MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH 22101

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Business Insights and Analytics Intern
Description:
To support our team in Switzerland we are looking for a Business Insights and Analytics Intern.




Are you ready to make a meaningful impact on patients' lives while gaining invaluable experience in business analytics? Novocure is seeking a dynamic and analytical individual to join our team as a Business Insights and Analytics Intern. This part-time position (50-70% time commitment) reports to the Associate Director of Business Insights and Analytics and involves collaborating with our international team to support and optimize our business reporting processes.




Your responsibilities:

Develop, prepare, and optimize monthly business excellence reporting and associated analytics across international markets.
Work closely with the Senior Specialist and Associate Director to analyze and interpret data, providing actionable insights to country General Managers.
Ensure data accuracy and reliability through robust data validation processes.
Analyze internal datasets to identify trends, patterns, and business implications.
Develop new dashboards and alerts within our International Business Operations reporting framework.
Gather feedback from various business units to address evolving needs and translate them into actionable insights.




Your profile:

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Business, Data Analytics, a Scientific field, or a related discipline with a strong analytical component.
Previous experience in data analysis through internships, academic projects, or relevant work.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word); experience with Power BI, SQL, or other data analysis tools is desirable but not essential.
Commitment to accuracy in all outputs.
Interest in business strategy, healthcare, and the implications of analytics on business operations.
Ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely in English.
Collaborative mindset and willingness to work closely with the Business Analytics team and other stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines.




About us:

Novocure is a global publicly-traded commercial-stage oncology company developing a profoundly different cancer treatment therapy called tumor treating fields (TTFields) for patients with solid tumors. TTFields therapy is a non-invasive, novel, antimitotic treatment modality which utilizes proprietary technology attempting to slow or reverse tumor progression by inducing tumor cell death. Novocure's commercialized product, Optune, is approved for the treatment of adult patients with glioblastoma (GBM) in the USA, Europe and Israel. Novocure has ongoing or completed clinical trials and is further expanding its efforts into several other solid tumor indications - non-small cell lung cancer, pancreatic cancer and other types of solid cancers.




We are looking forward to receive your application through our ApplicantPortal. Please find more information about Novocure and our therapy on our website www.novocure.com or by consulting our patient testimonial videos.

Title: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Position: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?

Then, this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.

We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.

A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.

Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :


You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, ‚Ä¶);
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth;
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions;
You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.


What we offer:


Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning
Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring‚Äì you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.


Job Qualifications

What we are looking for:

Masters Students with:


Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Data Analytics background a plus


Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:


Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)


WHO WE ARE:

P&G is one of the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash¬Æ, Gillette¬Æ, Pantene¬Æ, Oral-B¬Æ, Swiffer¬Æ, Head & Shoulders¬Æ, Braun¬Æ, Fairy¬Æ.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114493

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

We are a strong customer focused company working mainly for Top 500 companies. We pay great attention to further training and development, carrier opportunities and working conditions. We provide these opportunities to Swiss and EU residents. If you are strong in the above mentioned fields do not hesitate to send us your application and let us inform you about this.

Title: Data Engineer Intern (Python)
Description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 20 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda has offices in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Data Engineer Intern (Python) to be a part of our Inflation Trading Team, in 2025 for a 6-month internship in Zug, Switzerland. This is an exciting position offering opportunities to gain exposure to software development and portfolio management practices at a global hedge fund.

Position Responsibilities


Aid in the development of new lines of business solutions using Python, and SQL
Support senior investment staff by owning data extraction and ingestion from websites, transformation, tooling and automation
Provide support for in-house and 3rd party applications


Qualifications & Desired Skills


Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Quantitative Finance
Experience with the Python ecosystem of common libraries and working knowledge of at least one statically typed language
Good grasp of computer science fundamentals (e.g. data structures, algorithms, operating systems etc.)
Familiarity with object-oriented programming
Strong problem-solving skills and commitment to high standards for code
Interest or prior experience in the financial trading industry (particularly in fixed income) a plus
Ability to work effectively in a high-energy, time-sensitive team environment
Detail-oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung und methodische Kenntnisse im Bereich IT Business Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Mining, Data Warehousing und KI-Algorithmen von Vorteil


Was dich auszeichnet


  • Idealerweise sehr gute Kenntnisse des B2B-Telekommunikationsmarktes und seiner Angebote
  • F√§higkeit, komplexe IT-Systeme zu kennen und zu verstehen, komplexe Gesch√§ftsprobleme zu strukturieren und pragmatische L√∂sungen zu entwickeln
  • Strukturiertes, methodisches und analytisches Denken sowie eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten
  • Sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch; Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil


Was du draus machst, ist was uns ausmacht.

Title: Data Engineer (Zurich, Switzerland)
Description:
Who We Are

Founded in 2017, Unit8 is a fast-growing Swiss AI and data analytics consulting and services company dedicated to solving complex problems of traditional industries like automotive, chemical, financial services, manufacturing and pharma. We work with some of the biggest organisations in Europe to solve the challenges that directly affect their business - be it operations, finance, manufacturing or R&D. Since our foundation, we have successfully delivered more than 150 projects and have grown to 100+ talented individuals across 5 office locations.

Unit8's mission is to drive the adoption of AI and Data Science in the non-digital industries and to help accelerate their digital transformation. Among its activities, Unit8 dedicates a part of its resources and time on projects that deeply matter to us - that includes collaboration on pro-bono and "engineering for good" causes. You can learn more about what we are passionate about at Unit8 Talks and on our website you can find more useful information about our business and recruiting process.




These are some examples of projects that we have been working on

Building a real-time production line monitoring system for the pharmaceutical industry in order to improve the throughput of the production processes for the Pharmaceutical Industry. Technologies: AWS, EKS, CloudFormation, Docker, Python
Building system for calculating and delivering global climate scores i.e. estimating the impact of climate change on the risk of natural disasters (i.e. floods, wildfires & droughts) for the Insurance Industry. Technologies: PySpark, Python, Proprietary Data Processing Platform
Building a modern data science platform including a data lake for Chemical Industry. Technologies: Azure, ML Studio, Data Factory, Databricks, Spark




About You

As a member of agile project teams, your mission will be to build solutions and infrastructure aiming at solving the business problems of our clients.

You are a proficient software engineer who knows the fundamentals of computer science and you master at least one widely adopted programming language (Python, Java, C#, C++).
You know how to write distributed services and work with high-volume heterogeneous data, preferably with distributed systems such as Spark.
You are knowledgeable about data governance, data access, and data storage techniques.
You have strong client-facing skills: comfortable interacting with clients (business & technical audience), delivering presentations, problem-solving mindset.
You are willing to travel to meet with our clients and the team (mainly in Europe - up to 10% of your time).




What You'll Do

Design, build, maintain, and troubleshoot data pipelines and processing systems that are relied on for both production and analytics applications, using a variety of open-source and closed-source technologies.
Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve data quality.
Collaborate with other software engineers, ML experts, and stakeholders, taking learning and leadership opportunities that will arise every single day.
Work in multi-functional agile teams to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new product objectives.




What we offer

Work on client projects that have a concrete impact on their business.
Exposure to a wide variety of projects, industries, and technologies. Each client is different
Ability to contribute to internal open-source projects like Darts (https://github.com/unit8co/darts) or building our own MLOps platform.
Tailor-made mentorship programme.
Learning activities such as ML and Engineering Knowledge Sharing Groups.
10% of paid time for self-development.
Opportunity to join a fast-growing service company with a start-up atmosphere.
Work with an international team made of more than 15 nationalities.
Cross offices/company-wide frequent events (off-site or on-line).
Fun Fund to spend with the team on after-work activities.
Compensation package including base salary and profit sharing based on the performance of the company
30 paid days off.
Extended parental leave conditions.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer (m/w/d)




Are you in search of a meaningful and rewarding career path as a Data Engineer?




We are seeking for a new talent as a Data Engineer (m/w/d) to join the Data & AI team where you will have the opportunity to collaborate in the project for the telecommunications company in Switzerland, providing a wide range of services to both residential and business customers.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, and databases.




If you are passionate about data engineering and excited to work on a telecommunication project, we would love to hear from you!




Primary Skill: Data Engineering







Responsibilities:

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions for data generation, collection, and processing.
Your main tasks will include creating data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and implementing ETL (extract, transform, and load) processes to migrate and deploy data across systems.
You are expected to be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with deep knowledge in Data Engineering.
You will act in an advisory role in meetings and be the primary contact (go-to person) for your area of expertise.
Additionally, you will be responsible for publishing on your area of expertise within and outside of our client, as well as presenting on your area of expertise at conferences.
You will also be expected to provide solutions to business areas and client-wide problems, contribute to and be held directly and indirectly responsible for business area decisions, and define business area goals.
Design and develop innovative data solutions to optimize data generation, collection, and processing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and integrity.
Implement and maintain efficient data pipelines for seamless data migration and deployment.
Conduct data analysis and provide insights to drive business decisions.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Data Engineering to continuously improve processes and solutions.




Your skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
At least 5 years working experience as a Data Engineer
Proficiency in Data Engineering at an Expert level is required.
Proven experience with Data Migrations, Data Access, Data Pipelines, and Data Processing at an Expert level are recommended.
Experience with cloud platforms: AWS, Azure a plus.
Strong programming skills in Python, Java a plus
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy in big data sets
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
Experience in the telecommunication industry a plus
Language skills: English (C1), German (C1)




General Information:

Start date: 09.09.2023
End date: 28.02.2025
Extension: is an option
Workplace: Bern
Workload: 100%
Onsite Presence: Switzerland, 80% onsite work is required in Bern
Opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Exposure to innovative projects and technology
Competitive pay rate and benefits package

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About MS Reinsurance

MS Reinsurance is a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland with underwriting offices in Zurich, Bermuda, Miami, and New York. The Company underwrites non-life treaty reinsurance solutions on a worldwide basis through its three business units: Americas, International, and Specialty Lines. As part of the world-leading insurance group MS&AD, MS Reinsurance combines reliability and agility to make its clients‚Äô businesses stronger. With a drive to move quickly and a commitment to long term partnership, MS Reinsurance supports its partners with the momentum and stability they can build on.




About the role

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst who will drive MS Reinsurance BI initiatives and play a pivotal role in execution of the data strategy. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for turning data into insight, helping to inform business decision-making by using a variety of tools and methodologies to analyse data and present findings.




Your responsibilities

Collect, analyse, and interpret raw data from various sources
Develop reports and dashboards to present actionable insights
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver solutions that meet these requirements
Ensure data accuracy and quality by implementing rigorous testing methods
Participate in the transformation of legacy systems, aiding in the evolution toward a data-centric business approach
Stay updated on technology trends and new Power BI trends
Develop, deploy, and maintain BI interfaces, including query tools, data visualization and interactive dashboards, and data modelling tools
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems and streamline data flow to enhance data collection procedures
Implement databases and systems to optimize the efficiency and quality of data analysis
Stay at the forefront of industry and technology trends to ensure effective data handling and presentation




Your profile

Power BI expert
3-7 years experience in the BI areas
Expert in Design thinking methodology
Good communication skills (English proficiency is a must)
Experienced to work in agile teams (Scrum / Kanban)
Logic-, Powe-App and Power Automate is a plus
Strong competency in Microsoft Azure, including Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Data Warehouse / Lakehouse, Power BI, Power Automate, Power App and Logic App, Data Quality and other Azure services
Expert with Power BI creating dynamic dashboards meaningful reports telling a data story by producing end products and good user experience
Deep understanding with data modelling, SQL, DAX, Python and other programming languages including data warehousing principals
Excellent analytics skills with the ability to collect, analyse, organize and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization







What we offer

We offer a modern workplace, an entrepreneurial culture with room for innovation and a hybrid work model. Collaboration, Empowerment and Responsibilities are key values we live on a day-to-day basis. You will be part of a hands-on culture where you really can make an impact. We place mutual trust at the forefront of our collaboration and path to growth.




Note that we will only consider applicants eligible to work in Switzerland.




In case of questions, please contact us via email: careers@msreinsurance.com




MS Reinsurance is the market-facing brand of the risk carrying legal entity MS Amlin AG, a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland and operating in Bermuda as MS Amlin AG, Bermuda Branch, in the United States through MS Amlin Reinsurance Managers, Inc, and in Labuan, Malaysia as MS Amlin AG, Labuan Branch.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ALTEN Group

Within 30 years, ALTEN has become leader in both outsourced Engineering and IT Enterprise Services. ALTEN, composed of 54,000 employees (88% engineers), carries out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of 6,500 clients, the most prestigious companies in all sectors of industry, services and telecommunications. We work with key actors in the Aeronautics & Space, Defence & Naval, Security, Automotive, Rail, Energy, Life Sciences, Finance, Retail, Telecommunications and Services sectors.

ALTEN Switzerland

Since 2005, with 450 current employees, ALTEN Switzerland is a reference partner in providing Engineering services to 100 world leading companies. ALTEN Switzerland‚Äôs activities cover all the main strategical areas of the Swiss market in Life Sciences, Engineering & IT Services.

Main responsibilities

Design, implement, and maintain robust ETL pipelines using AWS services (Glue, Lambda, Step Functions) and Snowflake, focusing on transforming and loading data from various sources into fact and dimension tables.
Develop and optimize complex SQL queries for data transformation and analysis in both AWS Athena and Snowflake, with a strong emphasis on star and snowflake schema implementations.
Create and maintain data models, ensuring proper implementation of fact and dimension tables to support business intelligence and reporting needs.
Build and manage scalable data ingestion pipelines in AWS Data Lake, including setting up Lake Formation for cross-account data sharing.
Implement data quality checks and alert mechanisms based on defined business rules using AWS services and custom solutions.
Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like AWS CloudFormation or Terraform to provision and manage AWS resources.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, versioning, and deployment of data solutions.
Ensure data privacy, compliance, and security throughout the solution lifecycle, including proper configuration of AWS IAM and Lake Formation.
Monitor data pipelines and infrastructure using AWS CloudWatch and other relevant tools.

Main requirements

Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a technical field
5+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role
Strong knowledge of AWS services, particularly in the context of data processing (e.g. Lambda, Step Functions, S3, Athena, Glue, Lake Formation, CloudFormation)
You have advanced SQL skills, capable of writing complex queries for data transformation and analysis.
Proficiency in Python
Experience with mainstream data integration/ ETL platforms
Experience with CI/CD tools and general DevOps practices

What we offer you

At Alten, we offer you the security of a permanent contract while also giving you the liberty to work with multiple prestigious clients. With the luxury of having a wide range of offices around the world, we are in a unique position to provide you with the freedom to experience national and international business opportunities. Thus, we function in a highly innovative market, always being up to date with the latest technologies and making you a pioneer in your field.

Therefore, we offer our employees sought-after trainings and workshops ranging from hard to soft skills and providing you with certificates that will further increase your qualifications, enabling you to participate in ground-breaking projects.

Apply now and be a part of our amazing journey. We believe in growing together!

  • Design, implement, and maintain robust ETL pipelines using AWS services (Glue, Lambda, Step Functions) and Snowflake, focusing on transforming and loading data from various sources into fact and dimension tables.
  • Develop and optimize complex SQL queries for data transformation and analysis in both AWS Athena and Snowflake, with a strong emphasis on star and snowflake schema implementations.
  • Create and maintain data models, ensuring proper implementation of fact and dimension tables to support business intelligence and reporting needs.
  • Build and manage scalable data ingestion pipelines in AWS Data Lake, including setting up Lake Formation for cross-account data sharing.
  • Implement data quality checks and alert mechanisms based on defined business rules using AWS services and custom solutions.
  • Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like AWS CloudFormation or Terraform to provision and manage AWS resources.
  • Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines for automated testing, versioning, and deployment of data solutions.
  • Ensure data privacy, compliance, and security throughout the solution lifecycle, including proper configuration of AWS IAM and Lake Formation.
  • Monitor data pipelines and infrastructure using AWS CloudWatch and other relevant tools.

Main requirements

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a technical field
  • 5+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role
  • Strong knowledge of AWS services, particularly in the context of data processing (e.g. Lambda, Step Functions, S3, Athena, Glue, Lake Formation, CloudFormation)
  • You have advanced SQL skills, capable of writing complex queries for data transformation and analysis.
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Experience with mainstream data integration/ ETL platforms
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and general DevOps practices

What we offer you

At Alten, we offer you the security of a permanent contract while also giving you the liberty to work with multiple prestigious clients. With the luxury of having a wide range of offices around the world, we are in a unique position to provide you with the freedom to experience national and international business opportunities. Thus, we function in a highly innovative market, always being up to date with the latest technologies and making you a pioneer in your field.

Therefore, we offer our employees sought-after trainings and workshops ranging from hard to soft skills and providing you with certificates that will further increase your qualifications, enabling you to participate in ground-breaking projects.

Apply now and be a part of our amazing journey. We believe in growing together!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Experis is a globally leading provider of personalized recruitment solutions and IT specialists.

For our client, we are looking for a committed and experienced Data Engineer (m/f/d) to strengthen the team in Zurich. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop innovative digital solutions that enhance the performance and sustainability of our client's operations.

Start: ASAP or by agreement

Contract type: Permanent position

Location: Zurich

Work model: Hybrid (Home office by agreement)

Workload: 80-100%

Responsibilities

Design and Development: You will design and develop customized digital platform components that optimize the operational processes of our clients.
Monitor Machine Fleets: Participate in our industry segment team to implement advanced tools and analytical models, mainly in the backend.
Promote Innovation: Contribute creative ideas and push the boundaries of our business.

Requirements:

Technical Excellence: Proven experience in building highly available, scalable, and cost-efficient software systems.
Programming Skills: Strong knowledge of Java or Python; experience with Scala and reactive programming is a plus.
Platform Expertise: At least 3 years of experience with microservices, distributed systems, messaging brokers, and event processing (Apache Spark, Flink, or Beam).
Cloud and Container Technologies: Solid understanding of cloud environments (ideally AWS) and containerized technologies like Kubernetes.
Database Knowledge: Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases.
Tech Enthusiast: Passion for new technologies, especially in the area of turbomachinery.
Agile Mindset: Experience in test-driven development environments and international collaboration.
Language Skills: Fluent in English; basic German skills for effective collaboration.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens, or current holders of a valid Swiss work permit.

Our client offers you the opportunity to work in an exciting and forward-looking environment, continuously developing your skills. If you feel addressed and meet the required qualifications, we look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Finance Process & Data Analyst
Description:
Be part of an exciting journey by supporting Richemont International SA (RISA) Finance, based in Fribourg, in our transformation into a more standardized, automated, and data-driven department.

As a member of the RISA Finance Digital Transformation team, you will act as an internal consultant to lead automation and process improvement initiatives across various teams within RISA Finance (Accounting, Financial Planning, Treasury, and ICS).

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

PROCESS


Gather, validate, and document business requirements
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation
Support business transition and drive change management (working closely with end users)
Manage projects according to set requirements, milestones and deadlines
Engage with key stakeholders (technical and non-technical) at every stage of an initiative
Deliver presentations and project walkthroughs to a wide-ranging audience composed of various levels of seniority in the organization


TOOLS


Identify most suitable technical solution for each use case
Implement and coordinate implementation of solutions using selected tools
Design to-be solutions, perform testing and coordinate go-live activities
Ensure proper documentation, maintenance, and continuous improvement of existing products (i.e., Chatbot, Power Automate flows, Power BI dashboards)


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Mandatory


You hold a university degree in business, finance, computer science or similar
You bring a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience in an international environment
You have experience with agile project management
You are hands on with low-code automation tools (i.e., Power Apps, UiPath, Celonis or similar)
You speak English and French fluently
You have a strategic mindset, capable of presenting findings and recommendations
You are a good team player
You are curious, open minded and like to independently search for an innovative solutions


Desirable


Experience in database management
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or any other programming language
Understanding of the basic financial concepts (i.e., Purchase to Pay)
Experience in using SAP (or any other ERP solution) or Anaplan
Experience in developing BI solutions (using Power BI, Tableau, Looker or similar)


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.


We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity
We care for the world we live in


Your Journey With Us

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will provide an answer promptly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will then be a face-to-face interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

Title: Data Analyst - Metals Sector
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.







Responsibilities

Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage, including.
Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager. Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.




Qualification

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, Materials Science and engineering or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field.
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills in Python.
Basic modeling skill.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.




The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.




Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Z√ºrich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.




Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.




Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database‚Äîa comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.




Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date




Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.
