Title: Junior Linux Kernel Engineer - Ubuntu
Description:
Every year we select new junior professionals into the Canonical kernel team, to work on the Linux kernel for Ubuntu. If you've enjoyed operating systems in your coursework or current role, you are confident in your ability to write high quality C and possibly Rust, and are ready to take the plunge and see how it all works, then this would be a great place to pursue your next career stage. We are a global team working to ship the world's most widely used Linux kernel, across the very latest silicon and cloud, where you can apply and grow your software engineering skills.

The Canonical Kernel Team builds and maintains all supported Ubuntu Linux kernels for a variety of platforms and architectures from small embedded devices to standard desktop/server systems to large-scale cloud environments. In your first year you will tackle serious initiatives, which include but are not limited to:


Optimized solutions for key Silicon and Cloud partner platforms
Developer platforms such as Raspberry Pi and RISC-V
Enabling Ubuntu on a wide range of embedded systems
Security hardening and exploit mitigation
Third-party driver integration and distribution, such as graphics
Expanded driver support for bleeding-edge PC platforms


We select candidates that are recent university graduates or early career professionals who are enthusiastic to develop kernel-level software in multiple areas including security updates, patching, and testing. The successful candidate will have a background in software engineering, be motivated to work in a distributed team and willing and able to travel globally twice a year for company engineering events.

These are full-time positions available to prospective or recently graduated students.

Location: We have home-based kernel teams in every timezone.

What your day will look like


Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team
Learn from senior mentors to demystify the inner workings of the Linux kernel and how it is distributed
Work closely with external silicon, cloud, or hardware manufacturer delivery teams on bleeding-edge platforms
Diagnose and resolve issues in the kernel reported by customers, the community, and discovered by your own rigorous testing
Take personal responsibility for the delivery of various flavors of the Ubuntu Linux kernel
Improve tooling and automation for delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels
Submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers


What we are looking for in you


Well-organized and motivated self-starter able to thrive in a remote work environment
Professional manner with colleagues, business partners, and the open-source community
Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
Programming experience in C and/or Rust
Familiarity with version control practices, ideally with git
Understanding of operating system kernel fundamentals
Ability to travel twice a year for company events of up to two weeks length


Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring


Interest and experience in Rust
Python and Bash scripting ability
Prior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging
Demonstrated experience with kernel patching and debugging
Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineering


What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Home-based work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Every year we select new junior professionals into the Canonical kernel team, to work on the Linux kernel for Ubuntu. If you've enjoyed operating systems in your coursework or current role, you are confident in your ability to write high quality C and possibly Rust, and are ready to take the plunge and see how it all works, then this would be a great place to pursue your next career stage. We are a global team working to ship the world's most widely used Linux kernel, across the very latest silicon and cloud, where you can apply and grow your software engineering skills.

The Canonical Kernel Team builds and maintains all supported Ubuntu Linux kernels for a variety of platforms and architectures from small embedded devices to standard desktop/server systems to large-scale cloud environments. In your first year you will tackle serious initiatives, which include but are not limited to:

  • Optimized solutions for key Silicon and Cloud partner platforms
  • Developer platforms such as Raspberry Pi and RISC-V
  • Enabling Ubuntu on a wide range of embedded systems
  • Security hardening and exploit mitigation
  • Third-party driver integration and distribution, such as graphics
  • Expanded driver support for bleeding-edge PC platforms

We select candidates that are recent university graduates or early career professionals who are enthusiastic to develop kernel-level software in multiple areas including security updates, patching, and testing. The successful candidate will have a background in software engineering, be motivated to work in a distributed team and willing and able to travel globally twice a year for company engineering events.

These are full-time positions available to prospective or recently graduated students.

Location: We have home-based kernel teams in every timezone.

What your day will look like

  • Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team
  • Learn from senior mentors to demystify the inner workings of the Linux kernel and how it is distributed
  • Work closely with external silicon, cloud, or hardware manufacturer delivery teams on bleeding-edge platforms
  • Diagnose and resolve issues in the kernel reported by customers, the community, and discovered by your own rigorous testing
  • Take personal responsibility for the delivery of various flavors of the Ubuntu Linux kernel
  • Improve tooling and automation for delivery and test of Ubuntu Linux kernels
  • Submit, review, and apply kernel patches, working with both internal and external upstream maintainers

What we are looking for in you

  • Well-organized and motivated self-starter able to thrive in a remote work environment
  • Professional manner with colleagues, business partners, and the open-source community
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
  • Programming experience in C and/or Rust
  • Familiarity with version control practices, ideally with git
  • Understanding of operating system kernel fundamentals
  • Ability to travel twice a year for company events of up to two weeks length

Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring

  • Interest and experience in Rust
  • Python and Bash scripting ability
  • Prior experience with Ubuntu/Debian/Snap packaging
  • Demonstrated experience with kernel patching and debugging
  • Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineering

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Home-based work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Construction Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

JOB DESCRIPTION

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better. With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition. Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do. If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you. We are currently seeking a Construction Data Scientist, reporting directly to the Global Construction Data Innovation Manager in Rome to join our Construction Data Science team based in Paris (France) and Rome (Italy).

About The Job

The Global Construction Data Innovation (GCDI) is part of Global Construction, within Delivery Excellence division, and aims to develop and improve digital solutions, data science solutions (data analytics and AI), data accessibility and bi reporting for better estimating, preparing & controlling construction activities with the target to optimize construction resources, costs & duration.

The Construction Data Scientist will be part of the Construction Data Science team.

He/She will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and a creative mind. While mining and interpreting, and cleaning T.EN data, this person will be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the data‚Äôs full potential.

He/She will support projects all around the globe to use their data as best as possible to create value and improve the management at site.

He/She will work on data produced from past construction projects for identifying benchmarking and construction patterns to optimize construction execution.

He/She will produce digital solutions to make construction management taking data driven decisions.

He/She will be at the interface between site teams, CMC teams, Data Office teams and IDS teams.

He/She will be part of the CMC team and will strive to continuously improve the performance of construction at site.

Construction Data Scientist will be performing the following task:


Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights to help solve problems across various domains and industries.
Analyze data to identify patterns and trends to deliver recommendations for the future.
Visualization: develop data visualization and storytelling solutions.
Business Understanding: collaborate with businesses to understand their needs and identify use cases to develop.
IT understanding: collaborate with IT and Data Office for understanding the data frame where develop, deploy, and run digital and data science products.
Data Understanding: analyze data for exploring data characteristics and their alignment with business use case.
Data Preparation: interact with Data Engineering to set up the data sources and all steps of dataset preparation.
Modelling & Validation: develop modelling methodology, features engineering, implement model, follow up model training and its validation, and definition of efficient model to deploy.
Monitoring: monitoring and fine tuning of the model developed
Deployment: interact with IT and Data Office for deployment and industrialization of data science and digital solutions developed
Communicate findings to all stakeholders.
Prepare and deliver documentation, training and webinar about data science.
Staying up to date with the latest advancements in AI and scripting language.



We offer you not only a job, but an inspiring journey in a truly global environment where you team up to break down boundaries thanks to the innovation, creativity and pioneer spirit which drive our people.

About You

We‚Äôd love to hear from you if your profile meets the following essential requirements:

Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering (preference for IT and mechanical engineering), or Computer Science or Mathematical



Languages: English fluent

Main Skills:


Analytical thinking for translating data into descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics and products.
Story telling mindset.
Very good communication skills to identify the business requirements and to expose findings to all stakeholders.
Able to interface with IT and Data Office for understanding the data framework of data science projects.
Able to associate more efficient Machine Learning models to a specific business use case.
Able to identify algorithm metrics and monitoring system.
Data science curious, open mind and updated to data science state of art.
Ability to think creatively and strategically with excellent problem-solving skills..
Able to manage more than one activity at the same time.
Attitude to perform the work in team, in an international and multi-cultural environment.
Ability to fulfil tasks on time with the required Company quality level
Able to work and deliver in an incremental approach
Availability to international mobility either for short- or long-term assignment



Technical Competencies:


Knowledge of data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
Knowledge of SQL (from a data scientist perspective, not necessarily dev or data engineering)
Knowledge of Scripting Language (e.g., Python, R, Julia) and data science libraries
Knowledge of main Machine Learning models (supervised and unsupervised)
Knowledge of data pipelines, cleansing and data preparation
Knowledge of Statistical computing package (e.g, R) is a plus
Knowledge of NLP, LLM is a plus
Knowledge of Agile, Git, DevOps and MLOps is a plus
Knowledge of BI and visualization tools (e.g, PowerBI) is a plus
Knowledge of Dataiku and Synapse are a plus



Knowledge of Construction work processes is a plus

Inclusion Standards

In our continuous journey to developing and building culture of inclusion, we adhere to four Inclusion Gold Standards. And you?


We challenge our biases and embrace diversity of thought ;
No one has all the knowledge and solutions, collectively we do ;
We foster a caring environment where people are respected, comfortable to share and be heard ;
We promote active listening for effective decision and action.



What‚Äôs Next?

Starting Date:

Once receiving your system application, Recruiting Team will screen and match your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements. We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe. Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application.

Forecast Starting Date: Asap by 2024

Position located to: Rome OC, Italy

We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram , Facebook , Twitter , Youtube for company updates.

Title: Cloud Engineer
Description:
The Cloud Engineer is hands-on and primarily responsible for managing and maintaining the Local cloud environments for the local customer. Specifically, this role collaborates closely with IT, Software Engineering, and Product teams to understand needs and requirements before translating them into action - from design and documentation, to monitoring and support. As well the role will be aligned and will collaborate with a Cloud global service of the Kuba group

For existing solutions, the Cloud Engineer monitors environments to identify and implement enhancements or improvements as technologies, standards, and best-practices evolve.

This role requires staying current on the latest industry technology and standards, and maintaining an intimate familiarity with the company's obligations for security, data handling, and risk management.

Responsibilities:

Maintain technical expertise in AWS and Oracle cloud and related technologies

Develop, implement, and support secure solutions in accordance with best practices, participating in all aspects of the software development lifecycle

Monitor the cloud environment for efficient operation, enhancing and improving as needed

Identify, analyse, and resolve infrastructure or configuration vulnerabilities

Troubleshoot incidents, identify root causes, fix and document solutions, and implement preventive measures

Own backup, restoration, and recovery/failover processes

Conduct regular reviews of cloud environments for monthly / quarterly audit, making recommendations for improvements, and participating in Security Risk Assessments

Suggest improvements for existing cloud infrastructure, and lead any modernization efforts that may be required

Demonstrate problem-solving skills, with an ability to see and resolve issues before they impact productivity

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or related field of study, or equivalent in education and work experience.

Cloud certifications strongly preferred (Solutions Architect, Advanced Networking, Security)

1+ years of experience as an Cloud Engineer or comparable, bearing responsibility for a production environment

Demonstrable experience setting up, configuring, and maintaining VPCs and associated networking infrastructure

Experience working with and managing Windows and Linux server operating systems in a production environment

experience with automation and scripting (PowerShell, Python, Terraform, etc)

Problem-solving and empirical skills

Ability to work collaboratively with IT, software engineering, and product teams

Good communication and documentation skills

Self-starting, team oriented, and able to set and prioritize tasks independently

Familiarity with Microsoft .NET and other web languages, Containers (EKS/ECR) is a plus

Benefits

Salary commensurate with the position

Ticket Restaurant

Healthcare insurance

Training and Development

Cloud System Engineer

Title: Business Analyst & Controlling
Description:
Bulgari SPA within it's Business Controlling Department based in Rome, is looking for a Business Analyst and Controlling to actively and constantly support the company in setting and achieving the business goals, steering the planning process, monitoring the business and the organization performance, providing constructive feedback and corrective actions through an effective reporting system and in close relationship with all business functions.




Main accountabilities:




Support the definition of 3YP projections, yearly budget and its relevant revisions.
Act as a Business Partner for Sales & Retail VP, CMO and related central and local teams.
Perform Profit & Loss monthly analysis, with focus on overall Revenue and Advertising & Promotion spending, together with the Holding and Commercial legal entities costs.
Regularly perform Profitability Analysis by Area of Responsibility and by Store.
Perform A&P spending analysis by project providing the relevant stakeholders with a clear understanding of the spending and related ROI both through recommendation approval process and actual monitoring.
Highlight main variation vs Budget/Revisions and vs PY and propose indicated actions to ensure achievement of targets and support decision making.
Provide adequate documentation to the External Auditors during statutory closures.
Contribute to the implementation of standard reporting methodologies and business performance analysis, ensuring consistent information.
Manage controlling dimensions (Cost Centers, Profit Centers, Marketing Initiatives, Area of Responsibilities,‚Ä¶) to ensure effective analysis.




Qualifications:

At least 3 years of relevant experience controlling
Extensive product knowledge of luxury brands in local market, and specific knowledge in Jewelry and watch is a plus
Budget and reporting techniques
Accounting principles and procedures
IT Applications (Office, etc)
Business Awareness and Agility, Entrepreneurial spirit




Apply on our website with an English version of your CV.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ATON IT eroga consulenza altamente qualificata in ambito ICT. La comunit√† di specialisti presente in azienda √® il nostro punto di forza ed in virt√π di ci√≤, ATON IT ricerca costantemente i migliori professionisti nell'ottica dello spirito di ampliamento della propria squadra e dell‚Äôinnovazione continua, per soddisfare le richieste di un mercato in forte evoluzione.

Eccellenza, qualit√†, entusiasmo e dinamismo sono valori che caratterizzano il nostro lavoro quotidiano e ci permettono di raggiungere obiettivi sfidanti ed essere presenti con i nostri servizi su tutto il territorio nazionale attraverso le nostre di sedi di Roma, Milano, Napoli, Bari, Firenze e Terni.

Siamo alla costante ricerca di persone motivate, appassionate ed interessate a far parte di un gruppo dove ognuno potr√† contribuire attivamente al raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali.

Per la nostra sede di Roma, in particolare per la B.U. Data Analytics, stiamo cercando:

Data EngineerData Scientist

La risorsa, inserita in un team di professionisti del settore, si occuper√† di attivit√† di analisi e sviluppo di soluzioni applicative in ambito Data Analytics, verr√† coinvolta in stimolanti progetti e inserita in un percorso di carriera improntato alla crescita sia professionale che economica.

Il candidato ideale dovr√† essere in grado di svolgere le seguenti attivit√†:

Progettazione e sviluppo soluzioni AI scalabili

Ottimizzione algoritmi e modelli di Machine Learning

Gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita dei progetti AI, dal business discovery al deployment

Implementazione pipeline di dati efficienti

Collaborazione con il team di Data Science per industrializzare i modelli

Title: Salesforce Developer
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Salesforce Developer!

NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, √® tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicit√†, talento ed attitudine. Responsibilities

Lavoriamo in Italia e/o all‚Äôestero per grandi aziende appartenenti ai principali settori di mercato, tra cui Telco, Media, Energy&Utilities, Manufacturing in contesti di lavoro tecnologicamente avanzati e stimolanti, farai parte di team ben strutturati e a contatto con figure esperte che accelereranno il tuo percorso di crescita professionale in un'ottica di formazione e sviluppo costante.

Il Vero Motore Di NTT DATA Sono Le Persone, Ognuna Con La Propria Unicit√†, Talento Ed Attitudine. Qual √® La Tua? Raccontacelo e Potrai Essere Coinvolto Nelle Seguenti Attivit√†


Guidare i clienti nella definizione di soluzioni Salesforce aderenti alle loro esigenze, partecipando alla loro trasformazione digitale e/o profonda innovazione

Supportare il team di Analisti Funzionali e/o di Processo nella Gap Analysis
Implementare e distribuire nuove funzionalit√† e sviluppare integrazioni con altri sistemi, partecipando a progetti con metodologia Agile, Ibrida o Waterfall.
Supportare i Project Manager nella stima e pianificazione delle attivit√† di progetto
Completare le tue competenze su Salesforce con un mirato piano di certificazione
Curare la crescita professionale delle risorse meno esperte



Required Skills

Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nello sviluppo di progetti di CRM basati su piattaforma Salesforce sulle seguenti attivit√†:


Configurazione della piattaforma
Sviluppo di classi Apex, di Visualforce, di Lightning Component ed integrazione con altre applicazioni in modalit√† Real-Time, Batch, Sync/Async
Redazione di documentazione tecnica
Supporto al Configuration Management e alla gestione dei deploy
Supporto all‚Äôapplication maintenance e gestione bug-fixing
Trasformazione di requisiti di business in funzionalit√† Salesforce



E‚Äô richiesta la certificazione Salesforce Platform Developer I oppure la certificazione Salesforce Administrator.

Completano Il Profilo


Ulteriori certificazioni Salesforce relative ai percorsi Administrator, Developer o Consultant come, per esempio, Platform Developer II, Platform App Builder, Advance Administrator, Marketing Cloud Developer, Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant, Field Service Consultant e/o di ulteriori app Salesforce
Conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione ad oggetti Java/J2EE e/o sviluppo Front End (Javascript, HTML, CSS) e/o dei principali framework di front-end (Jquery, Bootstrap, AngularJS)
Esperienze in progetti gestiti in modalit√† Agile (preferibilmente Scrum) con coordinamento di team di lavoro e/o stream progettuali
Esperienze pregresse di Gap Analisys e/o di verifica Fattibilit√† tecnica e relativa stima dell‚Äôeffort necessario per eseguire le attivit√† di sviluppo
Ottime capacit√† relazionali e di comunicazione, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla gestione delle risorse
Ottime capacit√† analitiche ed organizzative ed orientamento al risultato
Atteggiamento positivo, spirito di iniziativa e flessibilit√†
Predisposizione al lavoro in team
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia parlata che scritta



Location

I nostri uffici si trovano a Milano, Roma, Torino, Napoli, Cosenza, Genova, Treviso, Pisa, Bari, Bologna e Salerno e sono stati rinnovati per migliorare l‚Äôesperienza di lavoro in sede.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.




To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.




For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.




A few examples of your responsibilities

Analyze and pull insights from vast amounts of data, spotting high-value opportunities to improve our decision-making.
Design, build, and maintain databases and automated data processes, leveraging internal Python libraries and Google BigQuery, with a focus on clarity, consistency, and accuracy of data across various platforms and systems.
Bring polished data to the final decision-makers, building pipelines and dashboards that offer insights into the performance of products, marketing campaigns, and more.
Collaborate closely with our engineering and data science teams to ensure data reliability, scalability, and accuracy.
Stay informed of industry trends and technologies, and actively participate in the formulation of best practices and standards.




What we look for

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.




Commitment & contract

Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.




Location

Milan (Italy) or fully remote.




Before you apply

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.




The selection process

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.




Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Cloud Data Engineer

Quale sar√† la tua sfida? 

Entra a far parte di BIP ‚Äì xTech, il Centro di Eccellenza di BIP specializzato in consulenza e servizi innovativi in ambito Big Data, Data Science, RPA, Cloud, Blockchain e Networking.

Sarai responsabile di operare su Data Platform Big Data o ibride, on-premises o cloud, implementando pipeline di lavorazione batch o real time, trasformazione e trattamento di dati strutturati e non strutturati.

Dovrai essere autonomo/a nelle fasi di acquisizione, storicizzazione, cleansing, anonimizzazione/crypting/masking dei dati, trattamento dei valori nulli e outlier, aggregazione, strutturazione di dati non strutturati, creazione di KPI di quality, preparazione dati per diversi utenti tra cui:

  • i e le Data Scientist che utilizzeranno i dataset per l‚Äôelaborazione di modelli di Machine Learning
  • gli strumenti di Data Visualization e Business Intelligence
  • l‚Äôalimentazione di strutture relazionali (es. DWH) e non (es. Graph DB, NoSQL)
  • applicativi esterni in logica API (es. REST API)


Sarai inoltre responsabile di recepire i modelli di Machine Learning dai Data Scientist, ottimizzarli in logica di esecuzione in scala, ad esempio applicando parallelismi di calcolo, e integrarli / schedularli per un‚Äôesecuzione automatica efficiente.

Lavorerai con diverse tecnologie, scelte in base allo specifico progetto e Cliente, prediligendo architetture cloud native e globalmente scalabili. Sarai un esperto o un'esperta in costante evoluzione in grado di selezionare le tecnologie pi√π adatte per l‚Äôimplementazione di pipeline complesse, massimizzando il riuso, la qualit√†, l‚Äôefficienza e la performance, la documentazione e l‚Äôordine.

Sarai spesso chiamato/a a fornire Advisory per selezionare tecnologie di Engineering all‚Äôinterno di nascenti architetture Big Data o per efficientare ecosistemi gi√† attivi con problematiche di ordine, qualit√†, riuso, strutturazione.

Ti sar√† richiesto, in modo commisurato alla tua seniority, di dimostrare ed evolvere le capacit√† di costruire relazioni con clienti, vendor, partner, e assicurare sempre il raggiungimento della migliore soluzione in accordo con le esigenze e i requisiti condivisi assieme al Cliente.

Oltre alle progettualit√†, ai/alle Data Engineer sar√† richiesto un contributo attivo per alimentare la Community con attivit√† di ricerca, scouting, concept di nuove soluzioni e business development.

Sarai tu ad entrare nel nostro Team?

  • Conoscenza di uno o pi√π linguaggi di programmazione e interrogazione dati (es. SQL, Java, Ruby, Python, R‚Ä¶)
  • Conoscenza approfondita di una o pi√π tecnologie per gestione di basi dati strutturate e non strutturate (es. Bigquery, MongoDB, Hadoop, Redis, ecc‚Ä¶)

E‚Äô gradito il possesso di una o pi√π delle seguenti certificazioni o equivalenti:

  • Google Professional Data Engineer
  • Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure

Title: Linux Cryptography and Security Engineer
Description:
This is a unique opportunity to use your software engineering and cryptography skills to build and maintain the security foundation that enables Ubuntu and its users to operate securely and remain compliant to international information security standards such as FIPS 140-3 and Common Criteria. You will use your applied cryptography, Linux Security, and coding skills to enhance the Ubuntu distribution and work with organizations such as DISA and CIS to draft and implement security hardening benchmarks for Ubuntu.

As a member of the Security Hardening team you will work with and develop automation tooling to audit deployed systems for DISA-STIG and CIS benchmark compliance. You will interact with internal and external stakeholders to identify gaps in our frameworks, and develop new solutions to address these challenges. In this role you will have the opportunity to influence team and security culture, facilitate technical delivery, and help drive team direction and execution. You'll collaborate closely with Canonical's kernel team as well as the wider engineering organization to drive features impacting all Ubuntu users.

Day-to-day responsibilities


Collaborate with other engineers in the Security Hardening team to achieve and retain various Security certifications
Extend and enhance Linux cryptographic components (OpenSSL, Libgcrypt, GnuTLS, and others) with the features and functionality required for FIPS and CC certification
Collaborate with external security consultants to test and validate kernel and crypto module components
Work with external partners to develop security hardening benchmarks and audit + remediation automation for Ubuntu
Contribute to Ubuntu mainline and upstream projects to land solutions and benefit the community
Communication and collaboration within and outside Canonical to identify opportunities to improve our security posture, rapidly resolve issues, and deliver high-quality solutions on schedule


What we are looking for in you


Hands-on experience with low-level Linux cryptography APIs and debugging
Excellent software engineering fundamentals, including prior experience with C development, and the ability to demonstrate such
Hands-on experience with Linux system administration and shell scripting
Demonstrated knowledge of security and cryptography fundamentals + direct experience writing secure code and implementing best practices
Significant development experience working with open source libraries
Excellent verbal and written communications to enable efficient collaboration with internal and external partners in a remote-first environment


Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring


Prior experience working on FIPS/Common Criteria certified products and in-depth knowledge of the underlying standards
Prior experience working directly with DISA-STIG or CIS benchmarks, including related audit + remediation tooling (e.g. Compliance as Code)
Experience working directly with Linux Kernel
Prior experience with Python, OVAL (Open Vulnerability Assessment Language), and Ansible
History of contributions to open source projects


What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: .net Back Office Net Developer
Description:
KUBA is an innovative company committed to providing modern and efficient ticketing solutions for its customers. We are looking for a .NET Back Office Developer to join our dynamic team in the Engineering department in Rome

We are looking for a passionate and qualified C# .NET Developer to join our team. The position will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining high-quality software applications, participating in all phases of the development life cycle of internal and external projects: software design, development, and traceability processes, which span from requirements gathering through development, code reviewing, testing and releasing. You will collaborate with a diverse and multicultural team, contributing to an environment that values innovation and high standards.

Key Responsibilities:


Participate in requirements analysis
Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages
Test and deploy applications and systems
Revise, update, refactor and debug code
Improve existing software
Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support



Requirements

Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
1-2 years of experience experience as a .NET Developer or Application Developer
Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC))
Knowledge of at least one of the .NET languages (e.g. C#, Visual Basic .NET) and HTML5/CSS3
Familiarity with architecture styles/APIs (REST, RPC)
Understanding of Agile methodologies
Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills
Attention to details
Ability to work independently and be proactive
Good written and oral communication skills, with a working level of English (B2 or equivalent)
Ability to analyse complex problems and find effective solutions
Teamwork and collaboration with other departments



Benefits

Salary commensurate with the position

Ticket Restaurant

Healthcare insurance

Training and Development

Title: Business Developer - Energy
Description:
Company Description

Il nostro Cliente, specializzato in attivit√† di produzione di elettricit√†, sviluppa e investe in progetti di energia rinnovabile da oltre 15 anni. E' un azienda che mantiene una traiettoria di crescita sostenibile e continua.

Position

La Risorsa Avr√† Le Seguenti Responsabilit√†


Sviluppare ed eseguire strategie di vendita per accrescere la presenza di mercato del gruppo nella vendita dei sistemi BESS in Italia.
Gestire ed espandere il portafoglio clienti, includendo l'identificazione e lo sviluppo di nuove opportunit√† di business.
Mantenere relazioni solide con i clienti esistenti e potenziali, offrendo soluzioni personalizzate e un servizio di alta qualit√†.
Collaborare con altri reparti per garantire coerenza nella strategia di mercato e nell'approccio al cliente.
Mantenersi aggiornati sulle tendenze del mercato e sulle innovazioni nel settore dell'energia rinnovabile.


Requirements

Il/la Candidato/a ideale possiede i seguenti requisiti:


Laurea in Economia, Marketing, Ingegneria o campi correlati.
Almeno 1 anno di esperienza nel settore delle Rinnovabili e/o nella componentistica industriale.
Abilit√† di comunicazione efficace e buona attitudine alla leadership.
Capacit√† di lavorare sia in modo indipendente che in team.
Conoscenza fluente dell'inglese (B2 o superiore); la conoscenza della lingua spagnola sar√† considerata un plus.
Disponibilit√† a viaggiare all'interno dell'Italia e occasionalmente a livello internazionale.
La conoscenza dei sistemi BESS C&I e delle dinamiche Utility Scale saranno elementi preferenziali ai fini della selezione.

Next Steps

nti scelgono di¬†lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

Title: Senior CSV Engineer
Description:
Stiamo ricercando un profilo di: Computer Sistem Validation Engineer, preferibilmente locato nella Provincia di Roma.

Summary:‚ÄØ This position uses policies and procedures to validate/qualify computer systems, including process automation systems, IS applications/infrastructure, and enterprise systems. Plans, coordinates, and participates in a compliant validation process for quality information technology and automation systems which require formal validation documentation under appropriate regulatory requirements and company manufacturing standards.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Prepares/reviews validation documentation related to projects/change controls.

Manages change controls and other compliance related tasks e.g. non-conformances.

Participates in the review of current and future CSV procedures and polices

Analyses the results of testing and determines the acceptability of results against predetermined criteria.

Investigates and troubleshoots problems which occur and determines solutions or recommendations for changes and/or improvements.

Manages projects and prepares status reports using Microsoft project and other communication tools.

Demonstrated ability with information technology delivery for regulated businesses highly desirable, specifically in supporting IT delivery or transition in manufacturing or integrations. Leadership experience in a matrixed environment preferred.

Ability to balance the long-term ("big picture") and short-term implications of individual decisions

Experience in delivery of successful enterprise level IT programs

Other Requirements

Excellent oral and written communication skills in English/Fluent in English

Able to travel domestically and internationally as required

Title: Security Engineer - Ubuntu
Description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join an industry leading software security team, and help protect the open source community and Ubuntu users from emerging threats. Canonical is building a team to provide security coverage across a wide range of different ecosystems and environments, and work to make the world a better, safer place.

As part of the Ubuntu team, you will work with the best and brightest people in technology to monitor, triage, respond to and document new and existing vulnerabilities in open source software. The role will involve collaboration with internal teams and external partners, to identify and prioritize issues and track progress.

The role can also include a number of other activities, including security assessment and code review, internal tooling developments, community engagement, security hardening and feature development and industry collaboration participation.

This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week and requires the ability to be productive in a globally distributed team through self-discipline and self-motivation.

What you'll do


Analyze, fix, and test vulnerabilities in Ubuntu packages
Keep track of vulnerabilities in Ubuntu releases as they are discovered, researched and fixed (using internal software tools)
Collaborate with other teams in the Ubuntu community and with upstream developers where appropriate, to exchange or develop vulnerability patches and make sure that Ubuntu includes the very best security features
Audit source code for vulnerabilities


Who you are


You have a thorough understanding of the common categories of security vulnerabilities and techniques for fixing them
You are familiar with coordinated disclosure practices
You are familiar with open source development tools and methodologies
You are skilled in one or more of C, Python, go, Rust, Java, Ruby or PHP
You have excellent logic, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and decision-making skills
You can clearly and effectively communicate with the team and Ubuntu community members


We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst (ConTe International Academy)
Description:
ConTe.it √® il brand italiano del Gruppo Admiral, specializzato in servizi assicurativi semplici, digitali e convenienti.




La sua storia inizia nel 2008 a Roma, con la missione di costruire una realt√† assicurativa capace di rispondere alle esigenze degli assicurati: polizze auto a prezzi convenienti e servizio di alta qualit√†. Tutto nasce da qui, anche il nome, che vuole essere la sintesi della vicinanza, della cura e del servizio.




Da allora ConTe.it non ha smesso di crescere, arrivando a superare in Italia 1 milione di clienti e 600 dipendenti, uniti da un brand riconosciuto in tutto il Paese come campione dell'assistenza e della convenienza.




Innovazione, tecnologia e impiego avanzato e consapevole dei dati sono gli ingredienti che rendono ConTe.it una insurtech di successo con un modello organizzativo agile, flessibile e che valorizza il talento.




Chi cerchiamo?




Siamo alla ricerca di un/una brillante neolaureato/a che voglia partecipare a un progetto sfidante e che stia cercando un‚Äôopportunit√† per lasciare la propria impronta nel business.

Sarai coinvolto in un periodo di training on the job della durata di un anno, durante il quale riceverai feedback periodici attraverso un coaching dedicato.

Nel ruolo di Data Analyst, farai parte del Team Portfolio Analysis e avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di dare un contributo all‚Äôottimizzazione della selezione del rischio e alla profittabilit√† del Gruppo Admiral.




Principali responsabilit√†




Contribuire, in qualit√† di Data Analyst, all‚Äôanalisi della struttura tariffaria per supportare la Compagnia assicurativa di riferimento nella creazione di nuovi vantaggi competitivi.
Lavorare su Project Work entrando in contatto diretto con i Senior Manager delle diverse funzioni aziendali.
Conoscere in dettaglio il business del Gruppo Admiral attraverso un affiancamento strutturato.
Acquisire competenze professionali necessarie per una brillante carriera nel business assicurativo.




Must have




Eccellenti risultati accademici preferibilmente con laurea in materie economiche, scientifiche, ingegneristiche.
Inglese fluente (sia scritto che parlato).
Disponibilit√† di lavoro a tempo pieno.
Disponibilit√† alla mobilit√† internazionale.
Potenziale di crescita verso ruoli manageriali.
Completano il profilo spirito di teamwork e orientamento agli obiettivi, spiccate doti analitiche e problem solving, creativit√†, capacit√† relazionali.




Sede di lavoro: Roma (Hybrid Model)




Che cosa troverai in ConTe.it




Entrando a far parte della famiglia ConTe.it scoprirai:




Un posto dove poter essere sempre te stesso! Siamo giovani, informali e pensiamo che diversity e inclusione siano valori fondamentali da preservare ed enfatizzare.
La ferma convinzione che le Persone siano pi√π importanti dei processi; non a caso siamo da anni nelle prime posizioni della classifica Great Place to Work¬Æ Italia.
Percorsi formativi ricchi e adeguati rispetto alle tue esigenze.
Un New Way of Working all‚Äôinsegna della flessibilit√†, in una modalit√† ibrida che coniughi smart working e il piacere di incontrarci nei nostri uffici di Roma, recentemente rinnovati.
Una serie di benefits (Sconti dedicati, programmi di welfare e wellbeing) per consentire il giusto equilibrio vita-lavoro.
Un ambiente di lavoro internazionale, grazie alla collaborazione e condivisione con i nostri colleghi della famiglia Admiral che si trovano in Spagna, Francia, UK, USA, Canada e India.

Title: Business Analyst
HTML:
For expansion and staff strengthening of the Rome office, we are looking for profiles to be included in the role of Business Analyst.

People will be placed at Clients of primary importance in the Italian healthcare sector, with the constant support of senior consultants and reference managers.

Main responsibilities:

  • Analyzing, re-engineering processes and supporting the Client in the eventual governance of the implementation of Information Systems, according to industry best practices, in order to ensure proper application coverage of business processes;
  • Collection, definition and documentation of functional requirements of IT tools and technology architectures supporting business processes;
  • Drafting and execution of organizational Change Enablement plans;
  • Project Management activities and monitoring of project progress.


What you need to apply:

  • Experience in management consulting or systems integration company of 2 to 5 years;
  • Experience in information systems implementation of at least 1 year;
  • Ability to manage relationships with different types of stakeholders;
  • Strong interest in Management Consulting, business process analysis and/or Organizational Review;
  • Good knowledge of both spoken and written English.


The profile is completed by: previous experience as an applied business analyst in the field of Healthcare (e.g., control and verification of data flows of the National Health System; analysis of processes and procedures for the compilation of flows), excellent analytical and interpersonal skills, precision, organizational autonomy and a strong orientation towards team working and achievement of results.

What HSPI offers:

  • Customized training plans, including attainment of internationally recognized certifications and ongoing learning of key industry best practices (e.g., ITIL, Prince2, COBIT, 27001);
  • Challenging work environment that fosters professional growth and career paths;
  • Team placement at leading Clients;
  • Autonomy and responsibility from the moment you join the company;
  • Direct relationship with company management and end customers.


A permanent contract is offered.

#HSPI

Title: Sviluppatore Microsoft
HTML:
Sync Lab √® una Digital Innovation Company che opera come System Integrator nei mercati di riferimento del settore IT.

Si rivolge principalmente a large account in vari mercati, tra cui telco, energy, finance, insurance e utilities e con le proprie 6 sedi (Napoli, Roma, Padova, Verona, Milano e Como) √® presente in tutto il territorio nazionale. Nella propria organizzazione annovera anche laboratori e strutture di R&D che progettano e sviluppano soluzioni innovative per clienti e mercati e partecipano a progetti di respiro nazionale ed europeo.

Con un organico composto da oltre 300 risorse, siamo alla continua ricerca di giovani talenti e professionisti affermati che vogliano entrare a far parte di un‚Äôambiziosa realt√† tutta italiana.

Per ampliamento dell'organico ricerchiamo un:


Microsoft Developer


I nostri candidati ideali hanno un'esperienza maturata in ruolo analogo e nell'ambito della consulenza specialistica IT di almeno 3 anni.


Requisiti tecnici:

  • .Net v4+;
  • .Net Core v3+;
  • sviluppo di applicazioni sia on premise che su cloud Azure


Gradita la conoscenza anche base di:

  • HTML5/CSS3;
  • Bootstrap;
  • Angular v14+;
  • Angular Material


Completano il profilo:

  • Preferenziale laurea in discipline tecniche/scientifiche;
  • attitudine al team working ed ai rapporti interpersonali;
  • capacit√† di gestione dei rapporti con il Cliente;
  • Una buona conoscenza dell'inglese.


Cosa offriamo?

  • L'opportunit√† di entrare a far parte di un'azienda in fase di forte espansione;
  • Un contratto a tempo indeterminato;
  • Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo, valutato anche in base all'esperienza e alle effettive competenze.


L'attivit√† si svolger√† in modalit√† ibrida su Roma.



Gli interessati a questa posizione possono inviare il proprio CV dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all‚Äôart. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all‚Äôart. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Title: Senior Data Engineer | Milano
HTML:
Management Consulting ‚Äì Lighthouse

Milan

Do now what the world‚Äôs going to need tomorrow.

Lighthouse is a KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of solutions based on data-driven technologies. Our Lighthouse professionals use their know-how to develop solutions in various fields to provide clients with added value.

Using cutting-edge technologies and a suite of skills shared globally, our professionals on the Lighthouse data and analytics team are tasked with harnessing big data, business intelligence, data visualisation, advanced analytics, process mining and machine learning technologies to improve human decision-making.

We have received prestigious international accolades for our ability to interpret and manage data. As a member of the team, you will have the opportunity to define and implement the best solutions on the market, with access to the wealth of knowledge shared among our centres of excellence around the world. By combining your expertise and technical experience in computer science, engineering mathematics and statistics with your business knowledge and experience, you will be able to design and develop new solutions based on data analysis, presenting and sharing them professionally and competently.

We are recruiting a senior data engineer with at least two years of experience in the sector.

The ideal candidate must have:

  • a master‚Äôs (or bachelor‚Äôs) degree in computer engineering, IT or another relevant subject;
  • at least two years of experience working in enterprise information management projects (metadata management, data models, data lineage, ETL/ELT or data architecture);
  • the ability to analyse, design, develop and maintain business intelligence systems (both DWH and big data);
  • experience with RDBMS (e.g.: Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL and Postgres);
  • experience with OS environments (e.g., Linux, Unix and Windows) and shell scripting;
  • experience with the main ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, DataStage, etc.);
  • a good knowledge of English.

Expertise/experience in the following areas is preferred:

  • experience with cloud environments (e.g., Microsoft Azure) and related technological solutions;
  • knowledge of at least one of the main programming languages for the implementation of analytics solutions (e.g., Python, Java or Scala);
  • development of stored procedures (e.g., TSQL, Oracle PL/SQL);
  • knowledge of data visualisation solutions (e.g., Power BI, Qlik and Tableau);
  • knowledge of the main big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop and noSQL DB);
  • bug fixing, corrective and AMS activities.

You are a problem solver and never lose sight of your goals. You have strong interpersonal skills and are a team player. Your motivation and enthusiasm inspire confidence and empower change. You enjoy taking on challenges and are comfortable in fast-changing situations where your leadership abilities make the difference.

Title: Cloud Engineer
Description:
The Cloud Engineer is hands-on and primarily responsible for managing and maintaining the Local cloud environments for the local customer. Specifically, this role collaborates closely with IT, Software Engineering, and Product teams to understand needs and requirements before translating them into action - from design and documentation, to monitoring and support. As well the role will be aligned and will collaborate with a Cloud global service of the Kuba group

For existing solutions, the Cloud Engineer monitors environments to identify and implement enhancements or improvements as technologies, standards, and best-practices evolve.

This role requires staying current on the latest industry technology and standards, and maintaining an intimate familiarity with the company's obligations for security, data handling, and risk management.

Responsibilities:

Maintain technical expertise in AWS and Oracle cloud and related technologies

Develop, implement, and support secure solutions in accordance with best practices, participating in all aspects of the software development lifecycle

Monitor the cloud environment for efficient operation, enhancing and improving as needed

Identify, analyse, and resolve infrastructure or configuration vulnerabilities

Troubleshoot incidents, identify root causes, fix and document solutions, and implement preventive measures

Own backup, restoration, and recovery/failover processes

Conduct regular reviews of cloud environments for monthly / quarterly audit, making recommendations for improvements, and participating in Security Risk Assessments

Suggest improvements for existing cloud infrastructure, and lead any modernization efforts that may be required

Demonstrate problem-solving skills, with an ability to see and resolve issues before they impact productivity

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or related field of study, or equivalent in education and work experience.

Cloud certifications strongly preferred (Solutions Architect, Advanced Networking, Security)

1+ years of experience as an Cloud Engineer or comparable, bearing responsibility for a production environment

Demonstrable experience setting up, configuring, and maintaining VPCs and associated networking infrastructure

Experience working with and managing Windows and Linux server operating systems in a production environment

experience with automation and scripting (PowerShell, Python, Terraform, etc)

Problem-solving and empirical skills

Ability to work collaboratively with IT, software engineering, and product teams

Good communication and documentation skills

Self-starting, team oriented, and able to set and prioritize tasks independently

Familiarity with Microsoft .NET and other web languages, Containers (EKS/ECR) is a plus

Benefits

Salary commensurate with the position

Ticket Restaurant

Healthcare insurance

Training and Development

Conduct regular reviews of cloud environments for monthly / quarterly audit, making recommendations for improvements, and participating in Security Risk Assessments

Suggest improvements for existing cloud infrastructure, and lead any modernization efforts that may be required

Demonstrate problem-solving skills, with an ability to see and resolve issues before they impact productivity

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or related field of study, or equivalent in education and work experience.

Cloud certifications strongly preferred (Solutions Architect, Advanced Networking, Security)

1+ years of experience as an Cloud Engineer or comparable, bearing responsibility for a production environment

Demonstrable experience setting up, configuring, and maintaining VPCs and associated networking infrastructure

Experience working with and managing Windows and Linux server operating systems in a production environment

experience with automation and scripting (PowerShell, Python, Terraform, etc)

Problem-solving and empirical skills

Ability to work collaboratively with IT, software engineering, and product teams

Good communication and documentation skills

Self-starting, team oriented, and able to set and prioritize tasks independently

Familiarity with Microsoft .NET and other web languages, Containers (EKS/ECR) is a plus

Benefits

Salary commensurate with the position

Ticket Restaurant

Healthcare insurance

Training and Development

Title: Business Analyst & Controlling
Description:
Bulgari SPA within it's Business Controlling Department based in Rome, is looking for a Business Analyst and Controlling to actively and constantly support the company in setting and achieving the business goals, steering the planning process, monitoring the business and the organization performance, providing constructive feedback and corrective actions through an effective reporting system and in close relationship with all business functions.




Main accountabilities:




Support the definition of 3YP projections, yearly budget and its relevant revisions.
Act as a Business Partner for Sales & Retail VP, CMO and related central and local teams.
Perform Profit & Loss monthly analysis, with focus on overall Revenue and Advertising & Promotion spending, together with the Holding and Commercial legal entities costs.
Regularly perform Profitability Analysis by Area of Responsibility and by Store.
Perform A&P spending analysis by project providing the relevant stakeholders with a clear understanding of the spending and related ROI both through recommendation approval process and actual monitoring.
Highlight main variation vs Budget/Revisions and vs PY and propose indicated actions to ensure achievement of targets and support decision making.
Provide adequate documentation to the External Auditors during statutory closures.
Contribute to the implementation of standard reporting methodologies and business performance analysis, ensuring consistent information.
Manage controlling dimensions (Cost Centers, Profit Centers, Marketing Initiatives, Area of Responsibilities,‚Ä¶) to ensure effective analysis.




Qualifications:

At least 3 years of relevant experience controlling
Extensive product knowledge of luxury brands in local market, and specific knowledge in Jewelry and watch is a plus
Budget and reporting techniques
Accounting principles and procedures
IT Applications (Office, etc)
Business Awareness and Agility, Entrepreneurial spirit




Apply on our website with an English version of your CV.

Supportare il team di Analisti Funzionali e/o di Processo nella Gap Analysis
Implementare e distribuire nuove funzionalit√† e sviluppare integrazioni con altri sistemi, partecipando a progetti con metodologia Agile, Ibrida o Waterfall.
Supportare i Project Manager nella stima e pianificazione delle attivit√† di progetto
Completare le tue competenze su Salesforce con un mirato piano di certificazione
Curare la crescita professionale delle risorse meno esperte



Required Skills

Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nello sviluppo di progetti di CRM basati su piattaforma Salesforce sulle seguenti attivit√†:


Configurazione della piattaforma
Sviluppo di classi Apex, di Visualforce, di Lightning Component ed integrazione con altre applicazioni in modalit√† Real-Time, Batch, Sync/Async
Redazione di documentazione tecnica
Supporto al Configuration Management e alla gestione dei deploy
Supporto all‚Äôapplication maintenance e gestione bug-fixing
Trasformazione di requisiti di business in funzionalit√† Salesforce

Completano Il Profilo


Ulteriori certificazioni Salesforce relative ai percorsi Administrator, Developer o Consultant come, per esempio, Platform Developer II, Platform App Builder, Advance Administrator, Marketing Cloud Developer, Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant, Field Service Consultant e/o di ulteriori app Salesforce
Conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione ad oggetti Java/J2EE e/o sviluppo Front End (Javascript, HTML, CSS) e/o dei principali framework di front-end (Jquery, Bootstrap, AngularJS)
Esperienze in progetti gestiti in modalit√† Agile (preferibilmente Scrum) con coordinamento di team di lavoro e/o stream progettuali
Esperienze pregresse di Gap Analisys e/o di verifica Fattibilit√† tecnica e relativa stima dell‚Äôeffort necessario per eseguire le attivit√† di sviluppo
Ottime capacit√† relazionali e di comunicazione, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla gestione delle risorse
Ottime capacit√† analitiche ed organizzative ed orientamento al risultato
Atteggiamento positivo, spirito di iniziativa e flessibilit√†
Predisposizione al lavoro in team
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia parlata che scritta



Location

I nostri uffici si trovano a Milano, Roma, Torino, Napoli, Cosenza, Genova, Treviso, Pisa, Bari, Bologna e Salerno e sono stati rinnovati per migliorare l‚Äôesperienza di lavoro in sede.
